loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more firewood to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina has been raising hogs for 20 years. She is married and has three children. Josefina's main goal is to have a stable source of income so she can let her youngest child finish her studies.

Josefina would like to borrow additional capital in the amount of PHP 20,000, allowing her to buy hog feed and vitamins for her pigs. She believes that with this loan amount, she can ensure proper growth of her hogs and that it will enable her to earn better profits which will serve for her family necessities and the education of her youngest child. Josefina hopes and prays that her requested loan will be granted.

loans.use: to buy hog feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 44 years old, married, and has three children who are in school. Nenita is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Nenita requested a 23000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Nenita has been pig fattening for 11 years and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Nenita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Remedios requested a 20000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy stocks like soy sauce, snack foods, noodles, and eggs to sell in her general store.

Remedios has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks like soy sauce, snack foods, noodles, and eggs to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy seeds, pesticides, and fertilizers to resell at a profit

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 47 years old and single. He runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy groceries like soap, soft drinks, canned goods, sugar, etc. to sell in his general store.

George has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, George would like to save money to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy groceries like soap, canned goods, sugar, etc. to sell in his general store

loans.name: Ismatullo

texts.ru: Исматулло 37 лет. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Его жена Сафаргул работает в фермерской хозяйстве. Исматулло более 2 года работает в электро-  энергическом центре контролером. Он является одним из успешных работников, но его зарплата не хватает для обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами, а также его доход не позволяет ему проводить свадебное мероприятие своего старшего ребенка, а у таджикского народа есть определенные этапы и требования для проведения мероприятий. Он должен дать приданное для дочерей, а сыновьям дать дом для жилья. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для проведения мероприятия. Он надеется только на вас и обещает оплатить во время свой займ. Давайте поможем ему для проведения мероприятия и таким образом осчастливить его детей. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Ismatullo is 37 years old.  He is married and raising four children.  His wife, Safargul, works on a farm.  Ismatullo has been working as a controller for an electric power plant for more than two years.  Although he is a successful employee, his salary is not sufficient to provide his family with all the necessities of life.  As his children have grown up, he now needs to marry them.  However, his income does not allow him to pay for their wedding celebrations, and in Tajikistan, there are certain steps and requirements that people must follow when marrying their children.  Ismatullo must give a dowry to his daughters and he also has to provide his sons with a house to live in. 

To this end, Ismatullo is requesting a loan of 3,000 somoni.  He is entirely relying on you and promises to repay his loan on time.  Let's help him to cover the cost of his children's weddings, and also make his children happy!

Ismatullo is relying on your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for his children's wedding costs.

loans.name: Sam Oeurn

texts.en: Sam Oeurn is 54 years old. She is married and resides with six children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling fruit for more than a year, earning approximately $25 daily. Her husband is a motor taxi driver who earns about $6 each day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Sam Oeurn is requesting a loan of $1000 to raise capital for her business to buy more fruit to resell. This money will help her expand the business and earn more income for the family. In the future, she would like to fill up her land and help her children earn higher education degrees.

loans.use: to raise capital for her business to buy more fruit to resell

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Gladys works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling frozen products. Gladys is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like soap, soft drinks, spices, noodles, etc. for her general store business.

Gladys has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like soap, soft drinks, spices, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is a forty-year-old married man with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. For eight years now he has been operating a retail shop and with the proceeds he has bought land and paid school fees for his children. He also has other income sources to support his growing family and these include a video library and a hotel. Like most businessmen in a developing country, he has challenges of price fluctuation and inadequate capital to meet the vast market. His desire is to see all his children attain degrees as minimum qualification and own a wholesale shop. Julius intends to use the loan to buy sugar and rice to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar and rice to sell.

loans.name: Evelyne

texts.en: Evelyne is a thirty-eight-year-old married woman with six children of living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been running a retail business for six years. Her determination to change her life and that of her children motivated her to invest in the business and with the income earned she has been able to pay school fees for them. One of her children has now graduated. Inadequate capital to meet the high demand is her major challenge while her business plans are to own a wholesale shop and expand to new markets. Evelyne is requesting money to buy maize flour, cassava flour, beers, sugar and salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize flour, cassva flour, beers, sugar and salt to sell.

loans.name: Baasankhuu

texts.en:
Mr. Baasankhuu, 26 years old, lives with his wife in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. He previously worked in a petroleum importing company but gave up his work due to the harmful working environment in 2010. Now he provides taxi service to local residents and his wife works in social network of health care tea. 

In 2011, they bought a plot of land and built a home. But due to lacking finances, the interior part of the house is not completed and is missing a ceiling. So he is requesting the loan of 2,000,000 MNT to buy construction and insulating materials. This will enable the family to successfully complete their unfinished work and living in a warm house will contribute to environmental security by burning less coal which is the primary source of heating in Mongolia.

loans.use: to purchase necessary materials for building his new house.

loans.name: Roza

texts.en:
Roza is a 33-year-old woman with two children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. She is a farmer who grows maize on a large scale for commercial purposes. She also trades in produce to supplement her farming activities. Like all good mothers she has a dream of educating her children up to the University.

Price fluctuation and unpredictable weather changes destroy her business projections while her dreams are to venture into modern farming activities and own a food store that can sustainably supply her customers all year round. Roza intends to use the loan to pay for labor to weed and buy maize for planting.

loans.use: to pay for labor to weed and buy maize for planting.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase more products for her pesticide business.

loans.name: Hector

texts.es:
Hector es soltero, no tiene hijos, vive en casa de sus padres ocupando una  habitación. Es estudiante en la universidad y trabaja de ayudante cortador de cuero en dos zapaterías de la ciudad para poder cubrir sus gastos personales, académicos y del hogar.

Hector trabaja alrededor de ocho horas al día y se dedica el resto del tiempo a sus estudios, el crédito que solicita es para comprar material (cuero) para adelantar su trabajo, tener el cuero cortado para venderlo directamente en sus trabajos y percibir mejores ganancias.

El sueño de Hector es poder independizarse y así aliviar el gasto el trabajo de sus padres.

Es la primera vez que solicita préstamo de Kiva.
texts.en:
Hector is single and has no children. He lives at his parents’ house where he occupies a room. Hector is a university student, but he also works as an assistant leather cutter at two shoe shops in the city. His job helps him to cover personal, school, and household expenses.

Hector works approximately eight hours a day and devotes the rest of the time to his studies. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy leather for his work. By having cut leather that he can sell directly at his jobs, Hector will be able to generate more income.

Hector's dream is to become independent and help alleviate some his parents’ expenses. This is the first time he has requested a Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy leather that he can cut and sell to the shoe shops where he works.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es: La Sra. Justina tiene 36 años y es casada, ella se dedica a la venta de salchipapas y también se dedica al servicio de impresiones  ya que tiene su imprenta junto a su esposo, ella vive en la zona de Coqueni de la ciudad de La Paz, este préstamo es su quinta secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Justina va a usar este préstamo para  la compra de material para la impresión de almanaques para el siguiente año ya que tiene muchos contratos que cumplir con distintas tiendas comerciales, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es quiere satisfacer a su clientela entregando trabajos de buena calidad  que por la falta de efectivo no la podía comprar y el préstamo le hacía mucha falta, La Sra. Justina enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que existen muchas imprentas en distintas zonas de la ciudad pero a ella le va muy bien y se siente feliz y agradecida, en la foto la Sra. Justina esta en compañía de su esposo.
texts.en:
Sra. Justina is 36 years old and married. She sells “salchipapas” (sausages and fried potatoes), but she also has a printing service that she manages with her husband. Justina lives in the District of Coqueni in the city of La Paz.

This is her fifth loan with Emprender. Sra. Justina will use the money to buy materials for printing calendars for the upcoming year. She has several contracts with different stores that she must fulfill. Her reason for requesting this loan is because she wants to satisfy her clients by delivering good-quality work. However, she lacks the cash to buy supplies, so this loan is greatly needed.

Sra. Justina faces challenges in her business, such as competition from several other printers that do business in different parts of the city. She is still doing well, so she is happy and grateful. In the photo, Sra. Justina can be seen with her husband.

loans.use: to buy materials for printing calendars.

loans.name: Claudia Cecilia

texts.es: La Sra. Claudia tiene 31 años  tiene 3 hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, ella se dedica a la venta  de productos de primera necesidad en su tienda de  barrio que se encuentra en la zona de la Mutualista de la ciudad de Santa Cruz, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Claudia  va a usar este préstamo para la compra de un Frízer que le hace falta para conservar los refrescos fríos,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de capital para la compra frízer. La Sra. Claudia enfrenta retos en su negocio que son crecer en clientela y va a utilizar los beneficios mejorar  la calidad de vida de su familia. El deseo de la Sra. es tener un almacén donde pueda ofrecer variedad de productos a su clientela, ella dice que trabajando duro y con el apoyo de la institución lograra  que se haga realidad.
texts.en:
Claudia is 31 years old and has three school-aged children.  She sells primary needs products in her neighborhood store, located in Santa Cruz.  This is her first loan through the institution and Claudia will use it to buy a cooler that she needs to keep soft drinks cold.  She needs this loan because she does not have enough working capital.

Claudia has challenges in her business, including attracting customers.  She will use these benefits to improve her family’s quality of life.  She wants to have a big store where she can offer a variety of products to her customers, and says that she will do it through hard work and help from the institution.

loans.use: to buy a cooler.

loans.name: Alex Ivan

texts.es: El Joven Alex tiene 21 años y es soltero,  se dedica a la elaboración y venta de colchones de paja también llamados como “payasas”, el muchacho es muy trabajador por lo que adicionalmente también trabaja en un  molino como empleado que se encuentran en la zona de Kalajahuira,  este préstamo es el primero que ha tomado con la institución, Alex va a usar este préstamo para invertir en la compra de paja por volqueta, debido a que en fines de año empieza la época de lluvia y la paja sube de precio ya que este es el principal material para la elaboración de las payasas, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de efectivo, Alex enfrenta retos en su negocio que son como comienza la época de lluvia corre el riesgo de no conseguir paja, que en estas épocas ya no abunda demasiado, además la ubicación de su casa es cerca al rio por lo que necesita producir más para asegurar la infraestructura de su vivienda y  va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando mas paja para proveerse por 3 meses, además comprara yute al por mayor para que disminuyan sus costos,  su deseo del joven Alex es que quiere tener su propio auto y llevar los colchones en el  mismo a distintas ciudades y provincias del interior como a los Yungas y a Beni  y así de esta manera poder aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Young Alex is 21years old and a bachelor. He makes and sells straw mattresses, which are called “payasas”. The young man is very hardworking because he also works in a mill as an employee. He lives in the Kalajahuira area.

This is Alex’s first loan from Emprender. He will use it to purchase straw by the truckloands because at the end of the year the rainy season begins and the price of straw rises. This is the main material used to make the payasas. The reason he is requesting the loan is his need for cash.

Alex faces challenges in his business such as the beginning of the rainy season when he runs the risk of not obtaining straw, which is scarce at this time of year. As well his house is located near the river so that he has to produce more in order to secure the infrastructure of his dwelling. He will use his earnings to continue buying more straw in order to supply his business for three months. In addition, he will also purchase jute wholesale in order to reduce his costs. 

Young Alex’s wish is to own an auto and to be able to transport his mattresses to distant cities and provinces in the interior such as Los Yungas and to Beni so that he can increase his income.

loans.use: to purchase straw wholesale.

loans.name: Gavhar

texts.ru: Гавхар -женщина 43 лет, замужем, имеет троих детей.Она работает на швейном заводе - мотальщицей нитей. Она туже несколько раз получает в нашей организации кредит, для своих домашних целей. За период кредитования она смогла выдать дочь замуж,отремонтировать квартиру, а теперь планирует провести стационарное лечение зубов.И заменить больные зубы.Гавхар благодарна организации за поддержку и финансирование.
texts.en: Gavhar is 43 years old, married, and has 3 children. She works as a thread reeler at a sewing factory. She has received several loans from our organization to pay for household-related needs in the past. During the time she has been our client, she has hosted her daughter's wedding, carried out apartment repairs, and she now plans to undergo dental treatment in hospital and to replace her bad teeth. Gavhar is grateful to our organization for the financing and support.

loans.use: to pay for dental treatment

loans.name: Kalyiman

texts.ru: Калайман 47 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. Калайман в качестве основного дохода с 1998 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 10,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Калайман в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 4 дойные коровы лошадь ежемесячный доход от продажи молока и молочных продуктов составляет 10,000 сом. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Калайман обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2  коров. Доходы от кредита Калайман планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины, а также планирует накопить средства для постройки дома.
texts.en: Kalyiman is 47 years old, married, and has 3 children. Since 1998, she has been working in animal husbandry, which is the main source of income of the family. She started this business with a sum of only 10,000 Kyrgyzstan Som (KGS.) Thanks to her persistent hard work, her farm now includes 4 dairy cows and brings in monthly earnings of 10,000 Som from the sale of milk and dairy products. For the purpose of developing her business, Kalyiman has approached Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 70,000 Som to buy 2 cows. She plans to use the income generated by this loan to further increase the number of livestock she has, and also to save up money to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase two milk cows

loans.name: Emerita

texts.en:
Emerita is 44 years old and has three children. Emerita is married and has one child who is in school.

Emerita is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy vegetable seeds, fertilizers and insecticides.

Emerita has been farming vegetables for eight years now, and has borrowed 18 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Emerita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes to sell ahead of the Christmas season.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 35 years old and married with one child who is in school. She is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Irene requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Irene has been farming rice for two years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Irene would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a 55-year-old woman with eight children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. Her main business is maize growing. In addition, she operates a small food stall in the market which gives her additional income. Her ambition to better the lives of her children drove her to venture into these activities. She wants to expand her business to other areas,  despite challenges of seasonal weather changes and low prices. Beatrice is requesting a loan to buy  land to expand her farming activities.

loans.use: to buy  land to expand her farming activities.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is 47 years old, married and has three children who are in school. She is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Leonida requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to purchase seeds and fertilizers for her farm.

Leonida has been farming vegetables for 10 years now and has borrowed 21 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her farming business.

In the future, Leonida would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers for her farm

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
This is Maria, 54, a resident of Intramuros, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Juan and is a mother to her children. Together with with her husband, she manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Maria operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Maria hopes to give her family a good future and dreams of making large savings while she still can through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a 36-year-old government employee who works as a primary school teacher. A father to four children, he is married and lives in Kagadi, Uganda. He was inspired to join the teaching profession by his desire to inspire young children, and he says teaching has made him realize his dream.

He owns a retail shop to supplement his meager salary. His dream is to become a principal after upgrading in his studies. Francis intends to use the loan to pay for his school fees.

loans.use: to pay for his school fees.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 34 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Mary Jane is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to purchase rice seed, fertilizers and other farm equipment.

Mary Jane has been farming rice for 15 years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase rice seed, fertilizers and other farm equipment.

loans.name: Morgan

texts.en:
Morgan is a 33-year-old government employee who works as a primary school teacher. A father to two children, he is married and lives in Kagadi, Uganda. He was inspired to join the teaching profession by his urge to serve the nation and he felt there was no better way but to teach the children of his nation. He owns a retail shop to supplement his meager salary.

He wishes to venture into commercial farming since food security is one of the country's major emphases in the next five years. Morgan intends to use the loan to buy land for farming.

loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: Mely

texts.en:
Mely is 49 years old, married with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Mely has a business buying and selling fish in the Philippines. Mely requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Mely has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Mely would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel no es casado pero convive con su pareja hace ya varios años, tiene cuatro hijos, vive en anticretico ocupando seis habitaciones con paredes de estuco y el piso es de tablones y cemento, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona de Ciudad Satelite de la ciudad de El Alto.
Actualmente trabaja como chofer propietario de la linea de trufi en uno de los  sindicatos de choferes  trabajando al dia,  o sea teniendo ingresos diarios; su pareja se dedica a la venta de peluches pero no es una operación contínua; ambos corren con los gastos de servicios básicos de su familia y el estudio de sus hijos.
El crédito lo requiere para la reparación y mantenimiento de su movilidad ( compra de llantas , cambio de líquidos y fluidos y mantenimiento general) ya que es la fuente de sus ingresos  y asi poder mejorar su calidad de vida
El sueño de Daniel es adquirir una tienda para que su pareja pueda vender en ella y poder generar mejores ingresos.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO Y KIVA.
texts.en:
Daniel is not married, but he and his partner have been in a relationship for several years. They have four children. Daniel lives in a rental property that has six rooms with stucco walls and a combination of hardwood and cement floors. The house is located in the District of Ciudad Satelite in the city of El Alto.

Daniel currently works as an independent driver for a taxi line that is part of one of the transportation unions. He works all day and generates an income. His partner sells plush toys, but she does not work on a continuous basis. Both of them contribute to the expenses, such as basic services for their family and the education of their children.

The loan he is requesting will be used to repair and maintain his vehicle. He will buy tires, replace the fluids, and provide general maintenance. His vehicle is his source of income, so it helps him improve his quality of life. Daniel’s dream is to acquire a store where his partner can sell her goods and generate more income.

This is the first time he has requested a loan from IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy tires and pay for vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Justa Pastora

texts.es:
El señora Justa Pastora es una señora que reside en el casco urbano de Condega desde hace mas de veinte años aproximadamente y esta felizmente casada y tiene tres hijo los cuales son independientes.

Ella se desempeña como obrera en la fabricación de puros de tabaco en una empresa tabacalera del en el casco urbano de Condega y que son exportados al extranjero, labora de lunes a sábado de 7 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde, y su esposo se desempeña como agricultor una propiedad donde se desempeña en la producción de granos básicos, donde ambos trabajan fuerte para obtener el sustento diario de su hogar.

Esta clienta se presento a nuestras oficinas a solicitar su financiamiento numero ocho en Ceprodel y donde ella espera que ser aprobado este crédito ella pueda realizar las compras de algunos materiales de construcción tales como cemento y ladrillos y pagar la mano de obre de la mejora que le realizara a su casa de habitación, ya que sus ingresos mensuales no son suficiente como para poder realizar las mejorar con esfuerzo propio y en el momento preciso. Cabe mencionar que los financiamiento anteriores que esta clienta a recibido de Ceprodel han sido para el mejoramiento de su vivienda y se muestra agradecida por el apoyo que nuestra institución le ha brindado y de esta manera tener un techo mas digno.
texts.en:
Justa Pastora is a woman that has lived in the town of Condega for more than 20 years and she is happily married with three children (they are now independent adults).

She works as a laborer in a tobacco factory in Condega and they export their tobacco products abroad.  She works from Monday to Saturday, from 7:00 AM until 5:00 PM.  Her husband works in agriculture on a farm that grows basic grains.  They both work hard to provide for their daily household needs.

Justa Pastora came to our offices asking for her eighth loan from Ceprodel, where she hopes to be approved so that she can buy the construction materials that she needs, such as cement, bricks, and money to pay the workers, so that she can improve her house.  Her monthly wages are not sufficient and she is not currently able to make the improvements on her own.  We should mention that the previous loans she received from Ceprodel were also used to improve her home and she is thankful for the support that our institution has given to her so that she can have a more suitable home.

loans.use: to buy construction materials, such as cement and bricks, and to pay workers

loans.name: Tukhtakhon

texts.ru: Тухтахон жительница города Турсунзаде. Ей 45 лет, она не замужем. Образование у нее среднее. Тухтахон открыла свой салон красоты, но у нее нет средств, чтобы начать свою деятельность. Поэтому она обратилась к нам за кредитом для развитие бизнеса в сфере предоставления услуг. Она берет кредит для приобретения необходимой мебели и аксессуаров.
texts.en: Tukhtakhon is a resident of the the city of Tursun-zoda.  She is 45 years old, she is married.  She has a secondary education.  Tukhtakhon opened her beauty salon, but she does not have the resource to start her business.  This is why she turned to us for a loan to grow her service business.  She is taking out a loan to purchase necessary furniture and accessories.

loans.use: to purchase necessary furniture and accessories

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a 34-year-old married man with six children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. His main product for his business is beer and he also practices farming for additional income. Charles is faced with a challenge of lack of capital to rent a permanent stall where he can sell his beer. His dreams are to educate his children up to the university, build business premises, and own a depot. Charles intends to use the loan to buy beers to sell.

loans.use: to buy beers to sell.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en: Edward is a 28-year-old married man with one child aged two, living in Kagadi, Uganda. Due to his passion to be better in life and escape the poverty he grew up in, he started a produce business four years ago. He has been able to buy land to do to do farming with the profits earned from the business. He dreams of educating his child up to the university and owning a sustainable food store despite challenges of weather changes and bad roads that affect his business. Edward intends to use the loan to buy beans and maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy beans and maize to sell.

loans.name: Venant

texts.en: Venant is a 26-year-old government employee who works as a primary school teacher. This father to two children is married and lives in Kagadi, Uganda. He was inspired to the teaching profession by his urge to serve the nation and he feels there is no better way than to teach the children of his nation. He also sells produce to supplement the low pay from his salary. Inadequate capital to meet the high demand is his great challenge while his dream is to own a wholesale shop. Venant is requesting a loan to buy groundnuts to sell.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and stock of cloth

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store like shampoo, groceries, canned goods, sugar, etc. 

Margie has been in this business for 15 years. Margie earns additional income from raising pigs.

Margie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store like shampoo, groceries, canned goods and sugar.

loans.name: John Baptist

texts.en:
John Baptist is a 36-year-old man, married with three children aged between five and two living in Kagadi, Uganda. A teacher who was inspired into that profession by the urge to earn a living, he also has a motorcycle and produce business from which he earns income to supplement his low salary.

He dreams of educating his children and upgrading his studies as his target is to become a principal. His business desire is to expand his produce business to new areas.

John Baptist is requesting a loan to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Margie is 30 years old and has two children who are in school.

Margie has a general store business in the Philippines. Margie requested a PHP 28,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her general store.

Margie has been in this business for three years. In the future, Margie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store like shampoo and groceries.

loans.name: Caleb

texts.en:
Caleb is a 26-year-old ambitious man living in Kagadi, Uganda. Due to his desire to become self-employed he set up a nursery school because he never wanted to roam around the streets looking for jobs with the current unemployment levels in the country. 

His major challenge is inadequate capital to provide all the facilities he needs for the school while his dream is to have a model school in the district. Caleb intends to use the loan to buy land to expand the school since the enrollment increases every year.

loans.use: to buy land to expand the school.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is married with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Marivic is 40 years old and has three children who are in school.

Marivic has a business buying and selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines. Marivic requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fruits and vegetables to sell.

Marivic has been in this business for two years. In the future, Marivic would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Marceline

texts.en:
Marceline used the previous loan to pay school fees for her children.

She is a 39-year-old married woman with six children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been teaching for fourteen years and is so proud of her profession because she feels that inspiring the young is her calling. Her personal goal is educating her children, and she intends to set up a poultry project to supplement her meager salary. 

Marceline intends to use the new loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Elbina

texts.en:
Elbina is 44 years old and lives in San Andres, Panaon,  Misamis Occidental. She is married with six children. 

Elbina is engaged in a business buying and selling coconuts and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used to purchase additional coconuts for her existing coconuts business. 

Elbina has been a member of PMPC for a year. In the future, Elbina hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional coconuts.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy embroidery material for an embroidery business.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Teresita works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines. Teresita is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store like shampoo, canned goods, soap, etc. 

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store like shampoo, canned goods and soap.

loans.name: Paz

texts.en:
Paz is 52 years old and lives in San Roque, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children. 

Paz is engaged in a business sewing and making coffin accessories and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used to purchase additional cloth and other accessories needed for her business. 

Paz has been a member of PMPC for eight years. In the future, Paz hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional cloth and other accessories.

loans.name: Dalaibaatar

texts.en:
Mr. Dalaibaatar, 40 years old, lives with his family in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family’s main income sources are his work as transporter and his wife’s private glove business. He uses his own minivan to carry people to their destination and his wife makes gloves and sells them to street vendors. 

The family has recently begun to build their own fences. But due to lack of finance, the fences are incomplete, leaving the main gate area empty. So he is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to buy planks and iron. Once they have finished their fence-building work, the family can work full of enthusiasm.

loans.use: To buy planks.

loans.name: Saroeurn

texts.en: Saroeurn is 35 years old, widowed and lives with his three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. He has been working as a teacher for more than ten years, earning approximately $5 daily. To earn additional income, he grows rice on the side. Due to a lack of funds, Saroeurn is requesting a loan of $600 to buy fertilizer and fuel to use on his farm. This purchase will help his crops grow well and provide a high yield. In the future, he would like to expand his farmland and send his children to a good school. He also hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and fuel to use on his farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tables and chairs

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a 33-year-old man, married with four children and living in Kagadi, Uganda. He is a teacher who was inspired to join that profession by the urge to serve his nation as he felt there was no better way to inspire young people other than teaching them. He also has a produce business from which he earns income to supplement his low salary. His dream is to educate his children up to university level and do commercial agriculture. Stephen intends to use the loan to buy land for farming.

loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: Munkh-Erdene

texts.en:
Mr. Munkh-Erdene, 33 years old, lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been working as a coal transporter for eight consecutive years and, especially in summer, he travels far away to transport goods between Ulaanbaatar and Erlian, a border city with China. 

While his family has income sources, his sister is unemployed and lives in a house without a heating system. So he has decided to install a heating system in his sister’s old wooden house as preparation for the harsh winter period. Also, his sister wants to make her house into a food store as an income source. 

Munkh-Erdene is requesting a loan of 6,500,000 MNT to buy insulating materials as well as a heating system. As a result, the house will get warm and it will consume less coal; in return it will greatly contribute to efforts against air pollution.

loans.use: to buy a heating system for his sister.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Nena works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell vegetables business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling fish. Nena is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional vegetables to sell for her buy-and-sell vegetables business.

Nena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Davaasambuu

texts.en:
Davaasambuu is 50 years old and the father of three children. He lives with his two daughters and wife in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They live together in a small house on their land. Davaasambuu’s oldest son lives separately from the family and the youngest two daughters attend a university. 

For many years, Davaasambuu worked at a contract company as a sanitation truck driver. However, since 2001, he has been running a furniture-making business. His wife works with him. They refurbish old wooden furniture and sell it at Narantuul market, the largest outdoor market in Ulaanbaatar. Over the years, Davaasambuu has gained a great deal of experience and has been able to purchase a house, land, and a small family car. 

Davaasambuu is requesting a loan to purchase another automobile as his previous car can’t adjust to the delivery service. This will be his fourth loan through Credit Mongol and he is one of the most reliable customers. Davaasambuu is a very hardworking person with a strong will and making delivery services using her new car will certainly increase customer satisfaction greatly.

loans.use: to purchase a new automobile.

loans.name: Nieves

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Nieves works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal. Nieves is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks like shampoo, soap, sugar, canned goods, etc. for her general store business.

Nieves has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store like shampoo, soap, sugar and canned goods.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 43 years old and lives in Dela Paz, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with five children. 

Fe is engaged in a dried fish vending business and earns approximately PHP 3,500 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used to purchase additional kilos of dried fish for her existing business. 

Fe has been a member of PMPC for almost two years. In the future, Fe hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional kilos of dried fish.

loans.name: Lodilen

texts.en:
Lodilen is married with two children. Lodilen is 35 years old and lives in Mangidkid, Plaridel Misamis Occidental.

Lodilen sells variety of snacks to earn a living and has had this business for four years. She has requested a loan to pay for sacks of flour, bananas, sugar, cooking oil and milk.

Lodilen has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Lodilen hopes to have more savings and invest in a new business raising pigs.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of flour, bananas, sugar, cooking oil and milk.

loans.name: Byambajav

texts.en:
Mr. Byambajav, 45 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He works as an electrician in a state-owned company and his wife is a cook in private restaurant. Their son has recently begun working in a credit department at private bank and has goal of becoming a credit expert. Their daughter goes to a local secondary school. 

As a person who cares about their children’s well-being, Mr. Byambajav is much concerned about the increasing air pollution. Thus he and his family participate in a clean air project which is funded by government and individuals. To implement the project, the household is requesting a 600,000 MNT loan to buy an electric-powered heater. By doing so it will help the local community to reduce the use of coal and contribute to the clean air project.

loans.use: to buy an electric powered heater.

loans.name: Arnulfo

texts.en: Arnulfo is 46 years old and lives in Butuay, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is married and the father of four children. He earns a living by working as a sword and knife blacksmith, and earns about PHP 5,000 a month. He is requesting a loan to buy metal bars to use in his business. Arnulfo has been a member of PMPC for one year and hopes to expand his business in the future.

loans.use: to buy supplies for a blacksmith business.

loans.name: Ganzorig

texts.en: Mr. Ganzorig, 42 years old, lives with his wife and four children in Dornod, an eastern province of Mongolia. The family resides in a traditional Mongolian home, a ger. Their main source of income is from the sale of silk, silk-made products, and Mongolian boots. They purchase the materials from a neighboring city in China. Before China closes its border, he wants to buy materials. He is requesting a loan for 2,800,000 MNT. The loan will help his family to generate more income and will contribute to their economic prosperity. Ganzorig is a very hardworking individual. In the future he has a goal of building his own house.

loans.use: to buy silk and other materials

loans.name: Ran

texts.en:
Ran is 53 years old. She is widowed and resides with two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling vegetables for more than ten years, earning approximately $10 daily. One of her children is a soldier who earns about $4 daily. 

In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Ran is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase more vegetables to sell. By doing so, she would earn more income for the family. 

In the future, she would like to expand her business and build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Firdoos

texts.en: Ms Firdoos is a 38-year-old married woman who is the mother of five children. She is trying hard to meet their needs, including for food, health, clothing, and education. For the last 20 years she and her husband have earned a living by manufacturing spoons which they make in various sizes. She is well-known in her area for the high quality of her products and works hard because she wants to take good care of her family. She has been a member of the Kashf Foundation for two years and is very happy with the support it provides. She is requesting a loan for Rs. 20000 to buy raw materials like good quality steel, iron and boxes for packing. Her goal is to increase her output and her sales. She will use part of the additional income she earns to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for a spoon-making business.

loans.name: Kim Ly

texts.en: Kimly is 26 years old, single and lives in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been employed as construction worker (working on roads) for more than a year. She is also involved in growing rice and earns about $5 daily. Kimly is requesting a loan for $400 to buy rice seeds and fertilizer to use on her farm. This loan will help her crops grow well and provide a high yield. In the future, she would like to expand her business and rebuild her house to make it more comfortable for her family.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and fertilizer to use on her farm.

loans.name: Sokhorn

texts.en:
Sokhorn is 55 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling meatballs for more than a year, earning approximately $2 daily. Her husband produces beds to sell. He earns about $4 per day. 

In order to improve the business, Sokhorn is requesting a loan of $1,300 to purchase timber to use for manufacturing beds to sell. 

In the future, she would like to expand the business and build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase timber to use for manufacturing beds to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy foam walls and ceiling materials.

loans.name: Emilie

texts.en:
Emilie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a spice-selling business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 14000 PHP through NWTF to buy more spices to sell in her stall.

NWTF is relisting Emilie's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy spices to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Connie

texts.en:
Connie, 36, is married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Connie has a food vending business in the Philippines. Connie requested a 24000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for this business.

Connie has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Connie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her food vending business

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Ms Zahida, a 43-year-old married to a factory worker, has been in the business of stitching for the last four years. Gradually she has improved her venture and now makes enough to contribute to the family income. Zahida has four children; one son works in a factory, while one daughter is married; the others assist her in stitching.

In order to meet the demands of her growing customer base in a timely fashion, Zahida has requested a loan of Rs. 20000 to purchase more spools of threads with some packs of buttons and zippers in many colors. She plans to spend part of her increased revenues on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of threads with some packs of buttons and zippers in many colors.

loans.name: Zeporah

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Zeporah works hard to support her family. She earns a living by raising chickens in the Philippines. She earns additional income from frozen foods. Zeporah is borrowing 23,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more feed and vitamins for her chickens.

Zeporah has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more feed and vitamins for her chickens.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 40 years old and married with four children.

Yolanda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase more grocery items to sell.

Yolanda has been in this business for 14 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Yolanda aspires to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items to sell at her general store.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 17000 through NWTF to purchase items to sell like sugar, milk, spices, etc. for her general store business.

Josephine has been in this business for 10 years. Josephine earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell in her general store like sugar, milk, spices, etc.

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es: María además de ser maestra de Educación secundaria en un instituto del municipio donde vive, es una madre ejemplar de 3 hijos a los que está apoyando en sus estudios, también ayuda a su marido en una mini ferretería que tiene, es soltera , y atiende a jóvenes adolecentes en su nivel académico, esta señora tiene la necesidad de mejorar su vivienda, por eso visito a ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito , el que utilizaría en la compra de cemento, arena, cerámica, cemento para cerámica,  piedrín, zinc y mano de obra, para mejorar las condiciones y su  nivel de vida y de la familia.
texts.en:
María, in addition to being a secondary-school teacher in a school in the town where she lives, is an exemplary mother of three children whom she's helping with their studies.  She also helps her husband in his mini-hardware store.  She's single and works with adolescent youth in her academic level.

This woman needs to improve her home, so she went to CEPRODEL to receive a loan.  She's going to buy cement, sand, ceramic tiles, cement for tiles, gravel, and metal sheets, and pay for labor.  This will improve her family's living conditions and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies and to pay for labor

loans.name: Marvin

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Managua Nicaragua vive don Marvin, es una persona casada,  tiene bajo su cargo a tres personas, tiene estabilidad laboral, actualmente se desempeña como conductor, desde  hace  catorce años  en una institución del estado.

Marvin solicita a CEPRODEL  un crédito  para poder comprar materiales de construcción tales como cinc, hierro, bloque, arena, cemento para realizar  anexo de un cuarto en su vivienda; Ya que necesito para darle a mi familia  una buena comodidad.
texts.en: Marvin lives in the city of Managua, Nicaragua.  He’s married and has three people in his care.  He has a stable job.  He’s been employed as a driver for 14 years in a state institution.  Marvin is asking Ceprodel for a loan to buy building materials like metal sheeting, rebar, concrete blocks, sand and cement to add a room to his house because he needs to provide his family with more comfort.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a rickshaw body and spare parts for a transportion business

loans.name: Quy

texts.en:
Quy was born in 1973 and has two children. Her younger child is learning in the 12th grade and her older child is a carpenter. Her husband is also a carpenter. She sells bananas to earn a living. She has done this job for 13 years. Her income is about 4,000,000 VND per month, and her family’s total earnings are about 11,000,000 VND per month. 

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2008. In the last cycle she borrowed 9,184,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9,184,000 VND to buy banana seeds to grow. She wants to use the profits to raise her children well and enlarge her husband’s wood workshop.

loans.use: to buy banana seeds.

loans.name: Vebce

texts.en:
As a married mother of 2 children, Vebce works hard to support her family.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from clothing sales.  Vebce is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Vebce has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ma. Rosie

texts.en:
Ma. Rosie is 43 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Ma. Rosie is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Ma. Rosie has been raising pigs for 5 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Remia

texts.en:
Remia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling dried fish in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy more dried fish to sell in her stall.

NWTF is relisting Remia's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is 50 years old and married with 3 children.

Rachel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Rachel has been in this business for eleven years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Rachel aspires to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is a 35-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the last ten years. She offers various goods for daily use. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. Her husband is employed in a small factory and earns insufficient income to support his family alone. 
 
She is motivated to provide for her family. As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of Rs 20,000 to buy stocks of rice, bread, and flour from the market at lower rates. She then will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She is in her 7th loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She wishes to utilize part of revenues to deal with personal expenses and to increase business capital.

loans.use: to buy stocks of rice, bread, and flour from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Virgie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Virgie requested a PHP 35000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing nets and other fishing equipment. She has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Virgie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets and other fishing equipment

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is 44 years old. He is married and has six children. He and his wife earn their income through the sale of crops and livestock. They grow maize, coffee, cassava, passion fruit and bananas. They also keep cows, pigs and chickens.

Vincent looks forward to becoming a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). As a CKW he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, helping them to improve their crop yields and to increase their incomes.  

With the additional money that he will earn as a CKW, Vincent will buy agricultural supplies. His biggest dream is to see his children receive a good education.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Pascal

texts.fr: Pascal est âgé de 56 ans et est marié à Yvette, une marchande. Le couple a neuf enfants, dont certains scolarisés. En plus de ces enfants, le couple a deux autres enfants à leur charge. Pascal et sa femme vivent dans la même maison avec leurs enfants. Pascal n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Parallèlement à son métier d’agriculteur, Pascal fait l’élevage des porcs depuis trente ans environs pour subvenir à ses besoins et assurer les diverses charges de sa famille. Dans le but d'augmenter sa culture, Pascal désire acheter des intrants pour cultiver du piment, de la tomate et du niébé. Pascal s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. C'est la sixième fois que Pascal sollicite un prêt auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Pascal is 56 years old and married to Yvette, a merchant. The couple have nine children, not all in school. In addition to these children, the couple have two others to support. Pascal and his wife live in the same house with their children. He did not attend school. Along with his work as a farmer, Pascal has been raising pigs for about thirty years in order to meet his needs and to ensure that the diverse family expenses are covered. 

With the goal of increasing his crops, Pascal would like to purchase some inputs to grow chili peppers, tomatoes, and black-eyed peas. He gets his supplies from a city in Benin. This is the sixth time that Pascal has requested a loan from ALIDé. The previous loans were indeed paid back.

loans.use: to grow chili peppers, tomatoes, and black-eyed peas

loans.name: Ricardo José

texts.es:
Don Ricardo José vive en Managua  Nicaragua,  actualmente labora como cajero en una universidad del estado, es una persona trabajadora,  tiene cuatro hijos dos de ellos están bajo su cargo, tiene estabilidad laboral desde hace ocho años.

 Visito la oficina de CEPRODEL  para solicitar un crédito y poder comprar materiales de construcción tales como bloque, arena, cemento, para construir en su vivienda un cuarto para darle a su familia mejor condición de vida. 

Con este financiamiento le servirá de mucha ayuda para hacer una ampliación en su casa y esperando el apoyo de ceprodel.
texts.en:
Ricardo José lives in Managua, Nicaragua. He works as a cashier in a public university. He is a hard-working person who has four children; two of whom still live at home. He has had a secure job for eight years.

He came to the CEPRODEL office to ask for a loan to be able to buy construction materials such as cinder blocks, sand and cement to build another room in his house to give his family a better standard of life.

He is hoping for Ceprodel's support as this loan will really help him to expand his house

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Victorin

texts.fr: Victorin est âgé de 32 ans et vit au Bénin. Victorin n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Victorin est marié à Véronique, une marchande. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a  un autre enfant à leur charge. Victorin vit avec sa femme et ses enfants. le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Afin d’assurer ses diverses charges, Victorin mène comme activité, l’agriculture et fait parallèlement la pêche dans une région du Bénin depuis quatorze ans. Dans le but d'augmenter sa culture, Victorin désire acheter des intrants pour cultiver le coton, le maïs et le piment en vue de satisfaire les besoins de ses clients. C'est pour la première fois que Victorin sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt lui permettra certainement de rehausser le niveau de son activité et de se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
Victorin is 32 years old and lives in Benin. He did not attend school. He is married to Véronique, a merchant. The couple have four children, not all in school. In addition to their children, the couple have another child to support. Victorin lives with  his wife and children. The couple jointly ensure that the family expenses are covered. 

To make sure his diverse expenses are covered, Victorin has been running a farming business and at the same time has been a fisherman in a region of Benin for fourteen years. With the goal of increasing his crops, Victorin would like to purchase inputs to grow cotton, corn, and chili peppers, so as to satisfy the needs of his customers. 

This is the first time that Victorin has requested a loan from ALIDé. This loan will surely enable him to boost his business and make more profit.

loans.use: to grow cotton, corn, and chili peppers

loans.name: Su

texts.en: Su was born in 1957. She has two married children. Her husband is a retired teacher. She and her husband raise chickens and grow rice to earn a living. This earns Su 3,000,000 VND a month. Her family’s total earnings are about 7,000,000 VND per month. Su has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2008. In the last cycle she borrowed 9,184,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9,184,000 VND to buy food for chickens. She always wants to enlarge her farm of chickens.

loans.use: to buy food for chickens.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Ms. Sajida is a 43-year-old married woman and a mother of three.  She has been sewing since she was eight years old. She decided to start her business to support her husband in meeting household expenses. She knows the techniques of sewing very well. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns enough to lead a decent life. 

To help her continue the operations of her business, she has requested a loan of  25000 PKR to buy a stock of threads in different colors with packs of zippers, buttons, etc to meet up with the increasing demand without delay. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenue for personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy thread, zippers, buttons, etc.

loans.name: Perveen

texts.en:
Perveen is a 29-year-old married woman. She has been in the milk sales business for many years. She has three buffalo that she milks. Initially, she had two buffalo; later she purchased one more buffalo after taking the loan from Kashf for increasing her milk sales. She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter, cheese and ghee that she makes from the milk. She has a good client list. Her business is good enough that she can lead a decent life. 

Perveen has two children. Both her sons also help in her business, while her husband does small agriculture work - his income is not enough to meet the daily expenditures. She is in her fourth loan cycle and has strong association with Kashf foundation. She has taken several loans and each time she has paid back her loan in full and on time. Now she has requested a loan of Rs. 30000 to buy one more cow to increase milk production. As a result, she would be able to serve more people in her community. She wishes to use some of the revenue for her children's benefit.

loans.use: to buy one more cow to increase milk production.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 39 years old, married, and has children.  She is a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. Her husband is a granite installer.  She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Marissa runs a food business where she makes and sells spring rolls, which she has been doing for eight years. Her spring rolls contain sweet potato and bamboo shoots. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns approximately 300 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Marissa is requesting a loan for 20,000 PHP, which she will use to buy ingredients such as wrappers, sweet potatoes, bamboo shoots, and cooking oil.  She will also buy LPG gas that she needs in her business. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.  

Marissa hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams of having a good life through all her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients and LPG gas needed in her business.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 32 years old and married with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Rosalie has a general store business in the Philippines. Rosalie requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari (general) store.

Rosalie has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of two children, Rosalina works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.  Rosalina is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell for her general store business.

Rosalina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Precy

texts.en:
Precy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food stall business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

NWTF is presenting Precy's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Flordeliz

texts.en:
This is Flordeliz. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a 25,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Flordeliz hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams of giving her family a good future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children, one of whom attends school. She is not looking after any other family members. She has been selling charcoal from home at retail for the last eight years, working seven days a week. She has no other source of income.

Rose has requested a loan of UShs 800,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to stock more sacks of charcoal for sale. Her challenges include seasonality and defaulters. Her dream is to be able to afford to buy a full truck of charcoal for sale and also to become a wholesaler.  She joined MCDT because she wanted more capital for her business. She rents a house with access to both electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses are rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Elza

texts.en:
Elza is 39 years old. She lives with her father in a small village of Gurjaani district, Kakheti regioni, East Georgia. The family is involved in agricultural business. In particular, they have a tractor and combine and Elza’s father serves his villagers during harvesting and gets a small income. But such a small income is not enough for the family. 

Elza requested a loan for purchasing piglets. After purchasing piglets, she will raise them and thus increase her livestock in future. This will increase the income of the family. With increased income they will be able to improve their living conditions. Elza awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase piglets

loans.name: Williams

texts.en:
Williams is 27 years old. He is married and has one child. He and his wife earn their income through the sale of crops and livestock. They grow maize and beans and keep cows and pigs. They also have a small transport business.

Williams looks forward to becoming a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). As a CKW he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, helping them to improve their crop yields and to increase their incomes.  

With the additional money that he will earn as a CKW, Williams will save to buy another cow. He dreams of having a large dairy farm with Friesian cows.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is from the village Vakiri. She is 29 years old, married, and lives with her husband, her parents-in-law and her 5-year-old son. The family is busy with an agricultural business. In particular, they have a vineyard and a plot of land where peppers are grown. The family does all relevant agricultural work to ensure a good quality of harvest. The harvested products are sold at the local open market. In addition, Ana has two pigs. 

Along with the agricultural business, Ana sells clothes. She purchases clothes at a wholesale price in the capital city and then sells them in her village and nearby villages at a retail price. Ana requested credit for purchasing seasonal clothes for resale. She will offer a wide assortment of clothes to the customers and increase her sales, and, consequently, her profit. 

Another part of the credit will be used for purchasing a pig. After several months it will produce piglets and the family will expand their animal husbandry business.  She will reinvest part of the profit in the clothing business, and the other part will be used for improving family living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for resale and buy a pig

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed and has eight children, one of whom attends school. She is not looking after her grandchildren.

Margaret has been keeping poultry at her home for the last 10 years, working two days a week. She does not have any other source of income. She has requested a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from MCDT- SACCO to purchase chicken feed and chicks. Her challenges include seasonality and diseases. Her dream is to expand her business, accumulate profits, and own 5,000 chickens. She joined MCDT to boost her capital. She lives in her own house with access to both electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy bags of chicken feed and chicks

loans.name: Sèho Vincent

texts.fr: Sèho Vincent un agriculteur, est marié à une marchande du nom de Dorcas. Sèho Vincent est âgée de 55 ans. Le couple a huit enfants dont certains scolarisés. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple à trois autres enfants à leur charge. Sèho Vincent et sa femme vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Sèho Vincent n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Il y a environ une quarantaine d’année que Sèho Vincent exerce sa profession d’agriculteur et fait parallèlement de l’élevage des bœufs. Sèho Vincent exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Sèho Vincent s’approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Sèho Vincent veut acheter des intrants pour cultiver du maïs, du niébé et du piment. C'est la cinquième fois que Sèho Vincent sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs reçu ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Sèho Vincent is a farmer and married to a merchant by the name of Dorcas. He is 55 years old. The couple have eight children, not all in school. In addition to their children, the couple have three others to support. Sèho Vincent and his wife live together with their children and jointly ensure that the different household expenses are covered.

Sèho Vincent did not attend school. For about forty years, he has been working as a farmer by trade and at the same time has been raising steers. He does his work with passion, and this enables him to meet his needs and those of his children. He gets his supplies from a region in Benin.

Seeking to satisfy his customers, Sèho Vincent wants to purchase some inputs for growing corn, black-eyed peas, and chili peppers. This is the fifth time that he has requested a loan from ALIDé. The previous loans received were indeed repaid.

loans.use: to grow corn, black-eyed peas, and chili peppers

loans.name: Larry Alberto

texts.es:
El Señor Larry Alberto es trabajador  de una institución del estado en Managua, donde se desempeña como ayudante Valvulero desde hace cinco años, es  casado con dos persona a su cargo, responsable luchador con espíritu de superación en todo aspecto.
Necesita mejorar su hogar como es el piso ya que es de tierra.

El  crédito que solicita a CEPRODEL lo utilizara  para comprar materiales de construcción tales como cerámica boom y pago de mano de obra.
Esto permitirá mejorar el nivel de vida para su familia. 

Los sueños de Don Larry Alberto es ver su casita bien acondicionada con el apoyo que Ceprodel le pueda brindarle.
texts.en: Larry Alberto works as a pipe fitter for a state institution in Managua; he has five years’ experience.  He’s married and has two dependents.  He’s responsible, hardworking with a spirit of self-improvement in all respects.  He needs to improve his house since the floor is dirt.  He requests a Ceprodel loan to buy building materials like tile and to pay labor costs.  This will make it possible for him to improve his family’s standard of living.  Larry Alberto’s dream is to have his house in good condition with the support that Ceprodel can provide.

loans.use: to buy building supplies and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Emilsse Nadiheska

texts.es:
La  joven Emilsse  Nadiheska es una persona dinámica alegre con espíritu de superación, vive en Managua  Nicaragua, labora como secretaria desde hace año y medio en una  universidad privada, es soltera con una persona a su cargo.

Necesita  realizar una mejora en su casa como es el piso ya que es de tierra.

El  crédito que solicita aCEPRODEL lo utilizara  para comprar materiales de construcción tales como cerámica boom. 
Esto permitirá mejorar el nivel de vida para su familia.
