Este financiamiento  le servirá  para ir mejorando su calidad de vida, con esta oportunidad que  le ofrecerá  kiva y Ceprodel quedaría muy agradecida.
texts.en:
Emilsse Nadiheska is a young, dynamic, joyful person who has an overcoming spirit. She lives in Managua, Nicaragua and has worked as a secretary for a year and a half in a private university. She is single and responsible for one other person. 

She needs to do some improvements on her house as it has a mud floor. She will use the loan that she is requesting from Ceprodel to buy construction materials such as tiles and polyurethane foam. This will improve her family's standard of living.

This loan will help her improve her quality of life. She would be very grateful for this opportunity which Kiva and Ceprodel will grant her.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Maricris

texts.en: Maricris is 31 years old with two children. She sells barbecue sticks and hot dogs in front of her friend's sari-sari store every day. To create higher profits she is asking for a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy barbecue, soy sauce, vinegar, onion and pork flavorings. She hopes to achieve higher profits in order to save for her children's future education.

loans.use: to buy flavorings of barbecue, soy sauce, vinegar onions and pork

loans.name: Aqeela

texts.en: Ms. Aqeela is a 43-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the last two years. She is popular in her street for providing good quality products at reasonable rates. Her husband works as a laborer and earns an insufficient amount to cover the daily expenses of the household. Aqeela makes enough to contribute to the family income. She is a mother of seven children. She is motivated to provide for her family. As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of Rs.15,000 to buy a sack of rice and flour from the market at lower rates. She will then be able to consistently meet increasing demand. This will improve her earnings and enable her to better support her family.

loans.use: to buy a sack of rice and flour from the market at lower rates

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is from Lapasan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old. Vicenta is married and has five children. 

To make a living, Vicenta makes and sells a variety of snack items in the local community. Vicenta has been in her business for three years and earns 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Vicenta is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to buy more snack foods to sell like hotdogs, hamburgers, etc. In 2011, Vicenta joined GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more snack foods to sell like hotdogs, hamburgers etc.

loans.name: Ma. Jahelen

texts.en:
Ma. Jahelen is 48 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more grocery items to sell.

Ma. Jahelen has been in this business for 30 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Ma. Jahelen aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 50 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Alma is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Alma has been raising pigs for five years and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Cecille

texts.en:
Cecille is from Aguada, Ozamiz City. She is 35 years old and married with one child. To make a living, Cecille owns and operates a general store. Cecille has been running her store for five years and earns 6,000 PHP a month. 

In 2009, Cecille joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase new items such as candies, Milo (a brand of malted milk), shampoo, soaps etc. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, Milo (a brand of malted milk), shampoo, soaps etc.

loans.name: Jerson

texts.en:
Jerson is married and has three children.  Jerson is 50 years old and he lives in the Philippines.

To earn a living, Jerson operates a service-based business, providing transportation services to local community members.  He has been doing this for eight years and every month he earns 3,000 PHP from this work.  He has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP in order to repair his existing vehicle to provide better service.

Jerson is a new member of GDMPC.  In the future, Jerson hopes to enable his children to complete their studies and to double the income he earns from his business.

loans.use: to repair his existing vehicle to provide better service.

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy is 32 years old.  She is married and has four children.  Three of her children attend school.

Mary Joy is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines.  Mary Joy has requested a loan of 13,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm tools.  Mary Joy has been farming vegetables for five years now and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Mary Joy would like to save enough money so that she can send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm tools.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is 29 years old. He is married and has two children. He and his wife earn their income through the sale of crops and livestock. They grow maize and coffee, and also keep cows and chickens.

Wilson looks forward to becoming a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). As a CKW he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, helping them to improve their crop yields and to increase their incomes.  

With the additional money that he will earn as a CKW, Wilson will pay school fees for his children. His biggest dream in life is to see his children finish university.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 55 years old and lives in Pan-ay, Clarin.  She is married and has four children. 

To earn a living, Betty operates a service-based business, providing transportation.  She has been doing this for 11 years, earning 6,000 PHP every month from her work. Betty is requesting a loan of 9,000 PHP in order to buy accessories and motor parts. 

Betty joined GDMPC in 2005.  In the future, Betty hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy accessories and motor parts.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Lourdes works hard to support her family.

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Lourdes is borrowing 11000 PHP through NWTF to buy materials for her tailoring business.

Lourdes has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Vara

texts.en: Vara, 43, is from the small village of Gurjaani, Kakheti district, East Georgia. She lives with her husband and 2 sons. Vara runs an agricultural business. In particular, she is involved in raising poultry and livestock. After raising them, she sells them locally at a good price. Vara is a very hardworking woman, and has a rich experience in her business. Vara requested a loan to purchase piglets. After purchasing the piglets, she will raise them and expand her income opportunities. This will increase the income of the family, allowing them to renovate their house and improve their living conditions. Vara awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase piglets.

loans.name: Elmie

texts.en: Elmie, from Segatic Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, is 23 years old and single. To make a living, for the past two years  Elmie has owned and operated a business selling food, especially buko salad, earning 10,000 PHP a month. In 2011, Elmie joined GDMPC and is now requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories for his business. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories for his business.

loans.name: Ariel Navarro

texts.es:
Don Ariel vive en un municipio  departamento de Carazo  Nicaragua, es una persona casada,  tiene bajo su cargo a cincos personas, un trabajo estable desde hace  once años donde se desempeña como fontanero en una institución del estado y junto a su esposa lucha para un futuro mejor de su familia.

Solicita a CEPRODEL un crédito para poder comprar materiales de construcción tales como bloque, arena, cemento para construir en su vivienda un porche ya que no tienen una pared que le diera protección a su familia. 

“Esperó de CEPRODEL y de los organismos que apoyan los esfuerzos de personas honestas una mano amiga a los clientes que necesitan de estos financiamientos ya que el trabajo no alcanza para hacer inversiones en la vivienda solo con su apoyo”.
texts.en: Ariel lives in Carazo Department, Nicaragua.  He’s married and has five people in his care.  He’s had a steady job for 8 years.  He’s employed as a plumber for a state institution and with his wife strives to give his family a better future.  He’s asking Ceprodel for a loan to buy building materials like concrete blocks, sand and cement to build a porch because they are missing a wall to provide protection for the family.  “I’m hoping that Ceprodel and organizations that support the efforts of honest people will give a friendly hand to clients who need these loans because work isn’t enough to make investments in housing: only with your help.”

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Guiselle Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Guiselle Elizabeth vive en la ciudad de Managua Nicaragua, se caracteriza  por ser una persona luchadora junto a su esposo para un futuro mejor de su familia.

Guiselle Elizabeth se desempeña como responsable de oficina en una institución del estado desde hace cuatro año. 

 Se presento a CEPRODEL para solicitar un crédito para poder  realizar unas series de exámenes clínicos y  compra de medicamentos para su Mama ya que se encuentra mal de salud,

Da gracia a CEPRODEL por el apoyo que le pueda brindarle otorgándole este financiamiento, ya que podrá resolver este problema de salud que se le ha presentado.
texts.en:
Sra. Guiselle Elizabeth lives in the city of Managua, Nicaragua. She is known for being a determined individual, along with her husband, as they strive to provide a better future for their family.

Guiselle Elizabeth is an office manager at a state institution. She has been in this job for four years. Guiselle is requesting a loan from CEPRODEL so that she can pay for a series of medical exams and also purchase medications for her mother who is in poor health.

Thanks to the support CEPRODEL has provided with this loan, she will be able to resolve the health problem that she is currently facing.

loans.use: to pay for medical exams and to buy medicines for her mother.

loans.name: Jacob

texts.fr: Jacob est âgé de 41 ans et vit au Bénin. Jacob est marié à une marchande du nom de Loutin. Jacob n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Le couple a trois enfants, non scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Jacob vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la maison. Afin d’assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Jacob fait de l’agriculture depuis une quinzaine d’année. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Jacob sollicite pour la troisième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Jacob s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Ce prêt lui permettra de cultiver de la tomate, du maïs et du piment en vue de rehausser le niveau de son activité et de satisfaire sa clientèle. Les premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Jacob is 41 and lives in Bénin. He is married to a merchant named Loutin. Jacob did not attend school. He and his wife have three children who are not enrolled in school but are all three their dependents. Jacob lives together with his wife and children. The couple share in supporting the household. 

In order to cover the various family expenses, Jacob has been engaged in farming for about 15 years. Wishing to satisfy his clientele and grow his income, Jacob is requesting his third loan from ALIDé. He buys his supplies in a marketplace in Bénin. This loan will allow him to grow tomatoes, maize, and hot peppers in order to expand his agricultural business and satisfy his clientele. His first loans were correctly reimbursed.

loans.use: to grow tomatoes, maize, and hot peppers.

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe works hard to support her family.   She has a business selling firewood in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from clothing sales.  Ma. Fe is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy more firewood to sell to her customers. 

Ma. Fe has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy firewood to resell

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina's main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. She is 41 years old, married and has 4 children. She is from Clarin and been 14 years in farming, earning an amount of PHP 3,000 a month.   In 2007, Divina joined GDMPC. 

Divina is requesting a loan of PHP 4000, which will be used to pay for labor cost in harvesting. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to pay for labor cost in harvesting

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a 50-year-old married woman. She is an active and talented lady who excels in the work of sewing. She has seventeen years of experience in this field and has gotten a lot of appreciation from her community. She wants to fulfill the needs of her family through all her hard work.  

Shamim is a mother of three children, among them two are school-going. She requested a loan of Rs 20,000 to buy a new stitching machine with reels of threads, and buttons and zippers in different colors to meet up with the increasing demand without delay. She dreams for her children's bright future and desires to spend part of the profits on her children’s education. She is very much thankful to Kashf for its support.

loans.use: buy a sewing machine and sewing supplies

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en:
Oliver is married and has 1 child.  He is 34 years old and lives in Mansabay Alto, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental.

Oliver sells hypochlorite (chemical for removing stains) to earn a living and has had this business for 7 years. Each month, he earns PHP 9,000 doing this type of work. Oliver has requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to pay for containers of hypochlorite.  

Oliver has been a member of PMPC for 4 years.  In the future, he hope to improve his living condition and to save for the improvement of his business.

loans.use: buy hypochlorite to resell

location.town: Plaridel-Mansabay Alto, Lopez Jaena , Misamis Occi

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith, 33-year old, is a married entrepreneur who lives in Tinac-laan, Clarin.  She is earning income from her transport service business, which she started almost 8 years ago.  She earn PHP 7,000 a month. 

To improve business, Judith borrowed an amount of PHP 15,000 from GDMPC micro credit, which she just joined recently, to obtain accessories and tires.  She’s hopeful of the possibility of expanding her business before long.

loans.use: buy motorcycle accessories and tires

loans.name: Tea

texts.en:
Tea is from the village of Tsilkani in East Georgia. She is 24 years old and lives with her husband, 2-year-old son and mother-in-law, who is a pensioner. The family is involved in an agricultural business. In particular, they have a small dairy farm with two milk cows, whose milk is used in cheese production. The cheese is sold in the capital city.  In addition, Tea has a greenhouse where cucumbers are grown. The harvested products are sold in the capital city's open market as well.  Tea also works as a worker for a private company and gets a monthly salary.

Tea requested credit for the start-up of a grocery store. She has constructed a small building for the store. It is located near her house. With the requested credit she will purchase grocery products for resale. According to her estimations, her store will work well, as there are no other similar store in the area. Also she will attract clients with quality service and a wide assortment of products. This will increase the income for the family and the family members will improve their living conditions.

loans.use: buy grocery items to sell

loans.name: Ma. Sanny

texts.en:
Ma. Sanny is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store and restaurant business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 12 years.  

Ma. Sanny is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell in her general store like soft drinks, canned goods, sugar, etc. and ingredients for her restaurant business.

Ma. Sanny has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: restock her general store and restaurant

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
Rolando is from Aguada, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. He is 43 years old.  He is married and has 2 children. 

Rolando raises rice. During harvests, he will produce rice then sell it.  He has been in his business for 7 years and earns PHP 25,000 a month from these activities. In 2011, Rolando joined GDMPC. 

Rolando is requesting a loan of PHP 35,000, which will be used to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for the next crop. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business for house renovation.

loans.use: buy fertilizers and seedlings

loans.name: Mely

texts.en:
Mely works hard to support her family.  She has a business selling shoes in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from clothing sales.  Mely is borrowing PHP 29500 through NWTF to buy more shoes and ready-to-wear clothing to sell in her stall.

Mely has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy shoes and clothing to resell

loans.name: Sera

texts.en:
Sera is a resident of the Malindi area of Coast province in Kenya. She is a married mother of four school-going children. Sera owns rental houses, a business that she has been running for four years. Besides this, the family also gets some income from a car hire business.

Sera learned about Milango from a friend and joined the institution with an aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business.  The challenge she has been facing is bad debts arising from those who delay rent payments.

Sera is applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenyan shillings to renovate her rental houses. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve on the living standard of the family.  She aspires to own other houses in the future and to pay for her children’s upkeep with a little ease.

loans.use: renovate her rental houses

loans.name: Yasmina Calletana

texts.es:
El Sauce es un bello municipio de occidente rodeado de montañas florecidas por la temporada de invierno donde abunda la leche y cuajada que producen sus habitantes.

En él hay muchas personas que se caracterizan por ser trabajadoras y luchadoras como es el caso de Yasmina una joven de 32 años, casada, madre de dos niños en edad escolar, se dedica a laborar como profesora de primaria desde hace 12 años, labor que tiene un gran mérito porque son personas con gran espíritu para enseñar y preparar a grandes profesionales que son el futuro de nuestro país.

Gracias a su profesión hoy tiene su propia vivienda la que ha ido mejorando poco a poco con la ayuda de créditos y la que quiere ir ampliando para brindarles un buen patrimonio a sus hijos, por tal motivo solicita este crédito para la compra de ladrillos, cemento, arena y cerámica con el fin de construir la cocina de dicha vivienda.
Agradece a KIVA y Ceprodel por el apoyo brindado a través de estos préstamos que le han ayudado a mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y espera que en futuro le sigan ayudando.
texts.en:
El Sauce is a beautiful western municipality surrounded by flowering mountains during the winter season and whose inhabitants produce large quantities of milk and milk curds.

Many of the inhabitants of El Sauce are known for their hardworking and fighting spirit, as is the case with Yasmina, who is 32 years old, married and the mother of two school-aged children.  Yasmina has taught primary school for 12 years, which is a profession she believes is of great worth and requires people with a great spirit for teaching and preparing the professionals that are the future of her country.

Thanks to her profession she now has her own home, which she has been gradually improving with the help of loans and which she wants to continue expanding in order to leave a good inheritance to her children.  For this purpose she is requesting this loan to buy bricks, cement, sand and ceramic tile in order to build the kitchen.

Yasmina is grateful to Kiva and Ceprodel for the support they have given her through these loans that have helped her improve the living conditions of her family, and she hopes that they will continue to help her in the future.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand and ceramic tile.

loans.name: César Del Carmen

texts.es:
En temporada de Noviembre y Diciembre es bonito visitar El Sauce, ir sobre la carretera entre montañas florecidas de Madroños blancos, el cual es el árbol nacional de Nicaragua y que rico es sentir aquel aroma natural y puro de esa flor que se acostumbra a adornar a la virgen María los siete de diciembre donde se celebra la gritería.
En este pueblo lleno de tradiciones religiosas habita César un señor de 43 años que se dedica a laborar como operario y vigilante para una empresa en dicho municipio, labor que le permite llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar e ir mejorando poco a poco su vivienda bajo sus posibilidades.
Dada las circunstancias en las que trabaja que la mayor parte es de noche ha tratado de darle mayor seguridad a su vivienda para que su esposa la cual queda sola no corra peligro, es por tal motivo que todos sus créditos han sido para ese fin. Hoy está solicitando este crédito para cerrar con pared el patio de su casa con el cual comprará materiales como hierro, ladrillos, cemento y pago de mano de obra.
Como hombre religioso confía en Dios y la Virgen María que su solicitud sea aprobada para llevar a cabo su objetivo, ya que solamente con la ayuda de estos créditos se pueden cumplir sueños en la vida.
texts.en:
November and December is a beautiful time to visit El Sauce and go along roads that lay between mountains covered with flowering Madroños, the national tree of Nicaragua. It's wonderful to smell the natural and pure aroma of the flower which is used to decorate the Virgin Mary on the 7th December when the day of the Immaculate Conception is celebrated. 

In this town, full of religious traditions, lives César, a 43 year old man who works as a machine operator and security guard for a company in the above mentioned area. This work allows him to provide for his house and improve his house little by little, according to his possibilities.

Given the circumstances of his work which require him to work during the night, he has tried to make his house as secure as possible so that his wife who stays in alone, isn't in danger. It's for this reason that all his loans have been requested for this purpose. Today he is requesting this loan to buy materials like iron, bricks, cement and to pay workers to block off his house's patio with a wall.  

As he is a religious man, he trusts in God and the Virgin Mary that his request will be accepted to carry out his objective since he can only make his dreams come true in life with the help of these loans.

loans.use: to buy iron, bricks, cement and to pay workers

loans.name: Mayra Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Mayra Isabel es originaria del municipio de san Juan de Limay que  pertenece al departamento de Estelí ,está ubicado en la zona oeste a 42 km de distancia del departamento , está zona es conocida como ganadera .

Doña Mayra trabaja en un centro estatal de san Juan de Limay desde hace 7 años en el área de limpieza, es conocida como una persona honrada y trabajadora, su núcleo familiar está compuesto por tres personas su esposo y sus dos hijos, uno de ello es mayor de edad y otro estudia secundaria, su principal deseo es preparar a su hija ya que ella no lo pudo realizar ni su otro hijo por el factor económico.

Solicita el crédito porque desea mejorar su vivienda  ya que no está en buenas condiciones y necesita comprar hiero, alambre de amarre, cemento, arena y pagar la mano de obra, ella espera que con el financiamiento que le brinde Ceprodel,pueda realizarle las mejoras a su casa y tener un techo saludable para su familia.
texts.en: Mayra Isabel is from the municipality of San Juan de Limay that belongs to Estelí Department and is located in the western part 42 kilometers from the department; it’s a zone that’s noted for raising cattle.  Mayra has worked in the sanitation department of a state institution in San Juan de Limay for 7 years.  She’s known as an honest, hardworking person.  Her nuclear family consists of three people: her husband and two children.  One of them is an adult and the other attends secondary school.  Her main wish is to prepare her daughter since neither she nor her other son were able to due to the economic factor.  She requests the loan because she wants to improve her house which isn’t in good condition.  She needs to buy rebar, tie-down straps, cement and sand and to pay labor costs.  She hopes that with the help Ceprodel can give her to do improvements at home and have a healthful home for her family.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Vedaste

texts.en: Vedaste is 22 years old. He sells wood and has been selling wood for four years. With the loan, he wants to get more wood to sell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: To buy more timber and wood for sale.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her food vending business.

Angelita has been in this business for five years. Angelita earns additional income from selling roasted whole pig.

Angelita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is 30 years old. She sells foodstuffs and has been running the business for eight years. She would like to get a loan to have more peanuts, rice and cooking oil for sale. The profits from the business will be used for reinvesting in the business.

loans.use: To buy more peanuts, rice and cooking oil for sale.

loans.name: Zina

texts.en:
Zina is 53 years old. She lives in Akhmeta district with her husband. The family runs an agricultural business. Zina’s husband brings wood from the forest in his truck and sells it locally during the winter, when wood is more expensive. In addition, Zina is involved in a livestock rising business and sells piglets and calves locally at a good price. Zina and her husband are very hard-working and do their best to improve their living conditions. 

Zina requested a loan to purchase tires for the truck. After the truck is renovated with new tires, Zina’s husband will be able to bring wood intensively from the forest. It will increase the income for their family.

loans.use: to purchase tires for the truck.

loans.name: Pinky

texts.en:
Pinky is 40 years old and married with two children. Pinky works very hard to provide for them.

Pinky runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of groceries to sell.

Pinky has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. 

In the future Pinky would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Con 46 años de edad Paulina se caracteriza por ser una persona con caracter. Tiene un matrimonio con Cadeón con quien trajo al mundo a sus 3 hijos Kevin, Andre y karina. Asimismo posee una vivienda hecha a base de material noble. El negocio al que se dedica es la venta de ropa y calzados, pues considera muy rentable edbido a que esta mercadería son productos no perecibles, eso facilita la recuperación de su capital. Dentro de la mercadería que posee más acogida están las zapatillas de nylon, por ser muy practicos para el uso en el campo llegando a convertirse en una buena fuente de ingreso. De la misma manera, complementa su negocio con la venta de ropa para damas caballeros y niños.
Tiene en mente para la temporada de fin de año solicitar el doble de su usual pedido por ser una fecha en que los comercios de su localidad presentan un incremento favorable en las ventas, por eso desea mas adelante abir una tienda similar en un distrito más poblado de su zona para que sus hijos puedan tener más ganan ias y así sus hijos puedan tener una educación eficiente. Por tanto con los 1,000 nuevos soles complementará su capital destinado para la compra de más mercadería para su negocio consistente en zapatillas, pantalones jeans y otros.
texts.en:
At age 54, Paulina is known for being a woman of good character.  She is married to Cadeón and together they have three children, Kevin, Andre, and Karina.  They also have a solidly built home.  She sells clothing and shoes and considers this to be a very profitable business, since this merchandise is not perishable and this makes it easier to recover her investment.  Her highest demand items are nylon slippers because they are very practical in the fields and they have become a good source of income.  She also sells men’s women’s, and children’s clothing.

She plans to double her normal year end order because this is when sales increase the most.  In the future she wants to open a similar store is a more populated district so that her children can get a good education.  She will use the 1,000 PEN to supplement her working capital and buy more merchandise, such as slippers, jeans, and other things.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Maxima Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Maxima del Socorro,   es una persona trabajadora, y emprendedora, atiende a diario desde las seis de la mañana hasta las nueve de la noche, los siete días de la semana en su pulperia, ella trabaja junto a su hijo
 
Solicita el  préstamo a nuestra institución para invertir en capital de trabajo, para la  compra granos básicos, gaseosas, embutidos. Esto con el propósito de comprar mas productos y  ofrecer variedad a sus clientes. y captar mas compradores. El crédito anterior lo invirtió en su negocio.

Agradece  a  ceprodel y Kiva, por la oportunidad y la confianza depositada en ella,esto le ha permitido incrementar su negocio y le permitira llevar el sustento a su hogar  e ir mejorando su condición de vida.
texts.en:
Maxima del Socorro is a hardworking, enterprising woman who works in her store from 6:00 am to 9:00 pm, seven days a week.  She works with her son.

She is asking for this loan so that she can increase her working capital and buy basic grains, carbonated drinks, and sausages so that she can offer more variety to her customers and increase their number.  She invested the money from the previous loan in her business.

She is grateful to CEPRODEL and Kiva for the opportunity and trust given her.  This has allowed her to grow her business, support her household, and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesús

texts.es:
Manuel de Jesús, reside en el municipio de Ticuantepe destacándose con  su negocio de comidería, refrescos naturales y venta de frutas desde hace 11 años,  nos comenta que para ayudarse mas en sus ingresos trabaja como empleado de guarda de seguridad, día de por medio. Por lo que sus días libres entre su esposa y el se encargan de manejar el negocio, ofrecen  sus servicios de comida principalmente por las tardes porque en esa hora hay más demanda. Con el tiempo ya es reconocido en la zona por lo que la mayoría de su clientela es fija y las personas que pasan,  ya que su negocio esta ubicado en una carretera transitada Ticuantepe  a la Concepción. 

El crédito que está solicitando lo invertirá en la compra de productos de alimentos  para la elaboración de comidas y refrescos, arroz, carne, aceite, queso, frijoles, coca cola, jugos enlatados, etc.

Espera que su crédito sea aprobado satisfactoriamente para así continuar elaborando los deliciosos platillos que tanto les agradan a sus clientes. Manifiesta que Ceprodel le ha servido de gran apoyo gracias a ellos ha engrandecido  su negocio y le da una mejor visión en el futuro.
texts.en: Manuel de Jesús lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe standing out with his business selling food, natural beverages and fruit for eleven years.  He comments that in order to earn a bit more money he works part-time as a security guard.  On his days off he and his wife tend to the business.  They provide food service mainly in the evenings when demand is highest.  As time has passed, he’s become well-known in the zone and most of his clientele is regular and also passersby since the business is located on a busy highway between Ticuantepe and La Concepción. The loan he’s requesting will be used to buy ingredients like rice, meat, oil, cheese, beans, Coca-Cola, canned juices, etc.to make the food and beverages.  He hopes that his loan will be satisfactorily approved so he can continue making the delicious dishes that his customers like so much.  He states that Ceprodel has been of great help and thanks to them the business has grown and he feels better about the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, a large frying pan, plastic chairs and a freezer.

loans.name: Faustino

texts.es:
Managua es una bella ciudad  de Nicaragua; Que se caracteriza  por sus tradiciones típicas.
Faustino es una persona de buenas costumbres y de buenos valores morales. Es luchador por su propio esfuerzo para su familia.

El actualmente trabaja para el estado y  se desempeña como ayudante de fontanería. Se presentó a CEPRODEL para solicitar un crédito porque necesita  comprar puertas y ventanas para su hogar ya que están  en mal estado. 

El agradece a CEPRODEL y KIVA por el apoyo que puedan brindarle otorgándole este financiamiento que ayudara a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Managua is a beautiful Nicaraguan city noted for its traditions.  Faustino is a person of good habits and moral values.  He makes an effort for his family and is currently employed by the state as a plumber.  He came by Ceprodel to request a loan because he needs to buy doors and windows for his house because they are in poor condition.  He thanks Ceprodel and Kiva for any support they may provide him by granting this loan that will help him improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Edgar Manuel

texts.es:
Niquinohono es una bella ciudad del departamento de Masaya que se conoce por su tradición y cultura como sus comidas típicas y costumbres, danzas. 

El señor Edgar Manuel es una persona casada con tres personas a su cargo, labora para una institución del estado como técnico agrónomo, desde hace doce años.

Esta solicitando un crédito a CEPRODEL, para realizar  gasto de reparación de un vehículo de un choque que tuvo, ya que es el medio que utiliza para trasladarse a Managua donde trabaja.
texts.en: Niquinohono is a beautiful city in Masaya Department known for its tradition and culture like its typical dishes, customs and dances.  Edgar Manuel is married with three people in his care.  He has been working as an agronomy technician for a state institution for 12 years.  He’s asking Ceprodel for a loan to repair his car after an accident he was in since he uses this means of transportation to get to his job in Managua.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Sovan

texts.en:
Sovan is 52 years old. She is widowed and resides with six children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in public transportation for more than a year, earning approximately $10 daily. Three of her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about $10 each day. 

Because the present motorbike is old, Sovan is requesting a loan of $650 to purchase a new motorbike for hauling the tuk tuk trailer (a 'tuk tuk' is a motorcycle and trailer used for transporting people). This purchase will help her reduce reparation expenses and generate more income for the family. 

In the future, Sovan would like to purchase a car to run the taxi service and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her house to make it much stronger and convenient for the family.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike for hauling the tuk tuk trailer.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with two children, both of whom attend school. She is looking after her mother.
She has been selling chips, fish and rice from door to door at retail for two years, working seven days a week. She does not have any other source of income.
She has requested a loan of UGX 1,300,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to stock more sacks of Irish potatoes, rice, spices, charcoal and cooking oil. Her challenges include having to move from door to door and seasonality. Her dream is to own a big restaurant and also to get a permanent business premise. She joined MCDT to acquire more capital for her business. She rents a house with access to both electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of irish potatoes, rice, spices, charcoal and cooking oil

loans.name: Narhol

texts.en:
Narhol is married and has one child who is an adult. She always wanted to provide him with good education and since her husband’s income is not enough to provide the family with a good quality of life, Narhol decided to start new business dealing with animal husbandry in order to generate an income with which she can contribute to her home’s finances. 

She studied on the course ‘To get ahead’ run by a women's organization and got enough business skills. Her child will help her with her business. She will be very successful business woman as she is hardworking and smart. She is asking for a loan of 4000 TJS to buy cattle to set up the new business. She will get through everything, using the loan and her business will go on to be a source of income, so that her family can have a good quality of life and better financial opportunities to progress. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle to set up a new business

loans.name: Jaridini

texts.en:
Jaridini has five grown children, one of whom attends school.  She is a poultry farmer in Malindi, Kenya, which she has been doing for five years.  Jaridini receives additional income from rentals. 

Jaridini is requesting a loan for 21,100 KES, which she will use to buy chicks, drugs and chicken feeds.  She was introduced to Milango by her friends The challenges in her business are disease, the high cost of poultry feeds, and drugs, and the effect of low seasons. Her future ambition is to increase the stock of animals on her poultry farm.

loans.use: to purchase chicks, drugs, and chicken feeds.

loans.name: Ermintancia

texts.en:
Ermintancia is 49 years old and married with nine children.

Ermintancia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling tobacco in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional tobacco to sell.

Ermintancia has borrowed and paid for two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the business buying and selling tobacco for five years and also earns an income from farming tobacco and sugarcane.

Ermintancia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional tobacco to sell.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Evelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling tobacco in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending and raising pigs. Evelyn is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of tobacco to sell in her tobacco selling business.

Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of tobacco to sell.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Lina works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Lina is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy additional items like pants, blouses, foot-wear and other clothing.

Lina has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items like pants, blouses, foot-wear and other clothing.

loans.name: Casimera

texts.en:
Casimera is a farmer from Talibon, Bohol in the Philippines. She has been in the farming business, together with her husband, for almost 20 years. She grows rice in their field.

Casimera is asking for a loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for the farm. With this loan, she and her husband will be able to grow and harvest a good quality of crops. In the future, Casimera dreams of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for the farm.

loans.name: Gideon

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Gideon works hard to support his family.

He has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig-fattening. Gideon is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of his motorcycle.

Gideon has been sustaining his business activities through his past nine loans from NWTF. He hopes that his hard work will help him attain his dream: to save enough money so he can afford to send his children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of his motorcycle.

loans.name: Francoise

texts.en: Francoise is 30 years old. She sells different items in her store and has been in the business for one year. She would like to get a loan to buy more rice, cooking oil and potatoes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to make savings.

loans.use: To buy more rice, cooking oil and potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
Tamara comes from the village of Akhalsheni in the Khelvachauri District of Georgia. She is 24 years old and lives with her husband. He is a worker and gets a monthly salary. 

Tamara and her husband cultivate a plot of land where citrus trees are grown. They do all relevant agricultural work to ensure a good harvest. The harvested products are sold at the local open market.  

Tamara requested a loan to purchase five calves. She will raise and sell them for a higher price. This will increase the family income. The profits from this new enterprise will improve the family's living conditions, as Tamara plans to renovate her old and damaged house. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To purchase calves to raise and sell.

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es: La Sra. Maria tiene 49 años y es casada con 2 hijos de las edades de 19 y 13 años, se dedica  a la  venta de leche y queso ya que tiene ganado vacuno, ella vive en la zona de Quillacollo, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  Maria utilizara  este préstamo para la compra de una vaca lechera y forraje para su ganado,  Su razón para solicitar este préstamo es no tiene dinero y necesita incrementar la producción de leche y así de esta manera producir más quesos y mejorar sus ingresos económicos, Maria enfrenta retos en su negocio que son el forraje que debe comprar cada cierto tiempo, y  utilizara los beneficios mejorar su ganado y la producción de leche,  sueña con comprar otras vacas lecheras para mejorar su producción y por ende sus ingresos economicos.
texts.en: María, 49, is married and has two children who are 19 and 13 years of age.  She works selling milk and cheese since she has cattle.  She lives in the Quillacollo zone and this loan is her second sequence in the institution.  María will use it to buy a dairy cow and forage for her cattle.  Her reason for requesting the loan is that she does not have any money and she needs to increase milk production to produce more cheese and improve her income.  The business challenge María faces is that she must buy forage every so often and she will use profits to improve her cattle and milk production.  She dreams with buying more dairy cows to improve production and thus her income.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Saragoza

texts.es:
De 45 años Saragoza comparte una vida conyugal con su esposo Isaac, tiene 2 hijos ya mayores de edad que desarrollan estudios superiores fuera de su ciudad.
Algo agotada de las actividades agrícolas debido a hallarse muy distante de su comunidad, decidió aportar al crecimiento de la economía familiar con la apertura de una tienda de abarrotes desde hace 2 años.
Gracias a su negocio ha logrado apoyar a sus hijos en los gastos que generan sus estudios superiores, haciendo  que se sienta muy motivada por los logros que va obteniendo. Cabe destacar que el hecho de tener su negocio ubicado en la misma esquina de la plaza le beneficia de manera considerable ya que la afluencia de clientela es casi constante. Para continuar con la buena venta de fin de año tiene en mente reabastecer su negocio con la compra de panotones y víveres de mayor demanda, esperando así obtener una buena ganancia al igual que otros comercios locales.
Sus objetivos a futuro apuntan a la construcción de una vivienda con cemento y ladrillos, esperando sea para el futuro de sus hijos pues espera que culminado sus estudios superiores retornen a su localidad para aportar con el progreso comunitario. Este viene a ser su préstamo número 14, se siente contenta puesto que desde su inicio en MFP ha logrado mantener un buen equilibrio económico en sus actividades. Comenta que le agrada mucho trabajar de manera conjunta con su banco comunal debido a ser una persona muy sociable.
Con los 500 nuevos soles complementará su capital destinado para la compra de panetones y otros para la campaña de fin de año.
texts.en:
Saragoza, 45, shares a married life with her husband, Isaac.  She has two adult children who are completing higher education outside the city.  Somewhat exhausted by the agricultural work located quite far from her community, she decided to contribute to her family’s economic growth by opening a grocery store two years ago.

Thanks to her business she’s managed to cover the expenses generated by her children’s higher education which makes her feel very motivated by the accomplishments she’s been attaining.  It’s worth mentioning that having her business located on the corner of the square is very beneficial because customer flow is almost constant.  In order to continue with good end-of-year sales she needs to restock the store with panettones and food items in high demand hoping to earn good profits like other local businesses.

Her future goal is to build a brick and cement house that she hopes will be for her children who once they complete their higher education will return home to contribute to their community.  This will be her loan #14 and she feels happy because since she started with MFP she’s been able to maintain good economic stability in her activities.  She comments that she likes working as a team in her communal bank because she’s a very sociable person.  She will use the 500 new soles to add to her capital earmarked to buy panettones and others for the end-of-year sales campaign.

loans.use: to buy panettones.

loans.name: Foska

texts.es: La Sra. Foska sigue con la misma actividad de la venta de ropa, cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que creció en su actividad, y en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de ropa de temporada, por mayor ya que esta época navideña tiene mucha de demanda y es también donde tiene mas ingresos economicos.
texts.en: Foska continues with the same activity selling clothes.  She relates that she did well with the previous loan since the business grew and on this occasion she’s requesting the loan to buy seasonal clothes at wholesale because demand is high during the Christmas season and it’s also when she earns the most income.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothes at wholesale.

loans.name: Leonita

texts.en:
Leonita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell to her customers.

NWTF is presenting Leonita's business profile again for funding another loan in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Chinyavu

texts.en:
Chinyavu is a 41-year-old married woman. She has five children with ages ranging from 4 to 22 years. She describes herself as a social and responsible woman. 

Chinyavu operates a grocery store where she sells vegetables and fruits. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located at a viable business area and her primary customers are local residents . She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. 

She will use the 35000 KES loan to buy vegetables to sell. Her business goal is to expand her business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will run another grocery store. This is second loan with SMEP DTM after taking a previous loan of 35000 KES which she managed to pay succesfully.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits to sell.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina works hard to support her family. Gina is married and has a funeral services business in the Philippines.

Gina requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her funeral business.

Gina has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Gina would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her funeral business

loans.name: Epiphanie

texts.en: Epiphanie is 27 years old. She sells cabbages and potatoes. She would like a loan to add more potatoes and cabbages to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: To buy more cabbages and potatoes to sell

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 35 years old and married with two children.

Gina is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Gina requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and medicines for her pigs.

Gina has been raising pigs for four years and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF and more recently, from Kiva to sustain her business. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: of saving money to expand her business

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon runs a sari-sari or variety store business in her place in Talibon, Bohol. She has been in the business for almost three years now.

Corazon is asking for a loan to buy dry goods, noodles, snack foods, chips, soda, beverages and other items. Through this loan, she will be able to attract more customers and buyers to her store, thus increasing her sales and profit.

In the future, Corazon hopes to expand her business so that she will be able to support the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy dry goods, noodles, snack foods, chips, soda, beverages and other items

loans.name: Felecidad

texts.en:
Felecidad is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food production business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

NWTF is listing Felecidad's request for another loan in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Nyamjav

texts.en:
Nyamjav, 54 years old, lives with her husband and son in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia's capital. She has earned a living by running a tailoring business for the last seven years. Before opening her own business, Nyamjav worked as a tailor in a private company where she accumulated vast experience. She makes Mongolian traditional dresses and is very proud of her products. Her husband earns a living by transporting heavy machinery.

In order to expand her business, Nyamjav needs an automobile which will help her deliver her goods. She is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to buy a car. This will allow her to earn more money and increase customer satisfaction because she will be able to deliver her products more quickly. She dreams of establishing her own tailoring factory in the future and believes that one day she will be paid back for all her hard work..

loans.use: to buy an automobile.

loans.name: Gertrude

texts.en:
Gertrude is married and has six children, three of whom attend school. She lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She has been selling fish in the market at retail for eight years, working six days a week. She generates additional  income from selling soda and other soft drinks.

Gertrude is requesting a loan from MCDT-SACCO for 1,000,000 UGX, which she will use to stock more baskets of fish to sell. She joined MCDT because MCDT is interested in empowering women in all spheres.  Her challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her dream is to expand her businesses and accumulate profits that will enable her to access piped water and to become a wholesaler. She currently has access to electricity but not piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: to purchase more baskets of fish.

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en: Vestine is 48, married, and blessed with four children. She has been selling maize for the past six years. With this KIVA loan she wants to purchase more maize for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more maize for sale.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
For almost 20 years now, Editha has earned a living  farming rice with her husband. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for her farm and additional piglets to raise.

In the future, Editha hopes to make her business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the farm and additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Florentina

texts.es:
La señora Florentina es una persona honesta, responsable y trabajadora, vive con  sus 2 hijos en una comunidad de Choluteca al sur de Honduras.
Doña Florentina tiene un negocio que es la fabricación  de  pan y necesita el   préstamo para la compra de harina, manteca, azúcar, leche, soda, huevos y leña porque tiene muchos clientes que le han encargado bastante este producto.
Doña Florentina con el préstamo espera que sus ventas  aumenten gracias a que contara con más materia prima y con las ganancias cubrir un poco sus necesidades y las de su familia.
Doña Florentina sueña  que de aquí a 2 años  su negocio este posicionado como  la repostería  más grande y  reconocida de su colonia, para poder seguir apoyando a  sus hijos  a que se conviertan en personas de bien y con mejores oportunidades.


Choluteca, Honduras – Noviembre   2012
texts.en:
Señora Florentina is an honest, responsible, and hardworking person. She lives with her two children in the community of Choluteca in the south of Honduras. 

Florentina has a business making breas and she needs a loan to to buy wheat, butter, sugar, milk, baking soda, eggs and firewood because her customers have ordered a lot of her product.  With the loan, Florentina hopes to increase her sales thanks to the fact that she will have more ingredients. With the profits she will be able to cover her and her families necessities a little.

Florentina dreams that in two years her business will become the biggest and most well known bakery in the neighborhood. This will allow her to continue supporting her children so that they become good people with better opportunities. 

Choluteca, Honduras – November   2012

loans.use: to buy wheat, butter, sugar, milk, baking soda, eggs, and firewood for her business.

loans.name: Naome

texts.en: Naome is 23 years old. She is married and has two children, ages 4 and 7.  They both attend school. Naome sells potatoes and vegetables. She has been running this business for one year. With this loan, she wants to add more potatoes and vegetables for resale. She will use the profits from the business to reinvest and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more potatoes and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Natela

texts.en:
Natela is from the village of Nukriani in the Sighnaghi district. She is 56 years old and lives with her husband and two grown sons. Agricultural activities are the main source of income for her family. Natela has eight milk cows and four calves. She sells her products to local dairy product retailers. Along with the dairy, Natela is also busy with an animal husbandry business. She raises calves and sells them for a higher price. She is a very hard-working woman with a lot of experience in her work. 

Natela requested a loan to purchase more calves. She will raise the calves during the winter and sell them by spring for a higher price. Natela will get additional income and will use it for purchasing new household goods, in order to improve the family's living conditions. Also part of the loan will be used for renovating her house, as it is old and in bad condition. Natela awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase more calves and pay for house renovation services.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has three children, all of whom attend school. She also looks after her parents.

Justine has been operating a beauty salon in rented premises for fifteen years, working seven days a week. She is also involved in farming as an additional source of income.

Justine has requested a loan of UGX 1,000,000 from MCDT-SACCO to purchase more hair products, braids, oils, and hair chemicals for resale and for use in her salon. Justine's main challenges include seasonality and an unstable power supply. Her dream is to have a big salon and make profits that can enable her to build rental houses. She joined MCDT because the need to save and the old members' hard work inspired her. Justine lives in her own house with access to electricity but no piped water.  Her major monthly expense is school fees.

loans.use: To buy more hair products, oils, braids, and hair chemicals

loans.name: Pascasie

texts.en: Pascasie is 25 years old. She sells different items in a boutique. With this loan, she wants to add more mineral water, juices, and sodas for resale. The profits from her business will be used for savings until her children go to school.

loans.use: To buy more mineral water, juices, and sodas for resale.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
La Joven Gabriela tiene 22 años de edad, es una persona muy responsable, honesta y trabajadora, vive  con  su  esposo  y una  hija en una comunidad al sur de Hondura
Gabriela tiene un negocio que es la venta  de  tortillas y necesita el préstamo para la compra de maíz, leña y cal, con el préstamo ella espera tener más producto que ofrecer para cubrir los pedidos que a diario recibe de sus clientes. 
Gabriela con los ingresos obtenidos desea mejorar un poco su situación económica y  la de su familia. En el futuro ella espera que su negocio crezca gracias a la inversión hecha en el mismo y sueña con ver a su hija graduada y convertida en persona de bien y con mejores oportunidades en la vida.


Choluteca, Honduras –  Noviembre del  2012
texts.en:
Gabriela is a young 22-year-old woman. She is very responsible, honest, and hardworking. She lives with her husband and one daughter in a community in the south of Honduras. 

Gabriela has a business selling tortillas and she needs a loan to buy corn, firewood, and lime. With the loan, she hopes to have more product to offer in order to cover the daily orders she received from her customers. Gabriela wants to improve her and her family's financial situation little by little with the income she makes. 

In the future, she hopes her business will grow thanks to the investment she has made in it and she dreams that she will see her daughter graduate and become a good person with better opportunities in life. 

Choluteca, Honduras –  November  2012

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, and lime for her business.

loans.name: Jerome

texts.en: Jerome is 29 years old. He sells rice, cooking oil, and fresh milk. With the loan, he wants to buy more milk, rice, and cooking oil for sale. The profits from the business will be used to renovate the house.

loans.use: To buy more milk, rice, and cooking oil for resale.

loans.name: Alvaro Jesus

texts.es:
El joven Álvaro tiene la edad de 28 años, es casado y tiene un hijo el cual está en edad escolar, vive en el municipio de Chichigalpa un lugar al oeste de Nicaragua conocido por su producción de caña y azúcar, además de ser uno de los lugares más caliente de Nicaragua.
El joven Álvaro cuenta con negocio de venta de refrescos en su casa de habitación, los fondos que se le facilitaron en la institución Ceprodel y Kiva fueron destinados precisamente para continuar trabajándolos en su venta de refrescos ya que cerca de donde ellos viven llegan la cuadrilla de trabajadores de la empresa Ingenio san Antonio a cortar caña, el negocio lo maneja su esposa ya que el nos manifestaba que está incapacitado por motivos de su enfermedad ya que presenta insuficiencia renal crónica y por tal razón dejo de trabajar y es debido a su estado de salud que su esposa es la que maneja el pequeño negocio.
El negocio lo inicio con el crédito que le fue facilitado por Ceprodel y es gracias a estos préstamos que el continua desarrollando poco a poco su venta de refrescos atendiendo a más trabajadores del campo.
texts.en:
Álvaro is 28 years old, married, and has a school-aged son.  He lives in Chichigalpa, a place in eastern Nicaragua, known for its sugar cane and sugar production.  It’s also one of the hottest parts of Nicaragua.

Álvaro has a soft drink business in his home.  He used the money from CEPRODEL and Kiva toward his soft drink business.  The crews from the Ingenio San Antonio Company go to cut sugar cane near his home.  His wife manages the business because he is incapacitated because of illness and has chronic kidney problems, so he had to stop working due to his health.

He started the business with a loan he got through CEPRODEL and thanks to it, he is able to continue developing his sales a little at a time, while serving more of the field workers.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Binish

texts.en:
Ms. Binish is a 32-year-old married woman.  She has been successfully doing a business of hand-embroidery for the last eight years. She fulfills the demands and standards of her customers very well. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. Her husband has furniture work and earns insufficient income to support his family alone. 

She is a mother of four children and one of her children is not able to speak and listen. Binish is working hard to save money for the treatment of her loved one. She is also motivated to provide for her family. As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of Rs 25,000 to buy spools of thread with packs of sequins, pearls and glittering material. She then would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently.  She wishes to spend part of her profit on the treatment of her child.

loans.use: to buy spools of thread, packs of sequins, pearls and glittering material.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy petrol for sale, jerrycans, and cement for building a storage area.

loans.name: Valantina

texts.en:
Valantina lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children, two of whom are attending school. She is not looking after any additional family member.

She has been selling secondhand clothes in the market, retail, for the last two and half years and works six days a week. She also sews clothes for sale to earn additional income.

Valantina has requested a loan of UShs 1,000,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to buy more used clothes for sale. Her challenges include seasonality. Her dream is to start buying lots of bales and accumulate profits that will enable her to build a house. She joined MCDT because the organisation helps women to develop. She rents a house without access to electricity or piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes for resale

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es:
La joven Flor  tiene  30 años de edad. Vive en el municipio Chichigalpa, un lugar en el oeste de Nicaragua, conocido por su producción de caña de azúcar y licorera. Es uno de los lugares más caliente de Nicaragua.
El papa de la joven Flor  trabajo por unos años en el corte de caña, posteriormente  falleció hace 5 años por problemas de insuficiencia renal crónica. Siendo ella en este momento la beneficiara por su papá.
La joven se dedica a la venta de ropa interior, pantalones, camisas de varón, blusas para damas, trajes de niñas, etc.  pero lo hace de forma ambulante, siendo sus clientes trabajadores del campo del ingenio san Antonio 
El destino del crédito fue para invertir en el pequeño negocio.
La joven Flor  manifestó que  los fondos que se dieron los ha utilizado para la compra de mercadería  para su pequeño negocio, además de apoyar a sus hijos.  Agradeciendo a CEPRODEL  y Kiva ya de esta manera está mejorando su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Flor is 30 years old and lives in Chichigalpa, a place in western Nicaragua, known for its sugar cane and licorice production.  It’s one of the hottest areas in Nicaragua.

Flor’s father worked cutting sugar cane for a few years and passed away five years ago due to chronic kidney problems.  She was his beneficiary at the time.

She sells undergarments, pants, men’s shirts, ladies’ blouses, girls’ outfits, etc, but she does this on foot and her customers are the field workers from the Ingenio San Antonio Company.

She will use the money from this loan to invest in her small business.

Flor says that the funds will be used to buy merchandise and help support her children.  She is grateful to CEPRODEL and Kiva and is improving her quality of life through this means.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es:
El señor Juan José Martínez en el casco urbano de Condega, en el departamento de Estelí a unos 30 km al norte.

 Este clientes es comerciante y se dedica a la ventas de verduras en general y venta de carne de pollo al por menor, este cliente tiene un  modulo en el mercado municipal de Condega donde ofrece sus productos a los clientes. El señor Martínez Tercero tiene aproximadamente unos 15 años de dedicarse a esta labor siendo muy conocido en el mercado

Su núcleo familiar esta compuesto por su esposa la cual también es comerciante y se dedica a la venta de verduras en otro modulo y tiene dos hijas las que ya son independientes.

El señor Tercero Martínez solicita un préstamo para comprar verduras variadas tales como tomates, cebollas, chiltomas, repollos, etc. Y de esta manera aumentar si inventario y lograr abastecer la demanda de las clientela lo que vendrá a aumentar las ventas de este cliente y pretende aumentar sus ganancias, esto mejoraría su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Juan José Martínez is from the Condega urban area in the Estelí department, located 30 km to the north.

He is a merchant and sells vegetables and chicken.  He has a stall in the Condega municipal market where he offers his products to his customers.  Mr. Martínez Tercero has been doing this for about 15 years and is well known in the marketplace.

His family business includes his wife, who is also a merchant and sells vegetables by another means.  He also has two adult daughters on their own.
 
Mr. Martínez Tercero is asking for a loan to buy a variety of vegetables such as tomatoes, onions, peppers, cabbages, etc.  In this way he can increase his inventory and supply his customers’ demand, increase his sales and income.  This will improve his quality of life.

loans.use: Compra de verduras tales como tomates, cebollas, chiltomas, repollos, etc

loans.name: Pita

texts.fr: Pita est âgé de 51 ans et est marié à Clémentine, une marchande. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Pita n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Pita vit ensemble avec ses enfants et sa femme. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Il y a de cela vingt cinq ans que Pita exerce comme activité, l’agriculture. Pita fait aussi parallèlement à l'agriculture, l’élevage des porcins. Pita exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Pita s’approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue d’augmenter son fonds de roulement, Pita sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé, pour cultiver du maïs, du piment et de la tomate. Ce crédit lui servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de sa clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en: Pita is 51 years old and married to Clementine, a vendor.  The couple has three children, some in school and all of them in their care.  Pita did not attend school.  He lives with his children and his wife.  Together, the couple meets the different needs of the household.  Pita has been farming for 25 years.  He also raises pigs.  He is passionate about his work, which allows him to meet his needs and those of his children.  Pita gets his supplies in a region of Bénin.  In the hopes of meeting his customers’ demand and increasing his working capital, Pita is requesting his first loan through ALIDé in order to plant corn, peppers, and tomatoes.  This loan will help him to respond to the demands of his customers and to make more profits.

loans.use: to plant corn, peppers, and tomatoes.

loans.name: Rosaura

texts.es: Doña Rosaura  es madre soltera, tiene 39 años de edad, tiene tres hijas que son estudiantes y que aun dependen de su madre. Doña Rosaura se dedica a la venta de tortillas de harina desde hace seis años, el negocio lo aprendió cuando trabajo en una fabrica de elaboración de tortillas. Ella trabaja en conjunto con una de sus hijas, ellas elaboran las tortillas y luego salen a vender, comienzan desde las 5:00 A.M hasta las 5:00 P.M. Una de sus ventajas es que tiene mucha clientela pero se le dificulta andar ambulante sin un medio de transporte ya que tiene que lidiar con los cambios de clima. El préstamo que doña Rosaura solicita es para surtir su negocio en la compra de productos como ser: harina, huevos, sal, manteca, leña, entre otros y para que su lugar de trabajo este en mejores condiciones . El mayor  deseo de doña Rosaura es terminar de construir su casa para ya no seguir alquilando y una de sus metas es poder tener una fábrica de tortillas de harina bien instalada, para así aumentar sus ganancias y de esta forma mejorar la economía de su hogar.
texts.en:
Doña Rosaura is a 39 year-old single mother with three daughters, who are students and still dependent on her. She has been selling flour tortillas for the past six years. She learned the business when she worked in a tortilla-making factory. Now she works with one of her daughters. They make the tortillas and then go out to sell them beginning at 5 a.m. and work until 5 p.m. One of the advantages she has is that she attracts many customers, however it is difficult for her to sell as a street vendor without a means of transportation, because she has to deal with the changes in the weather.

The loan that Doña Rosaura is requesting is to stock her business by purchasing products such as flour, eggs, salt, lard and firewood, among other items. She also wants to see to it that her workspace is in better condition. Her greatest desire is to finish building her house so that she does not have to continue renting. One of her goals is to own a well-equipped tortilla factory and increase her earnings, thereby improving her household finances.

loans.use: to purchase flour, salt, lard, and other items.

loans.name: Toribia

texts.es: La Sra. Toribia sigue con la misma actividad de la agricultura, ya se dedica a esta actividad hace mucho tiempo, cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior credito, en esta ocacion solicita el credito para la compra de semillas para la siembra de maiz y lo que implica el preparado de la tierra, ya que mejoro su produccion, ella vende sus productos directamente del productor al consumidor.
texts.en: Sra. Toribia continues with her same work as a farmer, a job she has been doing for some time. She notes that she did well with the previous loan. At this time she is requesting another loan to purchase seeds to plant corn and to prepare the land in order to improve production. She sells her products directly from producer to consumer.

loans.use: to plant corn.

loans.name: Welem

texts.en:
Welem, age 38, married to Marlinda, age 29.  They have four children whose ages are between 14 years old and 8 months old.  Three children are attending school. 

Welem has been operating a kiosk business since 2007, using his own capital; it is located about 500 meters from his house. At the moment, Welem is seeking capital assistance to initiate a new business that is producing toilets. He is requesting a loan from TLM amounting of IDR 7,500,000 to purchase  materials such as cement and sand and also to add more kiosk stock, i.e., oil, sugar, snacks, instant noodles, etc. He believes that he can improve his income through the capital assistance provide by TLM.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as cement and sand to produce toilets.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida is a 37-year-old married woman. She has operated a general store for the last two years at the corner of her house. Her husband drives an auto rickshaw but his income is not sufficient to meet the daily expenses of the household. Abida is contributing to the family income to meet the needs of the five family members. 

She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of 15,000 PKR to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to cater to more customers at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to cater to more customers at her store.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es:
El señor Manuel tiene la edad de 53 años, es casado y vive en el municipio de Chichigalpa un lugar al oeste de Nicaragua conocido por su producción de caña y azúcar, además de ser uno de los lugares más caliente de Nicaragua.
Don Manuel desde hace 7 años salió afectado con insuficiencia renal crónica, ya que en ese momento su trabajo era en el campo. 
El crédito lo solicito para siembra de 3mz de frijoles en una finca que tiene a una distancia de 25km desde su casa hasta la finca, para llegar temprano al lugar tiene que salir a las 5 de la mañana y llega a las 7 de la mañana para iniciar su jornada de trabajo. El continúa trabajando en el campo porque tiene que mantener a su familia que consta de 5 personas (esposa, hija y 3 nietos).
El está muy agradecido con Ceprodel y Kiva porque gracias a los créditos puede acudir su cultivo y así obtener una buena cosecha.
texts.en:
Manuel is 53 years old, married, and lives in Chichigalpa, in western Nicaragua, known for its sugar cane and sugar production, and as being one of the hottest places in Nicaragua.

Manuel was affected by chronic kidney problems seven years ago and was a field worker at the time.

He is asking for this loan so that he can plant beans on some farmland 25 km from his home.  He must leave his home at 5:00 am so that he can arrive on location by 7:00 am to begin work.  He continues to work in the fields because he has to support his family of five (wife, daughter, and three grandchildren).

He is very grateful to CEPRODEL and Kiva because thanks to these loans he can tend his crops and have a good harvest.

loans.use: to pay for farming expenses.

loans.name: Hengky

texts.en:
Hengky is 35 years old and is married to Susanti, 30. They are blessed with two children who are attending school. Hengky owns a motorcycle repair shop and has been engaged in this business for seven years. In addition to repairing vehicles, he also provides spare parts for customers. This business is the primary livelihood for him to support his family.
To improve customer service, Hengky intends to purchase a new air compressor and more kinds of spare parts. He also wants to assist his wife starting up a business selling Christmas cookies. Therefore, he is requesting a loan from TLM amounting to IDR 12.500,000.

loans.use: to purchase a new air compressor, more kinds of spare parts and to assist his wife starting up a business selling Christmas cookies.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 29 years old man and is married to Rosalina, 27. They have a 5-year-old son, Yance, who is their only child.
