To make a living for his family, Simon works as a motor taxi driver and also sells petrol (gasoline). He lives in a rural area so this business enables him to generate income. The business is situated at his residence so his wife is willing to sell petrol. 

Simon must pay a repair shop when a part needs to be replaced. This situation affects his family because it reduces income for their daily needs. Simon has applied for a loan amounting to IDR 4,000,000 to purchase gasoline to be resold and for spare motorcycle parts.

loans.use: to purchase gasoline to be resold and to purchase spare parts for his motorbike.

loans.name: Vip Vip Group

texts.en:
Joseph, who is in his early 30s, is married with one baby. For four years now, Joseph has been earning a living by running a retail shop business. He works from 7 a.m. to 9 p.m. daily and is able to make a good profit per month. 

This will be his sixth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to purchase items needed for his business and to cover household expenses. He has paid back all his loans successfully. He is requesting a new loan to buy more shop stock to resell. His dream is to one day be able to be a wholesaler.

He will share this loan with his loan group " VIP " which totals 13 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase more shop stock to resell.

loans.name: Clelia

texts.es:
Clelia tiene 44 años, y su mayor motivos son sus dos hijos. Actualmente reside en Ayacucho. Posee una vivienda de adobe. Motivada e impulsada por el deseo de salir adelante dejó atrás la venta de pollos por una baja  demanda que éste tenía ocasionándole perdidas finales, es así como se inicia desde hace 20 años en la venta de comida y en la preparación de platos típicos de su región, siendo expendidos en una pequeña feria junto a otros comerciantes ubicado en el parque de su distrito.
Comenta que le agrada mucho su trabajo debido a que son pocas pero arduas las horas que requiere su negocio, logrando así poseer un negocio muy concurrido, no obstante existen días en que la lluvia ocasiona una baja concurrencia de clientela.
Al ser una madre emprendedora tiene planeado aperturar una pequeño establecimiento de corte y confección el cual le permita ganar dinero extra y mejorar su economía.
Todos sus objetivos y esfuerzos tienen un solo fin que son sus hijos para quienes espera a futuro adquirir un terreno en la cual espera iniciar la construcción de una vivienda a base de ladrillo y concreto. Este es su crédito número 3, al igual que sus compañeros concuerda que la base del progreso de su banco comunal es la responsabilidad y el orden. 
Con los 1,000 nuevos soles otorgados complementará su capital para la compra de una maquina de cocer y otros instrumentos con el objetivo de iniciar un pequeño negocio de corte y confección.
texts.en:
Clelia is 44 years old and her greatest driving force is her two children. Currently she lives in Ayacucho where she has a house made of adobe. Motivated by the desire to get ahead, she left behind her business selling chickens due to low demand, which left her with financial losses. That is why she started selling food and traditional regional dishes 20 years ago.  She sells in a small market next to other merchants, located in a park in her district.

Clelia notes that she enjoys her work. Although her business is demanding, it does not require too many hours, and she has established herself in a very busy area. Nevertheless, there are rainy days when she has fewer customers. Since she is a very enterprising mother she has been planning to open a small dressmaking establishment to earn extra money and improve her finances.

All of her plans and work have a single goal, that of insuring that her children have a future. She wants to acquire a piece of land on which she can start building a house made of bricks and concrete. This is her third loan. Along with other members of her communal bank, she agrees that the basis of progress is a sense of responsibility and order.

This loan of S/.1,000 will increase her capital so that she buy a sewing machine and other tools with the goal of opening a small dressmaking business.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and other tools with the goal of starting a small dressmaking business.

loans.name: Felix Pedro

texts.es:
El señor Félix  es una persona responsable, trabajadora y honesta, vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos en una comunidad de Choluteca al  sur de Honduras.
Don Félix  tiene un negocio de venta de peroles y de material de aluminio. El préstamo lo necesita para la compra de peroles, sartenes, azafates, cucharones y tortilleras. 
Don Félix  con el préstamo que se le brinde espera que las ventas de su negocio aumenten y poder cubrir un poco sus necesidades y la de su familia.
Don  Félix  espera que en unos años  su negocio crezca y seguir invirtiendo en él, para que en futuro sea más grande y poder seguir apoyando a su familia  para que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y se han personas de bien.
texts.en:
Felix is a responsible, hard-working and honest person. He lives with his wife and his three children in a community in Choluteca in the south of Honduras.

Felix has a business of the sale of pots and aluminum materials. He needs the loan to buy pots, frying pans, trays, ladles, and tortilla presses.

With the loan that will be provided to him, Felix hopes that the sales in his business grow and to be able to meet a few of his and his family’s needs.

Felix hopes that in a few years his business will grow and to continue investing in it, so that in the future it will be larger and be able to continue supporting his family so that his children finish their studies and become good people.

loans.use: to buy pots, frying pans, trays, ladles, and tortilla presses for his business.

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita earns a living through her pot-making business. She has been in the business for several years. Florita works hard to augment her income, so that she can provide for the needs of the family.

As of now, Florita wants to expand her business, but she lacks the financial resources to do so. She is asking for a loan to buy more material, such as clay, for pot-making. With this loan, Florita will be able to produce more pots, thus increasing her sales and profit.

loans.use: to buy more material, such as clay, for pot-making.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es:
EL socio Ruben pertenece al banco comunal “Mujeres Emprendedoras” de la ciudad del Cusco - Perú

El socio continua con su negocio de agencia de viajes,el socio vende diferentes tipos de paquetes turisticos como tours al Valle Sagrado,City Tours,Machupiucchu entre otros,el socio lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio ,el socio es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que el socio saca adelante a su familia.

EL socio solicito el credito para la compra de boletos turisticos para su negocio.

El socio se siente agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Ruben belongs to the Mujeres Emprendedoras communal bank in the city of Cusco, Perú.  He continues to work as a travel agent, he sells different types of tour packages such as to Sacred Valley, City Tours, Machu Picchu and others.  

Ruben has been in this business for years and he does well thanks to the effort he puts into his business each day, he is responsible and hardworking, this allows him to get his family ahead.

He requested the loan to buy touristic tickets for his business.

He is grateful for the loan, and he pledges to make his payments according to schedule.

loans.use: to buy touristic tickets for his business.

loans.name: Felix Pedro

texts.es:
El Señor  Félix  tiene 67 años de edad, es una persona responsable, trabajadora y honesta, vive con su esposa y sus 5 hijos en una comunidad al  sur de Honduras.
Don Félix su negocio es la pulpería, y necesita el préstamo para la compra de  refrescos, galletas, arroz, manteca, café, pan, azúcar, frijoles, papel higiénico, cubitos, aguas, etc. Con el préstamo  espera que las ventas de su negocio aumenten, al tener más productos para que ofrecer a los clientes y cubrir las necesidades de los mismos.
Don Félix desea que mejore un poco su estatus de vida y la de su  familia. En un futuro espera que su negocio crezca y su pulpería sea la más grande y reconocido de la zona,
Don Félix su sueño es seguir  apoyando a su familia, y que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y se conviertan en personas de bien, con valores y principios.


Choluteca, Honduras –  Noviembre   2012
texts.en:
Felix is 67 years old, he is a responsible person, hardworking and honest, he lives with his wife and five children in a community located in Southern Honduras.

Felix's business is a convenience store, and he needs the loan to buy soda, cookies, rice, lard, coffee, sugar, beans, toilet paper, ice, water, etc.

He hopes that his sales increase with the loan by having more products to offer to his clients and cover ther needs.

Felix wishes to improve his and his family's quality of life.  In the future he hopes that his business will grow and the convienece store becomes the biggest and more prestigious of the area.

Felix's dream is to continue supporting his family and that his children finish their studies and become good people with values and principles.

Choluteca, Honduras –  November  2012

loans.use: to buy soda, cookies, rice, lard, coffee, sugar, beans, toilet paper, ice, water, etc.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children, all of whom attend school. She is also looking after additional members of her family (brother and sister).

For the last twenty years, Margaret has been selling in a shop, at retail, groundnuts and beans. She works seven days a week. She also has rental houses as another source of income.

Margaret has requested a loan of 1,100,000 UGX from Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO (MCDT SACCO) to enable her to buy more sacks of groundnuts for sale. Her challenges include the high cost of transport. Her dream is to be able to buy a whole truck of groundnuts and even sell to other retailers. 

Margaret joined MCDT SACCO because of the low capital that she had. She lives in her husband`s house without access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses are school fees and electric power.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of groundnuts for sale.

loans.name: Saul

texts.es:
Con 23 años de edad Saúl comparte una vida conyugal con Brígida de 24 años, ambos tienen a su pequeño Yerson de 4 años. Por el momento habita en una vivienda construida a base de madera en calidad de alquiler. Al ser una persona con mucha dedicación por la vida, se dedica a ofrecer el servicio de taxi.
Viene trabajando como tal desde hace 2 años con un vehiculo que alquila a diario, recorriendo las diversas arterias de su localidad y haciendo muchos amigos a su vez. Considera muy agradable su oficio puesto que esta más cerca de su familia y puede aprovechar su unidad llevar y traer a su pequeño del jardín. No obstante existen días en que no hay afluencia de clientes y son días que el considera perdidos.
Al desempeñarse ya un tiempo considerable como conductor, ha recibido la propuesta por parte del dueño de la unidad en vendérselo a un buen precio, motivado por la propuesta vio la necesidad  de contar con dinero para hacer posible dicha oportunidad.
Sus objetivos a largo plazo apuntan a iniciarse junto a su pareja en el negocio de la venta de ropa y calzados, brindándole así una oportunidad de trabajo menos forzada para ella y para el futuro de su pequeño. Este es su crédito número 3, se compromete desde ya a cumplir de manera puntual con el pago de su préstamo para formar un buen historial crediticio y acceder a un crédito mayor para el futuro. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles será posible ser el propietario del vehiculo que actualmente conduce para así obtener a futuro las ganancias netas con su trabajo.
texts.en:
At 23 years of age, Saul shares his conjugal life with Brigida, 24 years old. They both have their small Yerson, who is 4 years old. For now, they live in a rented home constructed of wood. Being a person with a lot of dedication in life, he makes a living providing taxi service.

He has worked as such for two years with a vehicle he rents daily, traveling the diverse arteries of his town and making many friends in turn. He considers his job very pleasant since it is closer to his family and he can use his vehicle to take and bring his young one to and from the kindergarten. Nevertheless, there are days in which there is no influx of customers and days that he considers lost.

Working now for a considerable time as a driver, he has received the offer from the owner of the vehicle to sell it at a good price. Motivated by the offer he saw the necessity of finding money to make that opportunity possible.

His long-term objectives aim at beginning with his partner a business selling clothes and footwear, providing him with a job opportunity less rushed for her and for the future of their young one. This is his third loan. He promises from now on to punctually complete the payments of his loan to form a good credit history and be eligible for a larger loan in the future. With the 2,000 Nuevos Soles, it will be possible for him to own the vehicle that he now drives to therefore obtain in the future the net profits with his work.

loans.use: to buy the vehicle that he rents.

loans.name: Rosa Amada

texts.es:
La Señora Rosa es una persona muy emprendedora, honesta y trabajadora, vive  con  su  esposo  y sus  2 hijos en una comunidad al sur de Honduras. 
Doña Rosa su negocio es pulpería. El préstamo lo necesita para la compra de refrescos, carne, maíz, leche,  frijoles, sal, aguas, pastillas, jabones, especias, papel higiénico galletas y churros. Con  el préstamo ella espera tener más mercadería que ofrecer para cubrir los pedidos que a diario recibe de sus clientes. 
Doña Rosa con los ingresos obtenidos desea mejorar su situación económica y  la de familia. 
Doña rosa en un futuro ella espera que su negocio sea un mercadito, gracias a la inversión hecha en el mismo y sueña con ver a sus hijos y nietos graduados y convertirlos en persona de bien y con mejores oportunidades.


Choluteca, Honduras –  Noviembre del  2012
texts.en:
Rosa is a very enterprising, honest, and hard-working person. She lives with her husband and her two children in a community in the south of Honduras.
Rosa’s business is a small grocery store. The loan is needed to buy soft drinks, meat, corn, milk, beans, salt, waters, pills, soaps, spices, toilet paper, cookies, and churros. With the loan she hopes to have more merchandise to offer in order to cover the daily requests that she receives from her customers.

With the income she receives, Rosa wishes to improve her and her family’s economic situation.

In the future, Rosa hopes that her business becomes a small market, thanks to the investment made in it and she dreams to see her children and grandchildren graduated and become good people with better opportunities.

Choluteca, Honduras- November 2012

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, meat, corn, milk, beans, salt, waters, pills, soaps, spices, toilet paper, cookies, and churros.

loans.name: Concepcion Mercedes

texts.es:
Concepción, se ha decidido por solicitar un nuevo préstamo, para aumentar el inventario de la tienda, comprándose productos básicos para el hogar, como gaseosas, boquitas, frijoles, aceite, condimentos, entre otros que sean del agrado de los clientes.
Con el préstamo que se le financio anteriormente concepción considera que su inventario mejoro, sus ventas tambien, ya que mantuvo un surtido de productos en el negocio; En su familia manifiesta que la situación económica ha sido favorable.
texts.en: Concepción has opted to request a new loan to increase her store’s inventory.  She will buy basic items for the home like soft-drinks, packaged snacks, beans, oil, and condiments, among others that her customers prefer.  With her previous loan Concepción thinks that her inventory improved and so did her sales because she had a good selection of stock in the store.  She says that her family’s economic situation has been favorable.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Lodya

texts.en:
Lodya, is a 44-year-old, single parent. She is living with five children; three of them are still in elementary school.

Lodya has a business selling dried salty fish, garlic and onions at a weekly traditional market. It is located 30 km from her residence. Due to limited business capital, Lodya can only produce a small income. The difficulties of life led her to expand her business by selling cakes as her second business. She then requested a loan from TLM amounting to 4,000,000 IDR to spend on ingredients like wheat flour, cooking oil, eggs, etc.. In addition, she wants to add more stock of dried salty fish, garlic and onions. She is optimistic that the loan can bring a little improvement in her life.

loans.use: to spend on more ingredients like wheat flour, cooking oil, eggs, etc. and also to add more stock of dried salty fish, garlic and onions.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with two children, both of whom attend school. She is not looking after any other family members. Justine stays in her own house with access to both electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees. 

Working seven days a week, Justine has been selling secondhand shoes from the market at retail for the last three years. She also sells secondhand clothes to earn extra income. 

Justine has requested a loan of 800,000 UGX from MCDT- SACCO to enable her buy more bales of shoes for sale. Her challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her dream is to expand her business into a wholesaler. She joined MCDT to acquire more capital for her business.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used shoes

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en:
Teopista lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed with four children, all of whom attend school. She is looking after her siblings. Teopista stays in her own house without access to either electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.

Working six days a week, Teopista has been selling secondhand clothes from home at retail for the last ten years. She also sews and repairs clothes to earn extra income. 

Teopista has requested a loan of 600,000 UGX from MCDT- SACCO to enable her buy more clothes for sale. Her challenges include seasonality. Her dream is to expand her business. She joined MCDT so that she could solve her problems.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Jerame

texts.en:
Jerame is a 25-year-old, married woman and a mother of two young children from Talibon, Bohol. She has been engaged in a pot-making business for almost three years now. Also, she runs a sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and commodities to the people in her place.

Jerame is asking for a loan to buy materials, such as clay, for making pots and stocks for her store such as canned goods, noodles, toiletries and soap. With this, she will be able to augment her income and profit.

In the future, Jerame hopes to make her business better and save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy materials, such as clay, for making pots and stocks for her store such as canned goods, noodles, toiletries and soap

loans.name: Shameem

texts.en:
Ms. Shameem is a 24-year-old, married woman and a dedicated mother of three children. Her husband runs a donkey cart as a means of transportation for carrying things. Four years ago, he started this business with a single donkey cart and carried material from one place to another. He earns enough profit from this business. 

In order to purchase a big size, wooden cart to have more capacity, Shameem contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 20,000 PKR. In this way her husband would be able to carry more items like fruits and vegetables, etc. at the same time. Shameem is thankful to Kashf for its support. She desires to utilize part of profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase a big size, wooden cart for more capacity.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with five children, two of whom attend school. She is also looking after her parents and siblings.

She has been selling charcoal in the market at retail for the last four years, working seven days a week. She does not have any other source of income.

She has requested for a loan of UShs 500,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to stock more sacks of charcoal for sale. Her challenges include seasonality. 

Her dream is to expand her business, to be able to employ people, and to build houses for renting out. She joined MCDT because of the weekly repayment system. 

She stays in her own house, without access to either electricity or piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy more sacks  of charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a 46-year-old woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has been in the food-vending business for more than seven years. She sells home-cooked foods to the people in her place.

Jocelyn is asking for a loan to buy more ingredients for food-vending, like flour, sugar, bananas, cooking oil, etc.. With the loan, Jocelyn will be able to cook more snack foods, thus allowing her to sell more and augment her profit.

In the future, Jocelyn dreams of expanding her business and making it sustainable.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for food vending like flour, sugar, bananas, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Roberto José

texts.es:
En el municipio de Condega departamento de Estelí, un pueblo conocido como tierra de alfareros por su artesanía y gente trabajadora  , vive el señor  Roberto, es Felizmente Casado, de profesión comerciante , ya que posee una ferretería donde vende materiales de construcción y Productor Pecuario  ganado mayor ,en engorde de semovientes, es un señor emprendedor, con 5 hijos donde actualmente solo depende dos de él , al  que tiene el deber de mantener sus estudios y prepararlos como a sus otros tres.

Este señor tiene 10 años  de experiencia en  la venta de productos ferreteros y 30 años en el manejo de ganado mayor ,donde ha tenido buenas perspectivas , ya que con la utilidades  ha mejorado su vivienda y le ha dado los estudios a su hijos , hoy en día este señor Roberto , tiene la necesidad de efectuar una inversión en la compra de dos novillos de engorde y aprovechar al máximo los pastos de su finca por tal razón  visito las  oficinas de Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con el crédito donde piensa obtener mayores ingresos y mejorar cada día más su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Condega, located within the Estelí department, is known as the land of the potters because of its arts and hardworking people.  Roberto lives there, is happily married, and is a businessman who has a hardware store where he sells building materials.  He also raises livestock and is an entrepreneur with five children, but only two still depend on him and he must provide them with an education and prepare them as he did with the other three.

This gentleman has ten years’ experience in selling hardware and 30 years in managing livestock.  He has been successful and has improved his home and provided an education for his children.  Today Roberto needs to invest in two steers to fatten up so that he can take advantage of the best grasses on his farm.  He approached CEPRODEL for a loan which he plans to invest to help increase his income and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy two steers.

loans.name: Elizabet

texts.es:
De 26 años, Elizabeth es una joven de 26 años quien comparte una vida conyugal con Geneton de 34 años, ambos aún sin hijos, y vienen trabajando con el objetivo de formar un sólido hogar.
Empeñosa y trabajadora decidió iniciarse en la venta de verduras y abarrotes en el mercado de su localidad desde hace 8 años con el firme apoyo de su madre. Comenta que tuvo mucha suerte al momento de establecerse en el puesto que ocupa, ya que se trataba del último puesto disponible y fue convocada para ser la acreedora final. Le agrada mucho su trabajo ya que es una buena manera de generar ingresos para su familia y un buen modo de iniciarse como propietaria de un negocio. Las factores que impulsan a desempeñarse en su negocio son las constantes amistades que ha ido ganando a través de los años convirtiéndose a la larga en clientela fija, no obstante en ocasiones existen clientes que le solicitan productos a crédito y presentan un retraso considerable en el pago del mismo generándole muchas molestias.
Al iniciarse la temporada de fin de año en donde los comercios en general presentan un alza en sus ventas desea adquirir panetones y otros víveres de temporada esperando obtener buenas ganancias.
Desea seguir trabajando con el entusiasmo que la caracteriza para a futuro ser propietaria de una tienda mayorista de abarrotes. Este es su octavo préstamo con MFP, es participe de la idea que la base del progreso es el cumplimiento y la responsabilidad, por tanto demuestra un buen historial crediticio. Se siente muy a gusto por como los integrantes de su banco comunal han presentado un buen crecimiento económico a través del tiempo en que vienen trabajando con el apoyo de microcréditos.
Con los 1,000 nuevos soles realizará la compra de panetones y otros víveres de temporada para sacarle el máximo provecho a la campaña de fin de año al igual que los comercios de la zona.
texts.en:
Elizabet is a young woman, 26 years old, who shares her married life with Geneton, 34 years old. They have no children yet. They both work in order to achieve their aim, which is to have a stable home.

Diligent and hardworking, eight years ago Elizabet decided to set up a stall selling vegetables and groceries at her local market. Her mother was very supportive of this. She says that she was very lucky when she set up her stall, because it was the last one available at the market and also she was asked to join as the last member of the communal bank. 

She really enjoys her work as it is a good way to generate income for her family and to establish herself as a business owner. The factors that motivate her in the business are the solid friendships that she has made over the years, and who have gone on to become loyal customers. However, at times customers ask to purchase goods on credit. This results in a considerable delay in payment which can be problematic.

The winter season has started when businesses generally increase their sales. Shops start to purchase panettones (a type of cake eaten at Christmas time) and other seasonal supplies in order to earn good profits. 

She wants to continue working with the same enthusiasm that she has been noted for up to now, so that in the future she can become the owner of a wholesale grocery business. This is her eighth loan with MFP. She believes in the idea that progress is based on honouring her commitments and responsibility. As a result she has a good credit history. She is very pleased with how the members of the communal bank have achieved good economic growth during the time that they have been receiving support via micro-loans.

With this loan of 1,000 Nuevos Soles she will purchase panettones and other seasonal supplies in order to make the most of the Christmas season, as the other businesses in the area are doing.

loans.use: to buy panettones and other products

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Por El Progreso Group

texts.es: Buenos Tardes!!! Este es el grupo “Mujeres Unidas Por El Progreso” conformados 10 socios que en el transcurso del tiempo han ido mejorando sus negocios, con el fin de brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus familias. Betzabet de 35 años es madre soltera de 02 hijos. Al ver que sus ingresos no eran suficientes, Betzabet se vio en la necesidad de emprender su propio negocio, la cual le generara mejores ingresos. Actualmente cuenta con una bodega donde brinda productos de primera necesidad, con su dedicación y el buen trato que les da a sus clientes ha llegado a fidelizarlos. Se siente feliz pues gracias a su negocio puede apoyar a sus hijos en su educación.  En esta oportunidad solicito el crédito para la compra de panetones por campaña navideña. Seguir mejorando su negocio es su mayor deseo. El grupo “Mujeres Unidas Por El Progres” están agradecidos con el crédito brindado. Betzabet se encuentra sentada es la primera del lado izquierdo viste polo color rosado.
texts.en: Good Afternoon!  This is the “Mujeres Unidas Por El Progreso” (Women United for Progress) group.  It has 10 members who over time have been improving their businesses aiming at providing their families with better quality of life.  Betzabet, 35, is a single mother of two children.  Seeing that her income was insufficient, Betzabet needed to start a business of her own that would generate improved income.  She currently has a store where she sells basic staples.  With her dedication and the good customer service she provides she’s acquired a regular clientele.  She feels happy because thanks to her business she’s able to support her children’s education.  On this occasion she requested the loan to buy panettones for the Christmas season.  To continue improving her business is her greatest wish.  The “Mujeres Unidas Por El Progreso” group is grateful for the loan provided.  Betzabet is seated; she’s first on the left wearing a pink shirt.

loans.use: to by panettones.

loans.name: Mi Pequeña Hacienda Group

texts.es:
La Sra. CArmen Emilia, tiene 47 años de edad, es casada y tiene 5 hijos. los cuales son mayores e independientes. Ella forma parte del grupo "Mi Pequeña Hacienda" formado por 7 socios.
La Sra. Carem Emilia, se dedeica desde hace 17 años a la venta de comida, en un espacio ambientado en su domicilio. Gracias a su trabajo ha podido pagar los estudios de sus hijos y apoyar a su esposo en el pago de los servicios de la casa.
El préstamo recibido lo invirtió en la compra de insumos para la preparación de sus alimentos, los cuales compra en grandes cantidades para poder obtener un precio mas bajo.
texts.en: Carmen Emilia, 47, is married and has five children who are independent adults.  She’s part of the “Mi Pequeña Hacienda” (My Little Hacienda) group; it has 7 members.  Carmen Emilia has sold food for the last 17 years in a space set aside for this at home.  Thanks to her work she’s been able to pay for her children’s schooling and help her husband pay for utilities at home.  The loan she got was invested in ingredients to prepare her dishes; she buys them in large amounts in order to get a lower price.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for the dishes she makes.

loans.name: Transito

texts.es:
El Señor Transito, tiene 61 años de edad,  es una persona muy responsable, honesta y trabajadora, vive  con  su  esposa y sus 4 hijos en una comunidad de Choluteca al  sur de Honduras.
Don Transito su negocio es la venta  medicinas, El necesita el préstamo para la compra de pastillas, antibióticos,  mantaca de cacao, gasas, vitaminas, esparadrapos y mentoladas. Con  el préstamo el espera tener más producto que ofrecerá su clientes que son sus amigos y vecinos de la comunidad. 
Don Transito con los ingresos obtenidos desea mejorar un poco su situación económica. En el futuro el espera que su negocio crezca y sueña con ver a sus hijos graduados y con mejores oportunidades en la vida.


Choluteca, Honduras –  Noviembre del  2012
texts.en:
Transito, 61, is a very responsible, hardworking, honest person living with his wife and four children in a community in Choluteca in south Honduras.  Transito sells health products.  He needs the loan to buy pills, antibiotics, cocoa butter, gauze bandages, vitamins, adhesive plaster and menthol lozenges.  He hopes with the loan to have more products to offer his customers who are his friends and neighbors in the community.  Transito wants to use income earned to improve his economic situation a bit.  In future he hopes his business will grow and he dreams with seeing his children graduate and with better life opportunities.

Choluteca, Honduras - November, 2012

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: Gracibell

texts.es:
La  Joven  Gracibel tiene 21 años es una persona bien honesta y trabajadora, vive  con  su  esposo y  sus 2 hijos en una comunidad al  sur de Honduras.
Gracibell tiene un negocio  de  venta  de  tortillas, y necesita  el préstamo  para la compra de maíz, leña y cal, con  el préstamo que se le brinde espera tener más producto que ofrecer para cubrir los pedidos que a diario recibe de sus  muy buenos  clientes. 
Gracibell con los ingresos obtenidos desea mejorar un poco su situación económica y al de su familia. En el futuro ella espera que su negocio crezca,gracias a la inversión hecha en el mismo y espera  ver  superados a sus hijos y con mejores oportunidades.


Choluteca, Honduras –  Noviembre del  2012
texts.en:
Gracibel, 21, is quite an honest, hardworking person living with her husband and two children in a community in southern Honduras.  She has a business selling tortillas and needs the loan to buy corn, firewood and lime powder.  With the loan she gets she’ll have more product to offer and be able to fill the daily orders she gets from her very good customers.  Gracibel wants to use income earned to improve her family’s economic situation a bit.  In future, she hopes her business will grow thanks to the investment put into it and she hopes to see her children improved and with better opportunities.

Choluteca, Honduras - November, 2012

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood and lime powder.

loans.name: Franklin Ernesto

texts.es:
Franklin, tiene 21 años de edad, vive con su esposa y un hijo de nueve meses de nacido, él trabaja en la agricultura para mantener a su hogar, aprendió el trabajo a través de un tío y tiene ya dos años de estar realizando el cultivo propio.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de 4 sacos de abono, tambien para el pago de mano de obra, con lo que estará realizando la siembra sin mayores inconvenientes, esperando que pueda tener una buena cosecha.
Con el préstamo su objetivo es mejorar el cultivo, que sus condiciones económicas a través de la producción puedan ser mejor.
texts.en: Franklin, 21, lives with his wife and nine-month-old son.  He works in agriculture to support his home.  He learned the occupation from his uncle and he’s been growing his own crops for two years now.  He requests the loan to buy four sacks of manure and also to pay labor costs.  With it, he’ll be able to plant with no great inconvenience hoping to have a good harvest.  His goal for the loan is to improve his crops and that thanks to his production his economic conditions will be better.

loans.use: to buy four sacks of manure and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Buzurgmehr

texts.ru: Бузургмехру 33 года. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Детям 13, 11, 9 и 8 лет. Он всегда старается обеспечить своих детей со всеми не обходимыми средствами, а также хорошим образованием, так как он считает, что образование важнее всего. Он упорно работает в организации и является одним из лучших работников. Он является единственным кормильцем, так как его жена домохозяйка. Бузургмехр хочет отремонтировать свой дом, так как его дом не отвечает стандартам жилья. Он должен отремонтировать все комнаты, так как зимой нет удобства, а в Таджикистане зима довольно холодная. Из-за не удобства дома, у детей всегда насморк зимой. Он запрашивает займ на сумму  3500 сомони для покупки строительных материалов для ремонта дома. Бузургмехр и его дети будут ждать, пока добрые кредиторы помогут им решить проблему жилья.
texts.en: Buzurgmehr is 33 years old, married, and has 4 children who are 13, 11, 9 and 8 years old. He has always tried to provide his children with the necessities of life and a good education, which he considers to be the number one priority. He works very hard in an organization where he is one of the best employees. His wife is a homemaker, so Buzurgmehr is the sole breadwinner of the family. He wants to repair his home because it is not up to housing standards. He must repair all rooms as they are not fit for Tajikistan winters, which can be quite cold. Due to the lack of comfortable conditions, his children always have colds in the wintertime. Buzurgmehr is seeking a loan of 3,500 Tajikistan Somoni to buy building materials to repair his house. He and his children are waiting for kind lenders to help them resolve their housing problems.

loans.use: To buy building materials to repair his house

loans.name: Juline

texts.en:
Juline lives in the village of Les Anglais, in the South Department of Haiti about 6 hours from the capital Port-au-Prince. She lives with her mother and brother and has never had electricity in her home. Juline learned about EarthSpark's work when a group passed through her town years ago, sparking her interest in solar energy. She has been a dedicated clean energy entrepreneur ever since. 

While she had a lot of success selling efficient cookstoves and solar light bulbs, Juline lacks the capital to grow her business. With a Kiva loan, Juline will be set up with a “Business in a Bag”, a kit containing a personalized mix of small-scale clean energy products, marketing materials and training on energy literacy, SMS tracking of sales, and basic business skills.  Juline will use her loan to purchase solar energy products such as solar light bulbs and desk lamps for sale in her community. She would like to sell EarthSpark’s clean energy products because she wants to see the organization get bigger and expand its services in Haiti.  She also feels that she has been with EarthSpark since the beginning and she would like to continue to be a part of the team.

loans.use: to purchase stock for a clean energy business

loans.name: Lecene

texts.en:
Lecene lives in the town of Port Salut, in the South Department of Haiti. He has had a store for 14 years that sells cell phone credit and motorcycle and bicycle parts. He has one employee in his store. He has recently decided to start selling EarthSpark clean energy products to expand his current business and hopefully be able to employ more staff. 

With a Kiva loan, Lecene will be set up with a “Business in a Bag”, a kit containing a personalized mix of small-scale clean energy products, marketing materials and training on energy literacy, SMS tracking of sales, and basic business skills.  Lecene would like to sell solar energy desk lamps with mobile phone charging capability. He wants to sell clean energy products because he likes business and the local population really likes EarthSpark products.

loans.use: to purchase stock for a clean energy business

loans.name: Rosane

texts.en:
Rosane lives in Les Anglais, a village in the South Department of Haiti about 6 hours from the capital Port-au-Prince. She is married and has 4 children in school. She has never had electricity in her home. Her current monthly income is about 125 USD and she would now like to augment this by becoming an EarthSpark clean energy entrepreneur. With a Kiva loan, Rosane will be set up with a “Business in a Bag”, a kit containing a personalized mix of small-scale clean energy products, marketing materials and training on energy literacy, SMS tracking of sales, and basic business skills.  

Rosane is very passionate and excited to take on about her new role. She would like to expand her business because she would like to help EarthSpark become bigger. She will sell solar desk lamps and charcoal efficient cookstoves. She believes that increasing access to solar products will help her country advance. Les Anglais is very vulnerable to flooding due to deforestation. In Haiti, deforestation is caused by cutting down trees to make charcoal for cooking fuel. EarthSpark reduced-charcoal cookstoves reduces the amount of charcoal needed by about 25%, which along with being better for the environment means the users save money on fuel costs. She particularly likes EarthSpark products because they are durable and of high quality.

loans.use: to purchase stock for a clean energy business

loans.name: Pierre

texts.en: Pierre lives in Port Salut, a small town on the coast of the South Department in Haiti, about 45 minutes from the regional capital of Les Cayes. He is married and has two children in school. As a pastor in his village he is also a community leader and perfectly situated to increase energy literacy amongst his neighbors. He would like to start a clean energy business with EarthSpark and specifically wants to sell kerosene stoves and solar desk lamps. With a Kiva loan, Pierre will be set up with a “Business in a Bag”, a kit containing a personalized mix of small-scale clean energy products, marketing materials and training on energy literacy, SMS tracking of sales, and basic business skills.

loans.use: to purchase stock for a clean energy business

loans.name: Antoine

texts.en: Antoine lives in Les Cayes, the capital of the South Department of Haiti with his wife and child. He has had a business in the city for 3 years and is now looking to expand his business to sell clean energy products. He is really interested in selling kerosene stoves as many people in Les Cayes use charcoal stoves which are not only expensive, but cause pollution and are bad for their users’ health. He wants to sell clean energy products because they contribute to protecting the environment in Haiti.  A loan through Kiva will enable him to jump-start his clean energy business.

loans.use: to purchase stock for a clean energy business

loans.name: Reehana

texts.en:
Reehana is 48 years old and married with two children. She is striving hard to meet their demands, including food, clothing, and healthcare. Her husband is retired from the railway and only earns a pension. His income is not sufficient to meet the daily expenditures of the family. Reehana started her business to contribute in the family's income.

Reehana has been in the sewing business for many years. She is very familiar with stitching techniques. She initiated her business with the support of Kashf Foundation; she took her first loan to buy a sewing machine. At present, she enjoys a great client list and has gained a lot of appreciation and popularity in her community.

She has requested a loan of PKR 25,000 to buy stocks of thread in different colors, buttons, needles, and other supplies. She believes that the loan would enable her to meet the demands of her customers without fail. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a high-quality education to her children through her hard work.

loans.use: to buy stocks of threads, buttons, needles, and other sewing supplies

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is a 40-year-old married woman. She has a business manufacturing "waan," a thread-like material used to make a bedstead from a wooden frame on four legs. She offers various types of "waan" in different colors and is famous for providing good-quality material in her community. Farzana operates the machine at home with the help of her husband. They are contentedly doing it for the sake of her family.

Farzana is the mother of five children: three sons and two daughters. She is trying hard to fulfill their needs, including food, healthcare, clothing, and education. It’s her second year with Kashf Foundation. She is satisfied with the support of Kashf Foundation. She has applied for a loan of PKR 25,000 to buy another good machine to make "waan" with fresh quality thread, in order to increase her sales. She expects boost in her net income.

loans.use: to buy another machine to manufacture quality thread

loans.name: Danelia

texts.es: Danelia es una joven, de profesión licenciada en ciencias naturales, trabaja como docente en un colegio rural de la comunidad donde vive, es soltera, con 1 hija la que tiene la obligación de proporcionarles las condiciones para su desarrollo. Actualmente tiene  la urgencia de la construcción de su casa, por eso visito a ceprodel para solicitar financiamiento y poder iniciar la obra de su sueños, ya que con el mismo compraría hierro grueso, varilla lisa, varilla, cemento, zinc y perlin, ya que de esta manera mejoraría las condiciones de la vida y la familia, agradeciéndole a ceprodel por el crédito oportuno y a los inversionistas de kiva por el apoyo a los sectores más necesitados de la poblacion y les insta a que continúen con tan noble labor.
texts.en: Daniela is a young woman with a master’s degree in natural sciences.  She works as a teacher at a rural school in her community, is single, and has a daughter to whom she must provide good conditions for her development.  She currently has a great need to build her house, so she approached CEPRODEL to request financing so that she can begin the work of her dreams.  She will use the money to buy iron bars, rebar, cement, zinc sheeting, and girders.  This will allow her to improve her living conditions and that of her family.  She is grateful to CEPRODEL for the loan opportunity and appreciates the Kiva lenders for their support to those in need.  She hopes that they will continue doing such noble work.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: José Isaac

texts.es:
El joven José Isaac habita en Managua departamento de Nicaragua, es una persona con una capacidad de superación, se desempeña como gestor desde hace cuatro años, es casado con un hijo a su cargo.

Se presento a la oficina de CEPRODEL para solicitar un financiamiento para la compra de un medio de transporte,  para poder agilizar un poco más rápido su trabajo ya que es en el campo que realiza su labor.

Esperando esta segunda oportunidad que le brinden, para poder hacer realidad unos  de sus sueños y agradece la ayuda para mejor su vida familiar.
texts.en:
Young Issac lives in Managua, within the Nicaragua department.  He has a great capacity for success and has worked as a manager for four years.  He is married and has one son.

He approached CEPRODEL to request a loan to buy a means of transportation to be able to speed up his work a bit, since he works in the fields.

He is hoping for this second opportunity to make his dreams a reality and appreciates the help in improving his family’s life.

loans.use: to buy a vehicle.

loans.name: Valentin

texts.es:
Valentín de 46 años, tiene el orgullo de haber cumplido con sus hijos de manera responsable hasta lograr convertirlos en personas de bien y con un futuro prometedor. Es propietario de una vivienda construida a base de adobe.
Considerado como uno de los pioneros en su zona en lo que se refiere al trabajo productivo de cacao orgánico, lleva casi 30 años, y hasta el momento ofrece a su clientes un producto de calidad. 
Considera que es una de las mejores actividades, pues aparte de sentirse a gusto con su trabajo se siente muy tranquilo de saber que es un producto que beneficia enormemente a las familias mas humildes de su región sin tener problemas de por medio.
Al iniciarse una nueva campaña productiva, espera sacarle el máximo provecho posible a sus parcelas contratando mano de obra, osea a los jornaleros del lugar para trabajos de sembrado de plantas de almácigo, injertado de plantas y sacar la maleza.
Por otro lado nos indica que ya llegó a su región un nuevo lote de abono orgánico que es guano de isla para el cual es necesario inscribirse primero y contar con el dinero suficiente de manera inmediata, puesto que se trata de abono de primera calidad muy esencial para garantizar una producción de calidad. Este es su quinto préstamo con MFP, se siente desde ya comprometido con el pago puntual de su préstamo. Como presidente de su banco comunal da lo mejor de si para lograr a largo plazo que este sea un grupo sólido y beneficioso para todos.
Con los 3,500 soles realizará la contrata de jornaleros del lugar para los diversos trabajos en sus parcelas, asimismo comprará una cantidad considerable de sacos con guano de isla cuyo precio radica en 60 nuevos soles la unidad.
texts.en:
Valentín is  46 years old. He is proud to have raised his children in a responsible way and made them into good people with a promising future. He is the owner of a home built from adobe.

He is considered to be one of the pioneers in his area of cacao production. He has been doing it for nearly 30 years and so far he has offered his customers quality product. He considers it to be one of the best activities, because aside from enjoying his work he feels good knowing his product really benefits the more humble families in his area without any trouble.
.
While starting a new production campaign, he hopes to get the best use possible out of his land parcels by hiring laborers from the area to plant the seedlings, grafting plants and weeding. On the other hand, he tells us that a new lot of island organic fertilizer has come to his region. He  has to sign up first and have enough money on hand, because it is the highest quality fertilizer and very essential to guarantee a quality production. 

This is his fifth loan with MFP. He already feels committed to make the loan payments on time. As president of his communal bank he gives his best to make this a solid group in the long term that will benefit everyone. With the 3,500 soles, he will hire laborers from the area for different jobs on his land parcels. He will also buy a considerable quantity of sacks of island guano whose price is 60 soles a unit.

loans.use: to hire laborers and buy sacks of island bird guano.

loans.name: Norma Sofia

texts.es:
Norma, tiene 29 años de edad, está soltera y vive con su madre quien tiene 50 años de edad, su padre falleció hace algún tiempo; Norma se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, este negocio está ubicado en el mercado, trabaja de lunes a sábado, junto a su madre.
Solicita un préstamo para poder fortalecer el negocio, comprando fruta de temporada y tambien verduras, que sean productos frescos, como manzanas, uvas, ciruelas, peras, bananos, papas, güisquiles, plátanos, etc. Esta compra le ayudara a incrementar sus inventarios, para poder ofrecer a los clientes mayor variedad.
Su objetivo con el préstamo es mejorar el negocio, teniendo más frutas y verduras frescas, además de ofrecer una mejor condición de vida a su madre.
texts.en: Norma, 29, is single living with her mother who is 50-years-old; her father died some time ago.  Norma works selling fruit and vegetables.  Her business is located in the market and she works Monday through Saturday alongside her mother.  She’s requesting a loan to strengthen the business.  She will buy fresh seasonal fruit and also vegetables like apples, grapes, plums, pears, plantain, potatoes, chayote, bananas, etc.    This purchase will help her increase inventory to offer a wider variety to her customers.  Her objective with the loan is to improve the business by having more fresh fruit and vegetables as well as to provide her mother with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fresh fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José, tiene 37 años de edad, está casado, su esposa tiene 35 años de edad, tienen dos hijos uno de 3 años y el otro de 2 años de edad, José se dedica a la ganadería y agricultura, esta actividad la aprendió de su padre, compra y vende ganado de repasto, tambien cultiva maíz para vender.
Actualmente quiere comprarse dos novillas para repasto, por eso solicita un préstamo que le permita realizar la compra, esto le ayudara a incrementar sus inventarios y poder obtener más ingresos.
Su aspiración es fortalecer más el negocio de la ganadería, ya que crecerá en la zona y podrá tener más facilidades de generar ganancias, y tener una calidad de vida mejor junto a su familia.
texts.en: José, 37, is married and his wife’s 35-years-old; they have two children, a three-year-old and a two-year-old.  José works raising livestock and in agriculture having learned this from his father.  He buys and sells grazing cattle and also grows corn to sell.  He currently wants to buy two grazing bullocks which is why he’s requested the loan so he can make this purchase.  This will help him increase his inventory and be able to earn higher income.  His hope is to strengthen the cattle raising business more so that it will grow in the zone and it will be easier for him to earn profits and have good quality of life with his family.

loans.use: to buy two grazing bullocks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a corn hulling machine and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Virgen De La Puerta Group

texts.es:
Cordiales Saludos desde Perú. 
Esta es la Alcancía Comunal “Virgen De La Puerta” la cual la integrada por 08 personas responsables y unidas que pasan a su 8vo ciclo.  En esta oportunidad conocerán a Eileen una de las integrantes. Ella  es madre soltera de 01 hija, quien ha sido su motivo de seguir adelante. Desde muy joven Eileen llego a la capital con el propósito de tener un futuro mejor para ella y su hija. Comenzó  con el negocio de la venta de  descartables (vasos, tenedores, cuchillos, bolsas, etc.), poco a poco ha llegado a implementar su negocio, dicho  puesto se encuentra situado en un mercado donde hay mucha concurrencia. Gracias a su esfuerzo y trabajo pudo cumplir algunos de sus metas como comprar su terreno y apoyar a su hija en su educación. Solicito el crédito para la compra descartables como vasos, tenedores, cuchillos y juguetes para niños por campaña navideña. Su mayor deseo es de ver a su hija profesional. Eileen agradece a los prestamistas Kiva por la ayuda brindada.  Eileen se encuentra ubicada en la parte posterior es la primera de lado derecho viste polo negro con puntos negros.
texts.en:
Cordial Greetings from Peru.
 
This is the “Virgen De La Puerta” communal bank. It has 8 responsible, united members who are in their 8th cycle. At this time, you will meet Eileen, one of the members. She is the single mother os one daughter, who is her motivation for getting ahead. When she was very young, Eileen arrived at the capital with the purpose of having a better future with her daughter. She started with a business selling disposable items (cups, forks, knives, bags, etc.). Little by little, she has outfitted her business. Her spot is in a market with a lot of traffic. Thanks to her work and effort, she has been able to reach some of her goals, such as buying a plot of land and helping her daughter with her education. She asked for the loan to buy disposable items such as cups, forks, knives, and toys for children for the Christmas season. Her biggest wish is is to see her daughter have a good career. Eileen is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the help they have offered. Eileen is in the back, first from the right wearing a black short with black dots.

loans.use: to buy disposable items and toys.

loans.name: Juditha

texts.en: Juditha is a 39-year-old married woman and the mother of five young children. She has run a sari-sari, or variety store, for more than 15 years. Juditha works hard to earn a living so that she can support her husband in meeting the needs of the family, especially to pay for the schooling of their children. Juditha is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell in her store, such as canned goods, noodles, soda, biscuits and snack foods, toiletries, and other items. With this additional inventory, she hopes to attract more customers to her store, thus augmenting her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of items to sell in her store

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is a 30-year-old married woman. She has 2 children, aged 3 years and 5 years. She describes herself as an active and humble woman. She operates a retail store where she provides M-PESA (mobile phone-based money transfer) services. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a viable business area and her primary customers are local residents. Josephine describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the requested KES 80,000 loan to increase her "float" (base of funds) for M-PESA services. Her business goal is to expand her business within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will open a similar retail store. This is her fourth loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to increase funds for her money-transfer service

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is 24 years old. He is married and has two children. He and his wife earn their income through the sale of crops and livestock. They grow maize, beans, coffee, cassava, and potatoes. They also have cows, pigs, chickens, rabbits, and bees (for honey).

Alex looks forward to becoming a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). As a CKW he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set, and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, helping them to improve their crop yields and to increase their incomes. He is especially excited about the opportunity to make his business more profitable and to help other farmers in his area to do the same.

With the additional money that he will earn as a CKW, Alex will invest in his poultry business. His biggest dream is to open up an agricultural supply shop where everyone in his village can shop for the farming inputs that they need. He also wants to continue to find additional ways to train other farmers in his community at no cost to them.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set, and weighing scale so that he can provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Eka

texts.en:
Eka is from the village of Bakurtsikhe in the Gurjaani district. She is 30 years old and lives with her husband, two children (10 and 12 years old), sister-in-law, father-in-law, and grandmother who is a pensioner. Agricultural activities are the household's main source of income. Eka runs a small dairy farm and produces cheese, which she sells at the local open market. Along with the dairy, Eka is also busy raising crops. Specifically, she has a vineyard and a plot of land where she grows cucumbers, tomatoes, peppers, and watermelons. She is a very hard-working woman, with rich experience in her occupation.

Eka has requested a loan to purchase calves. She will raise the calves during the winter and sell them in the spring for a higher price. Eka will use her additional income to improve the family's living conditions. She will also finance her children's education. Eka awaits your support.

loans.use: To purchase calves

loans.name: Tamalinda Group

texts.en:
Diana, who is in her late 20s, is single with a child who still goes to school. For two years, Diana has been earning a living by running a beauty salon. She works from 8 am to 9 pm daily, and she is able to earn a good profit each month. 

This will be her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. Diana will use the loan to purchase needed salon equipment. Her dream is to one day become an international businesswoman.

She will share this loan with her group "TAMALINDA," which totals 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to purchase needed salon equipment.

loans.name: Dorling Andrés

texts.es:
Dorling Andrés es un joven 100% sauceño que fue criado en la comarca La Palma con el esfuerzo propio de su madre sin el apoyo de su padre, con buenos principios y con amor al trabajo. Como todo joven emprendedor y por salir adelante estudió la carrera de Magisterio el cual se desempeña como profesor de primaria en una comarca aledaña a dicho municipio labor que le ha permitido comprar su propia vivienda y ayudarle a su madre que es merecedora de su amor y ayuda pro haberle formado como buena persona.

Desde que se trasladó a vivir al poblado del Sauce su vida ha cambiado porque tiene mejores condiciones de vida gracias a su salario y a los créditos que ha obtenido de KIVA a través de Ceprodel.
Uno de sus mayores sueños es tener una vivienda digna con todas las condiciones para brindarles a su familia lo mejor que se merecen, es por tal motivo que solicita este crédito a KIVA para construir un cuarto y comprar materiales como hierro, ladrillos, perlines, cemento, arena, zinc y pago de mano de obra el que piensa pagar con los ingresos de su salario.
Confía en Dios que su crédito sea aprobado por estos inversionistas de buen corazón que han venido ayudar a miles de familias Nicaragüenses que por falta de recursos no pueden cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Dorling Andrés is a young man who is 100% Saucian; raised in the La Palma settlement, with his mother’s support and with no father, with good principles and a love of work.  He works as an elementary school teacher in a nearby settlement.  This job has allowed him to buy his own house and help his mother who is deserving of his love.  He helps her for having made him such a good person.

Since he went to live in Sauce, his life has changed because he has better living conditions, thanks to his salary and the loans he got from Kiva through CEPRODEL.  

One of his greatest dreams is to have a dignified home with all the conditions needed to provide his family the best that they deserve.  It’s for this reason that he is requesting this loan from Kiva so that he can add a room and buy building materials such as iron bars, bricks, girders, cement, sand, zinc metal sheeting, and to pay for labor.  He plans to repay the loan with part of his salary. 

He trusts in God that his loan will be approved by investors with good hearts who have helped thousands of Nicaraguan families who have not been able to achieve their dreams because of a lack of resources.

loans.use: to build a room.

loans.name: Antonia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Antonia, es comerciante de ropa, tiene 48 años de edad, vive con su madre, Antonia es madre soltera tiene a su hijo a cargo. Ella realiza sus ventas de manera ambulante por los alrededores de la ciudad, aprendió por una amiga y tiene 8 años de experiencia.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa para niños, para adultos, en blusas, trajes, pantalones, este crédito le ayudara a incrementar sus inventarios para poder tener más ingresos, ya que se acerca una temporada de mayor demanda.
Su objetivo es fortalecer más el negocio, ofrecer una mejor condición de vida a su familia a través de su trabajo.
texts.en: Antonia is a clothes merchant.  She’s 48-years-old and lives with her mother.  Antonia is a single mother with a son in her care.  She sells from place to place around the city having learned from a girlfriend; she has 8 years’ experience.  She’s asking for a loan to buy children’s and adults’ clothes like blouses, suits and pants.  This loan will help her increase inventory to be able to earn more income since the season of highest demand is near.  Her goal is to strengthen the business more offering her family better living conditions by means of her work.

loans.use: to buy clothes for children and adults.

loans.name: Genaro

texts.es:
Genaro, tiene 58 años de edad, vive con su esposa y tienen dos hijos quienes trabajan con Genaro en la agricultura, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz, lo aprendió cuando era joven, tiene dos vacas lecheras y cultiva una media manzana de plátanos, trabaja de lunes a sábado con sus hijos.
Él está en proceso de la siembra, para esto necesita el apoyo de un préstamo que cubra los gastos de insumos agrícolas como abono y los herbicidas, tambien invertirá en la preparación del terreno. Esta compra le ayudara para poderse comprar lo necesario y realizar su trabajo sin inconvenientes.
Su aspiración es fortalecer mas desarrollo del cultivo, para obtener cosechas mejores para la alimentación y comercialización, mejorando su condición de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Genaro is 58 years old. He lives with his wife, and has two sons who work with him on the farm. He grows corn. He learned how to grow corn when he was young. He has two dairy cows and grows half a manzana of bananas (one manzana = approx. 1.72 acres). He and his sons work from Monday to Saturday. 

It is now sowing season, and so he needs the support provided by a loan in order to cover agricultural expenses such as fertiliser and herbicides. He will also use part of the loan to prepare the ground. He will buy necessities and this will enable him to carry out his work without any difficulties.

His aspiration is to strengthen the developments he is making with his crops, in order to obtain better yields for both consumption and sale, thereby improving his and his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser and herbicides.

loans.name: Telma Yaneth

texts.es:
Telma, es viuda, madre  de dos niños de 7 y 14 años de edad, su esposo murió hace un año, ella tiene que trabajar para mantener a sus hijos y lo hace vendiendo tortillas, tiene tres años en este negocio, lo aprendió con su madre.
Ella necesita el apoyo para el negocio, comprando maíz y leña, para poder tener suficiente cantidad para realizar la venta, con ello podrá tener el dinero para fortalecer el negocio y trabajar continuamente.
Su objetivo con el préstamo, es generar estabilidad en el negocio, ya que esto le permitirá tener una fuente segura de ingresos, para enviar a sus hijos a la escuela y poder tener la alimentación para ellos.
texts.en:
Telma is a widow and mother of two children who are 7 and 14 years old. Her husband died one year ago. She has to work to support her children and she does so buy selling tortillas. She has been doing this business for three years and learned it from her mother. 

She needs support for the business; buying enough corn and firewood to make her sales. With the loan, she will have the money to strengthen the business and work continuously.  

Her goal with the loan is to generate stability in the business as this will allow her to have a secure source of income to send her children to school and be able to feed them.

loans.use: purchase corn and firewood for the sale of tortillas.

loans.name: Miguel Enrique

texts.es: El joven Miguel de 30 años de edad, es casado tiene 3 hijos empezó a trabajar a los 18, actualmente se desempeña como promotor de ventas está estudiando la carrera de licenciatura en agro negocios, es su segunda profesion, el solicita apoyo de crédito para poder comprar una computadora para hacer sus trabajos que le dejan de la universidad y también desempeñar mejor su labor cotidiana como promotor, es una persona muy trabajadora que busca como salir adelante para que a su familia no le falte lo primordial en el hogar y en especial los estudios de sus hijos.
texts.en: Miguel is a 30 year old man. He is married and has 3 children. He started to work when he was 18. Right now he works as a salesman. He is studying agribusiness as a second profession. He is asking for the help of a loan to buy a computer to do his work assigned in his college classes as well as to to do his daily work as a salesman. He is a hardworking person who is seeking a way to get ahead so that his family will lack nothing at home, and especially to pay for his children's studies.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es:
Ana, se dedica a la venta de comida y refrescos, es madre soltera y su hija tiene 16 años de edad, no tiene parientes en el extranjero, ella se dedica al negocio de comida desde hace 13 años, la fundo por iniciativa propia, trabaja todos los días de 6:00am a 6:00pm, su ventaja en el negocio es no tener competencia cercana.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales de cocina para seguir en su negocio, se comprara pollo, arroz, gaseosas, carnes, entre otros productos para la venta de comida, esto ayudara a fortalecer el negocio, con más capacidad para la producción.
Su aspiración es crecer en el negocio, instalar una tienda para tener más entradas de dinero, tambien quiere apoyar a su hija a seguir estudiando.
texts.en: Ana works selling food and soft-drinks.  She’s a single mother of a 16-year-old daughter; she does not have any relatives abroad.  She’s been in the food business for 13 years.  She started it on her own initiative and works every day from 6am until 6pm.  Her advantage is that she has no nearby competition.  She’s asking for a loan to buy kitchen supplies to continue in business.  She will buy chicken, rice, soft-drink and meats, among other products for food sales.  This will help her strengthen the business giving it more production capacity.  Her hope is to grow in business and to open a store to have more sources of income; she also wants to support her daughter’s further schooling.

loans.use: to buy chicken, rice, soft-drinks and meats.

loans.name: Pedrino

texts.es:
Pedrino, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, porque necesita invertir en la tienda y ademas veder medicina natural, comprando productos de la canasta básica, arroz, frijol, aceite, azúcar, tambien medicina natural, para aumentar los productos.
Con el préstamo anterior ayudo en la tienda, surtiéndolo de productos y tambien realizo cultivo agricola invirtio en la compra de abono para realizar una milpa, con esto ha permanecido trabajando para su familia.
texts.en:
Pedrino decided to request a new loan because he needs to invest in his store.  He sells natural medicines, and basic products such as rice, beans, cooking oil, sugar.  He wants to increase his inventory.

He used the money from the previous loan to stock his store and invest in his crops by buying fertilizer.  This has allowed him to work for his family.

loans.use: to stock his store.

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en: Roseline is 36, single, and the mother of two children (ages 5 and 12). Her children live in her home and are attending school. Roseline lives in West Point, where she has run a cook shop for the past six years. She operates her business six days a week, from 6 am to 4 pm. She always prepares delicious meals like cassava leaves, fufu and soup (made from cassava), potatoes, grains, and palaver sauce (a West African stew) to meet her customers' demand. Because of the good service she provides to her customers, she has earned a profit, which she has reinvested to improve her business. Roseline is requesting a loan to purchase more ingredients in hopes of increasing her sales. Her plans for the future are to provide her children with a higher level of education and to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with two children, both of whom currently attend school. She is looking after her siblings and her mother. Justine has been selling cooked food from door to door for three years, and she works seven days per week. She has no other source of income. She rents a house with access to both electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses are school fees and rent.

Justine has requested a loan of UGX 500,000 from MCDT-SACCO to increase her stocks of rice, Irish potatoes, and cooking oil. Her challenges include unstable food prices and moving from door to door. Her dream is to own a fully stocked restaurant and to build her own house. She joined MCDT because she had little capital to support her business.

loans.use: to buy more rice, Irish potatoes, and cooking oil

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is 37 years old and married. She has seven children: three daughters and four sons. She is striving hard to meet their demands, including food, clothing, and healthcare. Her husband sells leather. His income is not sufficient to meet the daily expenditures of the family, so Rukhsana started her business to contribute to their income.

Rukhsana has been in the sewing business for many years. She is very familiar with stitching techniques. She initiated her business with the support of Kashf Foundation; she took her first loan to buy a sewing machine. At present, she enjoys a great client list and has gained a lot of appreciation and popularity in her community. 

Rukhsana has requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to buy stocks of thread in different colors and packages of laces, zippers, and other supplies. With these items, she believes that she will to be able to meet the demands of her customers without fail. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a high-quality education to her children through her hard work.

loans.use: to buy stocks of thread, laces, and zippers

loans.name: Ma. Cecelia

texts.en:
Ma. Cecelia is a 32-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol in the Philippines and a mother of four children. Her husband works as a tricycle driver. 

Ma. Cecelia earns a living through her sari sari or variety store business. She has been in the business for some time now. She sells various kinds of goods to the people in her place.

Ma. Cecelia needs a loan to buy more stocks like canned goods, noodles, chips, snack foods, sodas, and seasonings. Any additional income that she will generate will be used for her family's daily consumption and reinvestment in the business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks like canned goods, noodles, chips, snack foods, sodas, and seasonings.

loans.name: Heras' Group

texts.en:
Heras is a 29 years-old, hard working, young Iraqi man. He is married and has three children.

Heras took a loan in the past, working hard towards his ambitious plans to provide for his family working in his own business. At the time he was an employee who was just starting to take steps towards having his business. He successfully repaid the previous loan and is now ready for a business loan to support the improvements he plans for his own business. 

His own business activity, which he now has 2 years experience with, is a mechanic shop specializing in oil changes and tires. With both of these specialized services being greatly required in his hot dusty city, he is confident in the shop being able to generate enough income to support his family.

Heras is now taking a loan to be able to buy a compressor and special equipment for fixing tires.

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers "Group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor - thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of 3 to 5 clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group.

loans.use: to buy a compressor and special equipment for fixing tires.

loans.name: Momo

texts.en: Momo is a married woman with 4 children. She describes herself as  social and hard-working. Momo operates a retail store where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. It is located in a viable business area, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest challenge as insufficient funds for improving the business. Momo will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy charcoal to sell. Her business goal is to improve her business within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will become a distributor of charcoal to customers. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Doris is a 36-year-old married woman. She has 5 children. She describes herself as hard-working. She operates a retail business where she sells water. Her business is located in a viable commercial area, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient funds for improving the business. Doris will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy water storage containers. Her goal is to improve her business within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will have expanded her business.

loans.use: to buy water storage containers

loans.name: Kazhal's Group

texts.en:
Kazhal is a 51-year-old Iraqi woman. She is married and has two children. Kazhal learned to sew at a young age, so she decided to put her sewing skills to use. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Kazhal is one of the many Iraqi woman who works from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

Kazhal has two years' experience in making dresses and other small fabric household items for her customers. While she is confident in her sewing skills and knows she can satisfy her customers, she would like to focus on improving her own working conditions to make her experience a little nicer. She would like to renew her work area. To pay for the renovation, she took a loan from Relief International - Microfinance Iraq.

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers "group loans" for clients who are unable to provide a guarantor and are therefore unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of 3 to 5 clients, and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group.

loans.use: to pay for the renovation of her work area

loans.name: Carlos Osmin

texts.es:
Carlos, es agricultor, tiene 48 años de edad, vive con su esposa de 40 años de edad, posee dos hijos jóvenes que están estudiando el bachillerato, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y venta de pan por las mañanas, aprendió el negocio con su familia, tambien cultiva dos manzanas de terreno el maíz, de lunes a sábado.
Carlos busca el apoyo de un préstamo para poderlo invertir en sus actividades agrícolas, pues se dispone a sembrar y comprara abono, semilla, preparación del terreno, esto le ayudara para tener el cultivo en buenas condiciones, que obtenga buena cosecha para vender.
El objetivo de Carlos es fortalecer más sus cultivos, con ello estará ofreciendo a su familia una mejor calidad de vida, porque la cosecha servirá para su alimento y para vender.
texts.en: Carlos works in agriculture.  He’s 48-years-old and lives with his 40-year-old wife.  He has two teen-age children who are attending high-school.  He works growing corn and selling bread in the morning.  He learned the business with his family.  He also grows corn on two manzanas [Central American unit of land measurement] of farmland Monday through Saturday.  Carlos is looking for support from a loan to invest in his agricultural activities because he’s getting ready to plant and will buy manure, seeds and will prepare the soil.  This will help him have a crop in good condition that will lead to a good harvest to sell.  Carlos’ objective is to strengthen his crops more and with this will be offering better quality of life for his family because the harvest will be both for their food and to be sold.

loans.use: to buy manure, seeds and to prepare the soil.

loans.name: El Triunfo Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Maria Luisa, tiene 62 años de edad, ella  forma parte del grupo de nombre "El Triunfo". Este grupo se caracetriza por se ordenado y cumplido con el pago de las cuota de sus prestamos.
