La Sra. Maria Luisa se dedica desde hace mas de 20 años a la venta de dulces, ella los prepara y reparte a domicilio a sus vecinos, amigos y familiares.
El prestamo recibido lo invirtió en la compra de insumos como azucar por costales y descartables que le sirven para entregar sus dulces.
texts.en: María Luisa, 62, is part of the “El Triunfo” (Triumph) communal bank; this group is noted for being very well-organized and for making their installment payments properly.  María Luisa has worked for more than 20 years selling sweets.  She makes them and home delivers them to neighbors, friends and family members.  The loan she got will be used to buy ingredients like sugar by the sack and disposable containers used to deliver her sweets.

loans.use: to buy supplies and disposable packaging for her sweets and dessert sales.

loans.name: Lener Francisco

texts.es:
Lener  vive en la cuidad de Managua tiene dos hijos
Se caracteriza por se responsable en su trabajo y con su familia.

  Se desempeña como cajero en una expresa desde hace cuatro años, vive en la casa de su madre.
Con su familia es por esta razón que decidió hacer la solicitud de préstamo para la compra de un terreno  
Para poder mejorar las condiciones de viva para su familia ya que donde esta viviendo no presenta las comodidades necesarias su familia.
texts.en: Lener lives in the city of Managua and he has two children.  He’s noted for being very responsible at work and with his family.  He’s been employed as a cashier in a firm for four years and lives with his family in his mother’s house which is why he’s decided to request a loan so he can buy land to improve his family’s living conditions because where he is now living does not have the necessary comfort level for his family.

loans.use: to buy land.

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es:
EL socio Arturo pertenece al banco comunal “Ricchary Runa” de la ciudad del Cusco - Perú.

El socio continua brindando el servicio de mudanza con su vehiculo,el socio lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,el socio es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
EL socio solicita el credito para realizar el mantenimiento de su carro como en el cambio de aceite y en la compra de algunos repuestos .

El socio agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Arturo is a member of the “Ricchary Runa” communal bank in Cusco, Peru.

He continues to provide moving services with his vehicle and has been doing this for years.  Things are going well for him, thanks to the effort he puts in daily.  He is a responsible and hardworking person and in this way moves his family forward.

He is asking for a loan in order to do maintenance on his car, such as doing an oil change and buying some replacement parts.

He is grateful for this loan and promises to make his payments on schedule.

loans.use: to maintain his vehicle.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio, vive con su familia su esposa y tres hijos, él es agricultor, dedicado a la siembra de maíz, él aprendió desde hace 10 años, su horario es de lunes a domingo y la ventaja es tener el terreno propio para cultivarlo.
Él está realizando la siembra de maíz, solicita un crédito para comprarse los insumos necesarios como la compra de semilla, herbicidas y pago de mano de obra para la preparación del suelo, este crédito le servirá para mejorar su trabajo.
La aspiración de Julio es trabajar por su familia, mejorar la vivienda y tener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Julio lives with his family; his wife and three children.  He is a farmer who raises corn, having learned to do this ten years ago.  He works Monday through Sunday and has the advantage of having his own farmland.

He is planting corn and is asking for a loan so that he can buy necessary supplies such as seeds, herbicides, and pay for labor to prepare the ground.  This loan will help him improve his work.

Julio’s aspirations are to work to support his family, improve his house, and have a better income.

loans.use: to buy supplies and labor.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José, está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas, ya que está realizando una nueva siembra y se comprara abono, semilla, herbicidas y pago de mozos, y para la corta de ajonjolí, este financiamiento le ayudara a mejorar su condición en el trabajo.
Con el préstamo anterior logro cultivar maíz en tres manzanas de terreno, pero tuvo una perdida ocasionada por la falta de agua en la zona, en este tiempo se vio afectado porque sus ingresos disminuyeron, su deseo es seguir realizando la siembra y apoyar a su familia.
texts.en:
José is requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies because he's doing another planting and will buy fertilizer, seed, and herbicide, and pay for labor and cutting the sesame plants.  This loan will help him improve his working conditions.

With the previous loan he managed to grow corn on three manzanas of land, but he had a loss from the lack of water in the area.  This time he was affected because his income dropped.  His desire is to continue with his crops and support his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seed, and herbicide, and to pay for labor

loans.name: Hermine

texts.en:
Hermine is from Artashat town of Ararat region. She is 35 years old and lives with her husband (in the photo) and three children. The family earns their living through an agricultural business. More specifically, the family owns a plot of land where different kinds of fruits and vegetables are grown. Hermine and her husband do all of the relevant agricultural work to ensure a good harvest. The harvested products are then sold at the local open market.
 
Hermine has requested this loan to purchase eight calves, and grass for feeding them. This will enable her to get milk and use it in cheese production. This investment will increase her family's income and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for eight calves to be raised for dairy production, and grass for feeding them.

loans.name: Avara's Group

texts.en:
Avara is a 37-year-old, Iraqi woman. She is married and has two children. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Avara is one of the many Iraqi women who is working from home. She uses her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

Avara has five years' experience with the small, home-based sewing business. She enjoys providing her customers with nice and good-quality results, but she would like to improve her own working conditions. She would like to renew her work area, and to be able to pay for the renovation work, she is taking a loan from Relief International - Microfinance Iraq.  

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers "group loans" for clients who are unable to provide a guarantor, which makes them ineligible to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of 3 to 5 clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount, which is limited to the amount that can be repaid by the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group. 

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about these borrowers has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to pay for the renovation of her sewing area.

loans.name: Joavher's Group

texts.en:
One member of Joavher's Group is Joavher. She is 35 years old. She is a married Iraqi woman with four children. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Joavher is one of the many Iraqi women who are working from home, using their sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of their families.

Joavher has seven years' experience with the sewing and tailoring business. To be able to provide her customers with a greater variety of creative quality products, she would like to buy an overlock sewing machine. To be able to make the purchase, she is taking a loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq. 

Relief International Microfinance Iraq offers "group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor and, therefore, unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of 3 to 5 clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group. 

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection. Relief International Microfinance Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine to provide her customers with a greater variety of creative quality products.

loans.name: Carlota

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” RICHARY RUNA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco,  perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Carlota;la socia continua con su negocio de venta de tamales,la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio ,la socia vende en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de Cusco durante el dia,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar de insumos para su negocio como maíz, manteca y para algunos gastos personales.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en: Carlota belongs to the “Richary Runa” communal bank located in Cusco District belonging to Cusco Province and Department.  She continues selling tamales.  She’s been in this business for years and does well thanks to the effort she puts into it every day.  She sells in one of Cusco’s markets during the day.  She’s a responsible, dedicated person who supports her family this way.  She’s requesting the loan to buy ingredients like corn and lard for her business and to pay some personal expenses.  She’s happy with the loan and commits to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy tamale-making supplies and to pay some personal expenses.

loans.name: Colquecancha Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “COLQUECANCHA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Sorayda ella es casada y tiene 28 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de agricultura, la socia tiene un terreno de cultivo donde siembra papa,haba,cebada y maíz, la socia cultiva y luego los vende en los diferentes mercados, la socia se dedica este negocio 10 años y le va muy bien, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de agricultura y mejorar la tierra de cultivo. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insecticidas y semillas.
La socia que esta tapada su cara con un circulo se retiro del banco comunal Colquecancha por motivos de trabajo.
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de tienda de abarrotes, negocio de venta de maíz, negocio de venta de comida y negocio de venta de ganado.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These are members of the “COLQUECANCHA” communal bank, located in the Urubamba district and province of the Cusco department.

Sorayda is 28 years old, married, and has two children.  She works in her agricultural business and has farmland where she raises potatoes, beans, and barley and later sells them in different markets.  She has been doing this for 10 years and things are going very well for her.  She works from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm and moves her children ahead through this business.  Her dream is to expand her farming business and improve her farmland.  She is asking for this loan to buy insecticide and seeds.

The woman with her face b locked out left the communal bank.  The other members have grocery stores, sell corn, food, and livestock.

[Sorayda] is grateful to those who form part of this dream through this means and she promises to make her payments on schedule.

loans.use: to buy seeds and supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Carlota

texts.es:
Carlota, vive con su hija, es madre soltera, ella trabaja en su propia casa atendiendo un negocio de venta de productos domésticos, ella inicio este negocio por un proyecto que llego a la zona, con el que surtió de mercadería y supo aprovechar la oportunidad para tener bien establecido el negocio y darle seguimiento.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercadería para surtir el negocio en la compra de boquitas, galletas, gaseosas, jugos, pan, y más. Con este préstamo ella surtirá el negocio para satisfacer la necesidad de los clientes. 
Su objetivo es tener la tienda muy surtida de mercadería, que le permita generar ventas para solventar las necesidades del hogar.
texts.en: Carlota lives with her daughter; she’s a single mother.  She works at home tending to a store selling domestic products.  She started the business as a project when she came to this zone.  She stocked up on merchandise and took advantage of the opportunity to establish the business well and follow through with it.  She’s requesting a loan to buy merchandise to stock the store.  She’ll buy packaged snacks, cookies, soft-drinks, juices, bread, etc.  With this loan she’ll stock the store to meet customer demand.  Her goal is to have the store very well-stocked with merchandise to generate sales and meet household needs.

loans.use: to buy packaged snacks, cookies, soft-drinks, juices and bread.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Víctor, vive con su esposa, él  es divorciado y en su anterior matrimonio tiene un hijo, por quien está pendiente para ayudarlo, Víctor es sastre, este negocio nació hace más de 20 años, pero obtuvo su negocio propio hace 13 años, en un puesto de mercado, aprendió a través de clases de costura.
Solicita un préstamo para pagar el mantenimiento de las maquinas de coser, esta inversión le ayudara para mejorar la calidad del trabajo, ofreciendo un buen servicio a los clientes y mayor agilidad.
El sueño de Víctor es hacer más grande el taller de sastrería.
texts.en: Víctor lives with his wife.  He’s divorced and has a son from his former marriage that he’s watches over and helps.  Víctor is a tailor; the business arose more than 20 years ago but it’s been his own for the last 13 years.  It’s a stand in the market and he learned it by taking tailoring courses.  He’s requesting a loan to pay to service his sewing machines.  This investment will help him improve the quality of his work offering quicker, better customer service.  Víctor’s dream is to enlarge his tailor workshop.

loans.use: to service his sewing machines.

loans.name: Umeda

texts.ru:
Умеде 25 лет. Она замужем на хорошего человека, но не имеет детей. С детства она мечтала иметь свой бизнес и помогала родителям в ведении бизнеса, так как ее родители очень успешные бизнесмены. После замужества она осознала, что срочно должна реализовать свою детскую мечту в реальность, и таким образом зарабатывать деньги. Его муж работает кредитным офицером в организации и его доход не хватает для содержания семьи.
С целью организовать свой бизнес она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она хочет организовать бизнес купле продажей  скота. От полученного дохода она планирует улучшить условию проживания и купить не обходимых технологий и мебели для своих будущих детей. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 900 сомони для покупки скота, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Umeda is 25 years old. She is married with a good man, but has no children. Since childhood she has dreamed of owning her own business and she has helped her parents with their business, as they are very successful business people. After getting married, she realized that she should quickly realize her childhood dream and make money this way. Her husband works as a loan officer in an organization and his income is not sufficient to support the family.

With an aim to organize her own business, Umeda attended the course "Achieve success", organized by the Association of Business Women, and she received a certificate. Currently she may set up her own business and become successful in this area. She would like to set up a business of buying and reselling livestock. With the income received, she plans to improve her living conditions and buy necessary technical appliances and furniture for her future children. She requests a loan in the amount of 900 somoni for the purchase of livestock, in order to set up the new business. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase livestock for setting up a new business

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 35 year-old married woman who is the mother of five children, one of whom goes to school. Three years ago, she stared a clothing business to supplement her husband's low income. Nasreen was filled with hope when she started her business and she contacted the Kashf Foundation upon the advice of her neighbor. She buys clothes with different designs from the market in bulk and sells them in her community, mostly to her neighbors. 

Nasreen is requesting a 25,000 PKR loan to buy an ample variety of winter clothing to add to her inventory. She hopes to educate all of her children but is unable to cover their expenses. Nasreen intends to use the profit from her loan for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy winter clothing to add to her inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Rosaura

texts.es:
Con 51 años de edad Rosaura tiene una mision, que es sacar adelante a sus hijos, tiene 4 hijos. JUntos habitan en una vivienda construida a base de madera. Desde hace 20 años viene dedicándose al rubro productivo del cacao orgánico en su localidad. Se inicio con el apoyo de sus padres quienes le proporcionaron una parcela, pues de quer era niña ayudaba mucho a sus padres en el trabajo agrícola y como compensación le cedieron una parcela. Actualmente siembra plantas de almacigo de cacao. Ella comenta, que anteriormente deseaba incursionar en la producción de piña pero decidió posponerlo debido a que la parcela destinada aún posee árboles de cacao en su fase muy productiva y es factible sacarles el máximo provecho posible.
Para complementar sus ganancias, cosecha algunas frutas que posee como naranjas y plátanos y los expende a los vendedores en la feria de su localidad con el objetivo de generar ganancias acciónales para sus compras semanales. 
Ella desea contar con capital suficiente que le permita iniciar de manera fluida la campaña del sembrado de cacao, pues neceita sacar la maleza, contratar jornaleros, y aplicar abono orgánico. 
Al ser una madre acomedida con las diversas actividades comerciales a planeado iniciarse en la crianza de cerdos de corral de manera algo tecnificada puesto que el precio que demanda actualmente es muy rentable a comparación de otros animales de corral, según considera. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, se siente agradecida por la oportunidad de ingresar al mundo de los microcréditos puesto que le era muy necesario contar con una solvencia económica para trabajar de manera fluida. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles complementará su capital destinado al pago de los jornaleros, para el inicio de campaña de sembrado de cacao y la compra de sacos de abono orgánico para garantizar una producción de calidad.
texts.en:
At the age of 51, Rosaura has a mission: to get her four children ahead.  Together they live in a home built of wood.  For 20 years she has been making a living in the area of producing organic cacao in her town.  She started with the support of her parents, who gave her a plot of land as compensation for always helping them a lot with the farm labor since she was a little girl.  

Currently she grows cacao seed.  She says that previously she wanted to get into pineapple production but she decided to postpone it because the land still had cacao trees in their productive phase and it's feasible to get the maximum profit from them.  To supplement her earnings she harvests some fruits, such as oranges and bananas, and sells them to vendors in the street fair in her town to earn additional profit for her weekly purchases.  She wants to have enough capital to start the cacao-planting season smoothly, so she needs to weed, hire day laborers, and apply organic fertilizer.

She's a mother who offers to help with the various commercial activities, so she planned to get started raising pigs using some technology because she thinks the price they get currently is very profitable compared to other barnyard animals.  This is her first loan with MFP.  She's grateful for the opportunity to get into the world of micro-loans because she needed to be solvent to work smoothly.

The 1,000 nuevos soles [PEN] will supplement her capital for paying the day laborers, starting the cacao-planting season, and buying sacks of organic fertilizer to guarantee a quality production.

loans.use: to hire day laborers and to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Fidel Antonio

texts.es:
Fidel, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo para terminar de trabajar en la tierra, con la siembra de maíz y pipián, invirtiendo en abono, semilla y pagara mozos para trabajar en la siembra, esto beneficiara a Fidel para que desempeñe un buen trabajo en la siembra.
Él tuvo un efecto positivo con el préstamo anterior, considera que saco la cosecha de maíz y pipián, para poder alimentar a su familia y tambien vender, pero además manifiesta que tuvo una parte de esta siembra que la perdió, por falta de agua en el invierno.
texts.en:
Fidel decided to get a new loan so he can stop working on the land sowing corn and squash. He will invest in fertlizer and seed, and he will pay farmhands to work during the sowing season. This will help Fidel's sowing season to go well.

The previous loan had a positive effect. He was able to harvest the corn and squash in order to feed his family, and he was also able to sell some of the harvest, but he says that some of the crops sown were lost due to the lack of water during winter.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seed, and pay farmhands.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: La Sra. Maria tiene 39 años tiene 1 hijo de la edad de 7 años, la Sra. Maria se dedica a la venta de DVDs de música  y películas de manera ambulante, ella tiene su casa propia  que está ubicada en la localidad de El Torno,  este préstamo es su quinta secuencia dentro de la institución, ella es cliente antigua, la Sra. Maria va a usar este préstamo para invertir en la compra de un televisor para hacer la prueba los DVDs que vende a  los clientes, la  Sra. Maria enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la falta de efectivo para la compra de estos productos y va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando variedad de productos según la temporada para vender, su deseo para su negocio es crecer más y ayudar a su familia, ya que esta es la actividad con la que mantiene a su familia.
texts.en: María, 39, has a seven-year-old son.  She works selling music and movie DVDs from place to place.  She owns a house in El Torno.  This loan is her 5th sequence in the institution.  She’s a long-standing client.  María will use this loan to buy a television set to test the DVDs she sells to her customers.  The business challenge María faces is lack of cash to buy these products and she will use her profits to continue buying a variety of seasonal products to sell.  Her wish for her business is to grow more and help her family since this is the activity she has to support her family with.

loans.use: to buy a television set.

loans.name: Dora Argentina's Group

texts.es:
La señora Dora es una persona muy honesta y responsable, vive con  sus 3 hijos en un caserío en un caserío al sur de  Honduras. 
Doña Dora su negocio es una  pulpería y necesita el  préstamo  para la compra de refrescos, carne, azúcar, café, frijoles, sal, arroz, churros, aguas, galletas, papel higiénico, pan, jugos, etc. Con el préstamo ella espera que sus ventas aumenten gracias la inversión.
Doña Dora en esta temporada desea poder ofrecer más mercadería a sus clientes que son los vecinos de su comunidad y así cubrir sus necesidades, tambien espera que su estilo de vida mejore un poco.
Doña Dora en un futuro, sueña que su negocio este posicionado como el más grande y reconocido su caserío  y poder seguir apoyando a  sus hijos para que se conviertan en personas de bien y con valores.
Doña Nely su negocio es la venta de tortillas y servicio de molino de maíz, tiene 4 años de dedicarse a su negocio.
Doña Senayda su negocio es una  pulpería tiene 4 años de dedicarse a su negocio. 


Choluteca, Honduras – Noviembre  2012
texts.en:
Dora is a very honest, responsible woman living with her three children in a settlement in southern Honduras.  Her business is a grocery store and she needs the loan to buy soft-drinks, meat, sugar, coffee, beans, salt, rice, packaged snacks, water, cookies, toilet paper, bread, juice, etc.  With the loan she hopes her sales will increase thanks to the investment.  Dora would like to have more merchandise this season to offer her customers who are her neighbors in the community and thus meet their needs; she also hopes that her lifestyle will improve a bit.   Dora dreams with her store becoming in the future the largest and best-known in the hamlet and to continue supporting her children so that they will become upstanding people with a good set of values.  

Nely’s business is tortilla sales and corn mill service; she’s been in business four years and Senayda’s business is a grocery store she’s had for four years.


Choluteca, Honduras – November, 2012

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store with.

loans.name: Rolando Obdulio

texts.es:
Rolando, vive con su esposa y dos hijos, la casa en la que residen es propia, sus hijos estudian uno está en la universidad y el otro está cursando bachillerato, Rolando se dedica a atender el taller de estructuras metálicas, este oficio lo aprendió trabajando varios años como ayudante, decidió poner su propio negocio solo elaborando polines, poco a poco fue creciendo y mejorando el taller y ya tiene 20 años de experiencia.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de lamina, hierro, para elaboración de puertas metálicas, esto ayudara a que cuente con lo necesario para mejorar la calidad de su trabajo, teniendo el material a la mano, su riesgo puede ser los precios del hierro que suelen subir.
Él tiene como objetivo ampliar el negocio, comprar más herramientas y equipo para el negocio, agregar más diseños a los balcones.
texts.en:
Rolando lives with his wife and two children in a home of their own.  His children attend school and one attends university.  The other on is a bachelors student.  Rolando has a metal shop and learned this trade by working as an assistant for several years.  He decided to start his own business, making poles, and grew and improved the shop little by little.  Now he has 20 years’ experience.

He is asking for a loan so that he can buy metal, and iron bars to make metal doors.  This will allow him to have the necessary supplies on hand to improve his quality of work.  His risk is that the price of iron will go up.

He has a goal to expand his business, buy more tools and equipment for his business, and add more designs.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Jumakan

texts.ru: Жумакан 36 лет, проживает с мужем в гражданском браке.У них с мужем есть один замечательный, новорожденный  сын.Муж Жумакан помогает ей в ведении бизнеса, точнее он больше занят реализацией продукции. Жумакан в качестве источника дохода для своей семьи, три года назад начала заниматься птицеводством, вложив в этот бизнес 10,000 KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Жумакан в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется равитое птицеводчексое хозяйство, ежемесячная прибыль от хозяйства составляет около 30,000 сом (KGS) от реализации яиц и кур. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса и обновления кур. В связи с тем что куры очень старые,Жумакан вместо возможных 70-80 лотков яиц в день получает лишь сорок. Жумакан обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 200 кур. Увеличив сбор яиц, Жумакан сможет увеличить свои доходы.  Доходы от кредита Жумакан планирует вкладывать в развитие бизнеса , В планах она хочет открыть собственную точку по реализации яиц.
texts.en:
Jumakan is 36 years old and lives with her husband. They have a wonderful, newborn son together. Jumakan's husband helps her with managing her business, mostly with selling the products. In search of a source of income for her family, Jumakan started working with poultry farming three years ago, after having invested 10,000 som (KGS) in this business. Thanks to persistent work, Jumakan currently has a well-developed poultry business, which brings in around 30,000 som (KGS) per month through sales of eggs and chickens.

In order to further develop her business, Jumakan needs to get new chickens. Because her chickens are old, she only gets around 40 trays of eggs per day, instead of potentially 70-80. Jumakan turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 120,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of 200 chickens. By increasing the number of eggs, Jumakan can increase her income. Jumakan plans to invest the income from the loan in developing her business. She plans to open her own sales point for selling eggs.

loans.use: to purchase 200 chickens

loans.name: Shernazar

texts.ru: Успешно закончив свой кредит, Шерназар решил подать следующую заявку.    Он занимается торговлей овощей.    На очередной кредит он хочет купить оптом картошку, так как  в зимний период будет подорожание на неё.    Его жена недавно  родила мальчика теперь  Шерназар счастливый папа. Теперь он больше старается работать чтобы его сын не нуждался не в чем.    Шерназар очень энергичный и весёлый мужчина, он очень  благодарен организации Арванд за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
After having successfully repaid his loan, Shernazar decided to submit another application. He works with selling vegetables. For the next loan he would like to purchase potatoes in bulk, as their price increases in the winter period. 

Shernazar's wife gave birth to a small son not long ago, and now Shernazar is a happy father. Currently he works harder so that his son won't be in need of anything. Shernazar is a very energetic and cheerful man, and he is very thankful to Arvand for the financial support.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes in bulk

loans.name: Saida

texts.ru: Саида замужем и имеет детей. Погасив свой предыдущий кредит она решила в очередной раз обратится в МДО "Арванд", чтобы привезти зимний товар.  За период кредитования она расширила свой товарооборот в 3 раза и очень довольна этим. Саида сама ездит за товаром  в другой город,  едет на такси со знакомыми, ей очень тяжело но она не падает духом и старается развивать свой бизнес. Это их единственный доход в семье.  На полученный кредит Саида планирует привести зимний ассортимент одежды. Она очень благодарна Арванд за помощь и поддержку.
texts.en:
Saida is married and has children. After having repaid her previous loan, she decided to turn to MDO Arvand one again, in order to purchase winter goods. Over the previous loan period she increased her turnover by three times and is very pleased with this. 

Saida goes to another city to get the goods herself, in a taxi together with acquaintances. It is very hard on her, but she does not lose heart and tries to develop her business. This is the family's only income. For the loan received, Saida plans to purchase winter clothing. She is very thankful to Arvand for the help and support.

loans.use: to purchase winter clothing

loans.name: Karolina

texts.en:
Karolina is a 55-year-old widow. Since the death of her husband five years ago, she has been responsible for taking care of her family. She has two children; Debby, 23, who is married, and Ishak, 19, who is in the first semester at a local university. 

Karolina started a kiosk business two years ago by using her savings. The income generated was spent to meet her family's needs as well as for her son’s schooling fees. Karolina realized that Ishak will need a lot of money for his educational needs for several years. Therefore, Karolina wanted to enlarge the business by increasing her inventory. To do so, Karolina went to TLM and requested a loan amounting to IDR 3,000,000. She would like to buy more inventory of sugar, oil, cigarettes, wheat flour, coffee, tea and candy. She hopes the more income generated, the more money she can save for her son’s education.

loans.use: to buy more retail inventory such as sugar, oil, cigarettes, wheat flour, coffee, tea and candy.

loans.name: Shaban

texts.en:
Shaban is a 32-year-old married man with three children whose ages range from six months to 10 years. He describes himself as a social and business-oriented man. For the past eight years, Shaban has operated a carpentry workshop where he makes and sells furniture such as beds, chairs, doors, and other items. His business is in a rural area and his primary customers are local residents. Shaban's his biggest business challenge is the lack of enough raw material to make furniture to sell.

Shaban is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to buy wood to make furniture. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM. Shaban's business goal is to expand his business within five years.

loans.use: to buy wood to make furniture to sell

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica 33 and is married with two children who are four and 11. She lives the West Point community and her children attend school. For the past ten years, Veronica has been selling used children's clothing. She works hard and her business is productive for her family. Veronica works 12 hours a day and transports her goods in taxi.

Veronica is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothing to sell. In the future, she hopes to give her children a better education.

loans.use: to purchase used clothing to sell

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina runs a pottery business in her place in Talibon, Bohol. She works hard to support her husband, especially in dealing with their pot-making business. Marcelina has been in the business for almost 20 years now and she lacks additional capital to expand. 

Marcelina is requesting a loan to buy materials such as clay to make pots. She will also buy materials such as nails and wood to renovate her house. Marcelina hopes to use her loan to make more pots and renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy materials such as clay to make pots

loans.name: Drocelle

texts.en:
Drocelle is 26 years old and is married with one child. She sells a variety of merchandise such as shoes, salt, and sugar. 

Drocelle is requesting a loan to buy more items to sell. She will use the profits from her loan to buy a plot of land to cultivate.

loans.use: to buy shoes, salt, and sugar to sell

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La socio Rosa pertenece al banco comunal “Ricchary Runa” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.

La socia continua con su negocio de compra y venta de artesania como plateria entre otros,la socia lleva años  en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio ,la socia a la vez distribuye su mercaderia a  sus clientes que le solicitan como centros artesanales ,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante  a su familia.

La socia solicita el credito para la compra de aretes de palta para su negocio.


La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
The borrower, Rosa, belongs to the communal bank "Ricchary Runa" in the city of Cusco - Peru. 

She continues her business of buying and selling handicrafts like silverware, among other things. She has spent years in this business which is doing is well thanks to the efforts she puts into her business everyday, while she distributes her merchandise to customers who request craft centers. She is a responsible and earnest person, thus being the partner that supports her family. 

She is requesting a loan to by silver earring for her business. 

She appreciates the loan and agrees to comply with the payment plan according the the payment schedule.

loans.use: purchase sliver earrings for her business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María de 24 años comparte una vida conyugal con Nelson, tiene como principal motivación a sus dos pequeños hijos Juan y Naomi. Es propietaria de una vivienda construida a base de madera. Dedicada anteriormente a la venta de comida en una feria muy cercana a su domicilio decidió cambiar de rubro debido a la excesiva competencia que presentaba su negocio.
Es así como motivada por su gran capacidad de brindarle a sus clientes una buena atención decidió desde hace 3 años liderar de manera independiente su juguería y fuente de soda en un local dentro del mercado de su localidad.
Le agrada mucho su actividad puesto que es muy hábil en la preparación de diversos jugos de fruta de la zona como la papaya, plátano, piña entre otros. Sus clientes por lo general acompañan las deliciosas bebidas que prepara con sándwich y otros para el cual debe siempre contar con ingredientes básicos para la preparación de los mismos. Es por lo mismo que desea contar con capital de respaldo para la compra de diversos insumos y mantener su negocio abastecido.
Uno de sus principales objetivos dentro de un periodo no muy lejano es adquirir un terreno y posteriormente iniciar la construcción de su vivienda en beneficio del bienestar familiar. Este es su segundo crédito, desde ya desea generar un buen historial crediticio con el fin de acceder a un crédito mayor. Es una socia muy participativa y a su vez puntual en las reuniones de grupo.
Con los 500 nuevos soles complementará su capital para mantener su negocio bien abastecido con los ingredientes para la preparación de sándwich y compra de frutas al por mayor.
texts.en:
María, 24, shares her married life with Nelson.  Her main motivation is her two small children, Juan and Naomi.  She owns a house made of wood.  She used to work selling food in a nearby market but decided to change her line of work due to the high level of competition her business had.

Motivated by her great capacity for good customer service she decided three years ago to manage her juice stand and soda fountain independently inside one of the local markets.

She likes her work very much because she’s very skilled in making various regional fruit juices like papaya, banana and pineapple, among others.  Her customers usually accompany their delicious beverages with a sandwich or other things she makes so she must always have the necessary basic ingredients on hand to make them.  This is why she wants to have back-up capital to buy various ingredients and keep her business stocked.

One of her main goals for the not too distant future is to buy a lot and start to build her house for her family’s wellbeing.  This is her second loan and she wants to establish a good credit history so that she will be able to access a larger loan.  She’s a very participative as well as very punctual member at her group meetings.  She will use the 500 new soles to add to her capital to keep her business well-stocked with the ingredients needed to make the sandwiches and to buy fruit at wholesale.

loans.use: to buy fruit at wholesale as well as chicken and meat to make sandwiches.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy vegetables to resell

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane is 41 years old and lives in the Hovtashen village of the Ararat region with her 20-year-old son. She works raising and selling grass. Gayane's work takes a lot of strength and requires physical work which is very hard for one woman. Her son helps with her work.

Gayane is requesting a loan to purchase onion seeds and fertilizer to improve the quality of her land. She will also use her loan to renovate her greenhouse. Gayane expects that her loan will significantly increase her family's income and enable her to provide better living conditions for her son.

loans.use: to purchase onion seeds and fertilizer to improve the quality of her land

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.en:
Jeannette is 25 years old and is married with one child. She works selling shoes and clothes. 

Jeannette is requesting a loan to buy more shoes to sell. She plans to use the profits from her loan to pay school fees for her child.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell

loans.name: Hendriter

texts.en:
Hendriter is a 28-year-old, married woman. She has four children. She describes herself as honest, warm, and customer-friendly. She operates a charcoal retail business, where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for one year. Her business is located at a local residential area, and her primary customers are people who live nearby. She says her biggest business challenge is insecurity in the area.

In addition to the charcoal business, Hendriter runs some rental houses, and this activity increases her business income. 

She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy charcoal to resell, and to pay for the renovation of some rental houses. Her business goal is to expand her business within five years.

loans.use: to buy charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Anastase

texts.en: Anastase is married to a businesswoman, and they have one child. He owns a store, which he has been running for the past four years. With the loan, he wants to add items like rice, cooking oil, and soaps, to his inventory for sale.

loans.use: To buy more rice, cooking oil, and soaps for resale.

loans.name: Laurice

texts.en:
Laurice is 22 years old and single with a three year old child who currently attends school. She lives in the West Point community and is a college student. For the past six years, Laurice has run a restaurant in her community. She prepares palm butter, palava, potatoes, and grain. She is able to earn a profit because her food is well prepared and her restaurant is one of the best in her community. Laurice works six days a week from six in the morning until four in the afternoon. She received the initial capital to start her business form her aunty and she learned to sell from her mother.

Laurice is requesting a loan to purchase more ingredients to prepare food for her business. In the future, her dream is to build a house and have a bigger restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to prepare food

loans.name: Jean Batiste

texts.en:
Jean Baptiste is 24 years old. For the past four years, he has run a shop where he sells different items.

Jean Baptiste is requesting a loan to buy more sugar and salt to sell. He will reinvest the profits from his loan into his business.

loans.use: to buy sugar and salt to sell

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is a 35-year-old married woman and the mother of three young children, from Talibon, Bohol. 

She owns a tricycle transport business. Her husband is the tricycle driver.

Maribel is asking for a loan to buy nuts and bolts and fuel for the motorcycle. With this, they will be able to maintain the tricyce in good working condition, thus allowing her husband to use it as a way of earning a living. 

In the future, Maribel hopes to explore another venture to augment their income. Moreover, she wants to save money for the school expenses of her children.

loans.use: to buy nuts and bolts and fuel for her motorcycle

loans.name: Heghine

texts.en:
Heghine is married and has two children. Besides her work at the local school, Heghine is engaged in agriculture. She has a plot of land, where she cultivates beech, potatoes and grass. 

With the received credit Heghine will purchase three calves and ten lambs. Together with her husband, Heghine will work hard on the farm to raise the animals, and will eventually sell them for a higher price. 

Heghine hopes that the loan will significantly increase her family's income and will enable her to ensure a better life for her children.

loans.use: to pay for three calves and ten lambs.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a married woman with three children between the ages of 22 to 28. For the past four years, she has operated a store where she sells items such as coats, slippers, scarves, and other products. Rebecca's business is located in a residential area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes herself as honest. Rebecca's biggest business challenge is the high price of slippers, coats, and other merchandise. 

Rebecca is requesting a 30,000 KES loan to buy coats, slippers, and scarves to sell. This will be her third loan with SMEP DTM and she has successfully repaid her previous loans. Rebecca's business goal is to run a boutique within five years. She hopes that, in the future, she will use her profits to improve her family's living standards

loans.use: to buy coats, slippers, and scarves to sell

loans.name: Athanasie

texts.en:
Athanasie is 35 years old. She sells construction materials, and she has been running her business for 16 years. 

With the loan, she wants to add more nails, timbers and bricks. 

With the profits from the business, she will pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more nails, timbers, and bricks for sale.

loans.name: Eyad

texts.en:
Eyad is a 38 years old and married. He is a father to two sons and one daughter, all of them under 12 years old. 

Eyad works in the public sector with a low income. This low income does not cover all the family needs. Eyad wants to buy some necessary home appliances such as a refrigerator and a heater to use in this cold winter.

For this purpose Eyad took a USD loan from FATEN, which will help the family to cover some of its necessary expenses and live in better home conditions.

About Shariah-compliant lending:  FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and a heater for home use

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 60-year-old, married woman. She has seven children. She describes herself as hard-working. She operates a retail store, where she sells soft drinks. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in an urban area, and her primary customers are local residents. She says her biggest business challenge is the high price she pays for soft drinks. 

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy soft drinks to resell. Her business goal is to improve her business within five years. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. She previously took a loan of KES 50,000, which she managed to pay back successfully.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks to resell

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en:
Chantal is 26 years old. She sells different merchandise and has spent four years at this business. 

She wants a loan to buy more rice, soap, and cooking oil. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more rice, soap, and cooking oil for sale.

loans.name: Cathreen

texts.en:
Cathreen is 54 years old and married. She has four children, ranging in age from 14 years to 29 years. She describes herself to be focused, sincere, and God-fearing. 

She operates a retail business where she sells water to the community and cereals.  She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located at a densely populated area, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be rationing of water she provides to the customers. 

She will use the KES 120,000 loan to pay for cementing the watering surface for the water tank 

Her business goal is to buy several water tanks, so as to be providing clean water to the whole community in her area within five  years. This is her fifth loan with SMEP DTM. Previously, Cathreen was selling clothes to the customers.

loans.use: to pay for cementing the watering surface for her water tank.

loans.name: Jose Monico

texts.es:
José, se dedica a la venta de mariscos, tiene 51 años de edad, vive con su esposa en casa de su madre, vende mariscos para poder obtener ingresos y ayudar en los gastos del hogar, este negocio tiene 7 años de existir, aprendió por iniciativa propia, trabaja de lunes a viernes de 6:00am a 7:00pm.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de mariscos frescos en su variedad de: pescado, camaron, conchas, entre otras especies que son demandadas por los clientes, esto incrementara el inventario de mercadería para atender la demanda de los clientes.
La aspiración de José es mejorar las condiciones económicas para vivir mejor con su esposa.
texts.en:
José makes a living selling fish. He is 51 years old and lives with his wife in his mother's house. He sells seafood in order to earn money to help pay the household expenses. José has been selling fish for 7 years. He has learned through his own initiative, working Monday through Friday from 6 a.m. to 7 p.m. 

José is requesting this loan to buy many fresh seafoods: fish, shrimp, shellfish, and other special varieties demanded by his customers. This would help him increase his supply in order to better serve his customers. His goal is to improve his financial situation so that he and his wife can live better.

loans.use: to buy fish, shrimp, and shellfish.

loans.name: Khursan

texts.ru: Хурсан – 54 года, замужем, имеет 4 детей. Кредитуется в  организации Арванд с 2011 года. Этот кредит Хурсан второй по счету. В предыдущем кредитовании она ни разу не нарушила условия кредитования и показала себя с хорошей стороны. Занимается откормом и продажей крупного рогатого скота и переработкой молока. Молоко у нее всегда свое, а часть она продаёт соседям. Муж Хурсан – пенсионер, помогает ей вести хозяйство и присматривает за скотом. Он в основном занимается продажей скота (выводит скот на рынок). Двое сыновей Хурсан находятся в РФ на заработках. Они тоже помогают родителям присылая им деньги. На полученный кредит Хурсан хочет купить крупно рогатый скот и увеличить поголовье скота. Она благодарна  организации Арванд за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: Khursan is 54 years old, married, and has 4 children. This loan will be Khursan's second with Arvand, where she has been a client since 2011. She proved herself to be very reliable with her previous loan, never once violating the terms of credit. Khursan fattens and sells cattle. She also processes milk, using part for her own consumption and selling part to her neighbours. Her husband is a pensioner and helps her on the farm, mainly by looking after the cattle and taking them to market to be sold. Two of her sons have gone to the Russian Federation to earn money. They also help their parents by sending money home. Khursan plans to use this loan to buy cattle to increase her herd. She is thankful to Arvand for the financial support.

loans.use: to  buy cattle

loans.name: Manuel

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 4 filhos, dos quais 2 ainda vão a Escola, vive na casa própria e sustenta sua mãe que vive com ele.
É electricista e trabalha a conta própria e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, pedra, areia, ferro, arame e outros) para reabilitara a sua casa. 
No futuro deseja casar oficialmente e formar se ainda na área de electricidade, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é trabalhar ainda mais e economizar mais fundos para a realização do seu desejo.
texts.en: Manuel is married and is the father of four children, two of whom go to school.  He lives in his own house and supports his mother, who lives with him.  He is an electrician and works independently.  He will use this loan to buy construction materials (cement, stone, sand, iron, wire, etc.) to fix up his house.  In the future, he hopes to buy his marriage license and to keep getting more training as an electrician.  To do this, he promises to make his payments on time so he can request more loans from Hluvuku.  His challenge is working even more and to save money to realize his dreams.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (cement, stone, sand, iron, wire, etc.) to fix up his house.

loans.name: Tharwat

texts.en:
Tharwat is a 39-year-old, married woman. She is a housewife and a mother to three sons. Tharwat is a conservative person, who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband, Majed, appears in her place in the Kiva profile photo. He was photographed next to the taxi.

Tharwat's husband has been driving a taxi for the past two years. This has been a profitable project and is the only source of income for the family. Now the business needs more support to cover its costs.

Tharwat is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to help her husband, by furnishing him with the last bit of money he needs to complete the price of purchasing his own taxi. Owning the taxi will enable Tharwat's husband to work extra hours and take additional internal and external requests for service. This will improve the family's income.

loans.use: To complete the price of purchasing the taxi

loans.name: Najla

texts.en: Najla is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband Saed appears in her Kiva profile photo, next to his taxi. Najla is 21 years old, married to Saed, and a mother to one daughter. Her husband is employed but earns a low income which is not enough to cover all the family's needs. He would like to have his own taxi and work with it as an extra source of income, but the amount of money he has isn't enough to cover all the costs. Najla has taken a loan from FATEN to help her husband to purchase his taxi. This loan will help the family to get another source of income and live in better conditions.

loans.use: to help her husband purchase his taxi

loans.name: Uziel

texts.en: Uziel is aged 42. He is married and owns a bar which he has been running for the past seven years. He wants to use his loan to add more crates of beer for sale. He plans to use the profits to renovate his house.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer for sale.

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en:
Nuru is a married woman, with two children. She describes herself to be a focused and generous woman. 

She operates a retail business where she sells water to her customers. Her business is located at a populated business area, and her primary customers are local residents . She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of an adequate storage facility. 

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy a water tank, which will be used to sell her water. 

Her business goal is to diversify her business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful in her business. 

This is her second loan with SMEP DTM, after taking a previous loan of KES 20,000, which she managed to pay succesfully.

loans.use: To buy a water tank

loans.name: Paulino

texts.es: El Sr. Paulino  tiene 23 años es casado tiene un hijo de 1 año,  se dedica  a la construcción y remodelación de viviendas, el es albañil contratista, el vive en la localidad de El Torno,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Paulino va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de una motocicleta ya que esto le permitirá realizar su trabajo de manera eficiente ya que tiene contratos que cumplir, y esto le permitirá movilizarse de manera rápida a sus obras ya que son distancias largas que tiene que recorrer,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en trabajo, el  Sr. Paulino va a utilizar los beneficios en comprar Herramientas para su trabajo ya que las que tiene se le están gastando y necesita renovar para realizar un mejor trabajo, el Sr. Paulino es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada  en la otorgación del crédito ya que esta es su única  actividad que le permite mantenerse.
texts.en:
Paulino is 23 years old, married and has a one-year-old son. He works in construction and renovating houses, and is a contractor. He lives in the town of El Torno. This loan is his first with the institution. 

Paulino is going to use this loan to buy a motorcycle, as this will allow him to carry out his work more efficiently. He has contracts to fulfill, and this will allow him to get around quickly to his construction sites, as the distances he has to travel are long. 

His reason for requesting this loan is to continue improving in his work. Paulino is going to use the profits to buy tools for his work, as the ones he has are wearing out, and he needs to replace them to do a better job.

Paulino is a very hard-working person. He feels happy about the opportunity offered him in the granting of the loan, as this livelihood is his only means of supporting himself.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: May

texts.es:
May es una joven de 22 años muy trabajadora, madre de la pequeña Naomi de 3 años cuyo padre es Wilmer su pareja. Recibieron por parte de sus padres una vivienda hecha a base de madera con el objetivo de brindarle las facilidades hasta lograr contar con una vivienda propia. Con motivo de reemplazar las actividades en el campo optó por dedicarse al comercio de verduras en el mercado de su localidad desde hace 2 años.
Con el apoyo de sus padres y el de su pareja logró iniciarse de a pocos implementando posteriormente la venta de pollo y abarrotes.
Considera su actividad como muy tranquila ya que es necesario estar en constante atención con el público llegando a entablar muchas amistades quienes a la larga son fieles clientes de su negocio, no obstante los días de lluvia son cuando menos salida tienen sus productos ocasionándole algunas perdidas puesto que la calidad que brinda son esénciales para ella como vendedora confiable.
Al notar un pequeño crecimiento en sus ventas diarias desea contar con capital suficiente para mantener siempre bien abastecido su negocio, para ello desea contar con sacos de cereales, conservas y otros.
Sus objetivos a largo plazo apuntan a ser la propietaria de  una tienda de abarrotes mayorista, pues es uno de sus sueño que asegura con trabajo y esfuerzo será posible hacerlo realidad. Este es su primero crédito, desde ya se siente muy agradecida puesto que era una herramienta de trabajo con la que siempre quiso contar y espera cuidarla con el cumplimiento responsable de sus cuotas. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles mantendrá abastecido su negocio por un buen periodo adquiriendo sacos de cereales, conservas y la compra de pollo al por mayor.
texts.en:
May is a 22 year old hardworking mother to little 3 year old Naomi whose father is May's partner, Wilmer. They received a house made of wood from their parents with the goal of providing them the facilities to achieve homeownership. With the objective of replacing her work in the field, she opted to work selling vegetables in her local market 2 years ago. 

With the support of her parents and her partner, she managed to initiate the sale of chicken and groceries. She considers her work to be very relaxed. It is necessary that she be in constant contact with the public, which has enabled her to make many friendships, who are ultimately loyal customers of her business. However, the rainy days are when she has the least sale of her products and some go to waste, given that providing quality is essential for her as a reliable vendor. 

Noticing a small growth in daily sales, she wants to have enough capital to always keep her business well stocked; that is why she wants to have sacks of cereal, canned foods and other goods. 

Her long-term goals are to be a wholesale grocery store owner. It is one of her dreams that she is sure with work and effort she can make a reality. This is her first loan, and she is already thankful for it was always a tool that she wanted to use. She hopes to take care of it with responsible repayments. With the 1000 soles, she will keep her business well stocked for a long period of time by purchasing bags of cereal, canned foods and wholesale chicken.

loans.use: purchase sacks of cereal, canned food and wholesale chicken.

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Lima De Conchacalla Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SANTA ROSA DE LIMA DE CONCHACALLA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Bernardina ella es conviviente y tiene 46 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azúcar,leche y aceite, la socia ya tiene 20 años en este negocio, la socia también se dedica al negocio de crianza de animales como chanchos, cuyes y gallinas, la socia los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, por medio de estos negocio la socia quiere salir adelante a su hijo, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los animales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar pollos y cuyes.
Las socias que estan pegadas a la foto grupal se les tomo despues la foto porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de leche, negocio de venta de maíz, negocio de venta de comida y negocio de venta de ganado.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The group are members of the communal bank "Santa Rosa de Lima de Conchacalla". The communal bank is located in the district of Anta in the province of Anta, department of Cusco. 

Bernardina is in a civil union, is 46 years old and has one child. She works in her business, which is a grocery store. She sells basic needs items like rice, sugar, milk, and oil. She has had the business for 20 years and she also has a business raising animals like pigs, guinea pigs, and chickens. She fattens them up, raises them, and then sells them in various markets. She wants to get her child ahead through these businesses. Her dream is to have a storefront where she can sell her animals. She is requesting this loan to buy chickens and guinea pigs.

The members whose photos have been added to the group photo took those photos later because they asked to miss the meeting due to work obligations. The other members make their livings selling milk, corn, food, and livestock.

The member is grateful to those who are part of realizing her dream through this medium and she has committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy chickens and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: El Sr. Jose tiene  36 años tiene un hijo de la edad de 4 años,  vive por la zona 24 de Septiembre,  El Sr. Jose   se dedica a la venta de variedad de licores en su licorería que se encuentra ubicado en la misma zona donde vive,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, El Sr. Jose va a usar este préstamo para la compra de productos como vino por mayor  para surtir su negocio y  de esta manera brindar variedad de productos a sus clientes,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, El Sr. Jose va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando productos y así mejorando sus ingresos, El Sr. Jose es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada ya que esta es su única fuente de ingresos para mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
Jose is 36 years old and has one 4-year-old child. He lives in the 24 de Septiembre neigborhood. Jose makes a living selling a variety of liquors in the same neighborhood that he lives in. 

This loan is his first with the institution. Jose will use the loan to buy products at wholesale, like wine, to supply his business and in this way offer a variety of products to his customers. His reason for requesting this loan is to continue improving his business. Jose will use the profits to continue buying products and in that way increase his income. 

Jose is a very hardworking person who is happy with the opportunity offered as this is the only source of income he has to support his family.

loans.use: to buy liquors (wine).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials (metal sheets, cement, stone, sand, iron, etc.) to continue work on his home.

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
Alaa, who appears in the picture, is a 35-year-old, married man.  He is the father of two sons and one daughter. He lives with his family in Jabalia refugee camp, in the Gaza Strip, located in Palestine State. 

Alaa is employed and gets a low salary, which is not enough to cover all the family's needs. Alaa is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of purchasing new bedroom furniture. This will improve living conditions in his house. Taking this loan will offer to Alaa comfortable furniture, so he can enjoy living in his house.

loans.use: to buy new bedroom furniture

loans.name: Ararat

texts.en:
Ararat is 51 years old. He lives in Goris town with his wife and 4 children. The family earns their living through an agricultural business. More specifically, they own a plot of land where apple and pear trees are grown. Additionally they have 10 chickens and 30 colonies of bees. 

Ararat is very hard-working man with a lot of experience in this field. He produces and sells ecologically clean honey that in high demand among buyers. He has requested a loan to purchase 12 calves. By growing them he will be able to get milk and sell it in the local markets as well. This will increase his income and will help to provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to pay for 12 calves

loans.name: Beathe

texts.en: Beathe is 32 years old. She sells and rent tents to people involved with special events. With her loan, she wants to buy more tents for renting to the people who might need them. The profits from the business will be added to her savings.

loans.use: To buy more tents for sale.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en: Teresa is a 29 year old business lady. She is married to Samuel, who is a businessman. They are blessed with one child aged nine months. Teresa has been running a welding business for the past three years with a monthly income of KES 15,000, which she uses to support her family. She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced to the organization by a KADET LTD staff member. Teresa will use the loan to buy old scrap metals for use in her business. She will use the anticipated profit from the business to expand it. Her hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and build rental houses.

loans.use: to buy old scrap metal

loans.name: Ernest

texts.en: Ernest is 47 years old. He sells maize and cassava. He wants this loan to buy more cassava and maize for sale. The profits from the business will be used to buy a milling machine.

loans.use: To buy more cassava and maize for sale.

loans.name: Kartlosi

texts.en:
Kartlosi is 43 years old. He lives in the village of Kartubani, with his son, who is a university student. Kartlosi works at the City Council and gets a monthly salary. The income from this job is hardly enough to cover food and everyday expenses for the family. He has requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but he hasn't had any success. He wants to start a bakery and a confectionery, but his loan request has always been rejected in the past because of his low income and his lack of experience, which is usually required by local credit providers. 

Kartlosi has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With his credit, Kartlosi will purchase flour and wood for baking bread and different kinds of cookies. This will increase his sales volume. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase flour and wood for starting a bakery

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a poultry farmer who lives in Mariakani, Kenya. She has been in the business for the last five years. She is the mother of five children.
 
Regina saw potential in agri-business and would like to expand the poultry farming. She was introduced to Milango by her friends, and she is applying for a loan of 83,450 Kenyan shillings to buy chicks, poultry medicines, chicken feed, and other items for taking care of the birds. The challenge in the current business is that demand is seasonal, but Regina believes she will make sales over the festive season. Her future ambition is to increase the stock of animals in her poultry farm.

loans.use: To buy chicks, poultry medicines, chicken feed, and other items for taking care of the birds.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is 45 years old, a business lady, and married to Stephen, a business man. They are blessed with one child, aged 14 years. Lilian has been a tailor for the past four years, with a monthly income of KES 10,000. She uses her income to support her family. 

She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced by a credit officer. Lilian will use the loan to purchase more textiles and sewing thread. 

With the profit from the business, she will educate her child. Her hopes and dreams are to open a boutique shop, and to improve the family's living standard.

loans.use: to purchase more textiles and sewing thread to use in her tailoring business.

loans.name: Laurence

texts.en: Laurence is 25 years old. She owns a bar, where she sells both alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks. With the loan, she wants to buy more beer and soda for sale. She will use the profits from the business to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy more beer and soda for resale.

loans.name: Mariano De Jesus

texts.es:
Mariano, tiene 49 años de edad, no tiene hijos pero está viviendo con su esposa, se dedica a cultivar maíz, del que logra obtener la cosecha para el alimento de la familia y para vender, generando ingresos para mantener, esta actividad la aprendió de su padre, tiene  20 años de estar realizándola para el hogar, de lunes a viernes. 
Solicita un préstamo para el pago de una maquina desgranadora de maíz, con la que estará preparando la cosecha que obtuvo, para el consumo y para la venta, este préstamo le dará lo necesario para poder realizar el pago de máquina y sacar la producción.
El objetivo de Mariano es mejorar sus condiciones económicas a través del trabajo, para tener una mejor condición de vida.
texts.en:
Mariano is 49, has no children and lives with his wife. He grows corn and obtains some of the harvest to feed his family and to sell, generating income to support them. This activity was learned by Mariano from his father, he has been farming for 20 years from Monday to Friday.

He requests a loan to pay for a grain processing machine, with which he will process his harvest for consumption and sale; this loan will provide for what's necessary to pay for the machine and complete production.

Mariano's goal is to improve his economic conditions through work and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for a grain processing machine.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
María, vive con su madre, sus hermanos, está soltera, su padre le ayuda desde el extranjero, ha logrado instalar un negocio al que se dedica diariamente, ella realiza ventas de ropa de forma ambulante, desde pequeña conoce el negocio y decidió abrir una boutique para que sus clientes la visitaran en su negocio.  
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de mercadería para el negocio, surtiendo de blusas, pantalones, camisas, entre otra mercadería que sea necesaria para que pueda satisfacer la necesidad de sus clientes.
El objetivo de María es ampliar la boutique, hacer más grande el local y surtirlo de más mercadería para la demanda de los clientes.
texts.en:
María lives with her mom and siblings, she is single, her father helps her from a foreign country; she was able to start a business where she works at daily, she sells clothing; she's known the business since she was little and decided to open a clothing store for her clients to visit her business.
She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise for the business, to stock up in tops, pants, shirts and other merchandise needed to fill her customers' needs.

Maria's goal is to expand the boutique, have a larger store and stock it with more merchandise for her clients.

loans.use: to buy tops, pants and shirts.

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Julia tiene55 años de edad, ella es socia del grupo "Nuevo Amanecer", grupo formado por 5 socios, los cuales se caracterizan por su empeño en salir adelante con sus negocios, y en la responsabilidad al momentos de asumir los pagos de las cuotas del préstamo.
La Sra. Julia se dedica desde hace mas de cinco años a la venta de salchipapas, inició su negocio con una pequeña cocinita donde preparaba sus frituras, poco a poco y con la dedicación y esfuerzo de su trabajo pudo comprar una cocina mas grande y actualmente atiende en un espacio ambientado en su domicilio.
El préstamo recibido lo invirtió en la compra de sillas y algunas mesas para poder atender mas comodamente a sus clientes, asimismo compró todo lo que es articulos descartables que son necesarios para servir sus salchipapas, sanguches y pollos broaster.
texts.en:
Julia is 55 years old and a member of the "Nuevo Amanecer" group, which is made up of five members. They are noted for their determination to succeed with their businesses and for being responsible when taking on the payment of loan installments.

Julia has been selling salchipapas (fast food made from hotdogs and potatoes) for more than five years. She started her business with a small stove where she prepared her fried dishes. Little by little, and by working with dedication and effort, she was able to buy a larger stove, and currently runs her business in a space set up in her home. 

When she receives the loan, she will use it to buy chairs and some tables so that she can serve her customers in more comfort. In addition she has bought all kinds of disposable items that are necessary to serve her salchipapas, sandwiches and fried chicken.

loans.use: To buy disposable dishes as well as chairs for serving her customers at her "salchipapas" stand.

loans.name: Jose Wilfredo

texts.es:
José, se dedica a la venta de ropa variada, es una persona de hogar, vive con sus padres, por el momento está separado de su esposa, tambien vive con una hermana, él trabajaba de albañil anteriormente y agricultor, hoy en día está realizando la venta de ropa variada, sus ventas fuertes son con las personas de la zona rural.
Actualmente él quiere realizar la inversión al negocio, para mejorar la variedad, solicita un préstamo por medio del cual se pueda comprar pantalones, camisas, blusas, faldas, mejorando así el negocio con mas productos, prendas de vestir en diferentes estilos, esto ayudara a crecer en sus ventas; Su riesgo en el negocio es la competencia de comerciantes que le ocasionaría una baja en las ventas.
El objetivo de José es instalar un negocio en un local, surtirlo de variedad de ropa, estará ayudando a su familia y tambien lograra en sus planes construir su casa y seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
José sells a variety of clothing. He's a home-loving person and lives with his parents. At the moment is separated from his wife. He also lives with a sister. He was working previously as a bricklayer and farmer, and nowadays he is selling a variety of clothing. His most important sales are to people in the rural area. 

Now he wants to invest in his business to improve variety. He is requesting a loan to enable him to buy pants, shirts, blouses and skirts; in this way improving the business with more products, and articles of clothing in different styles. This will help him to increase his sales. 

His risk in the business is competition from merchants that would result in a drop in sales. José's goal is to set up a business in a shop, and supply it with a variety of clothing. He will be helping his family, and will also succeed in his plans to build his home and continue going to school.

loans.use: To buy pants, shirts, blouses and skirts.

loans.name: El Grupo Dinamico Group

texts.es:
El grupo Dinamico está formado por seis integrantes. Éste grupo se caracteriza por ser como su nombre lo indica muy dinámicos, todos se desempeñan a tiempo completo en sus negocios para poder cumplir sus metas.
El sr. Jorge Augusto, se dedica a prestar servicio de  taxi, es su único ingreso por lo que debe dedicarle la mayor parte del día, para poder llevar a su hogar el dinero para los gastos de la casa y de sus 4 hijos. Realiza ésta actividad desde hace 20 añoñs y gracias a su trabajo ha logrado darle estudios superiores a sus hijos.
El préstamo recibido lo invirtió en el pago de mantenimiento de su vehículo, para que quede en óptimas condiciones para realizar su trabajo.
texts.en:
The ‘Dinamic’ group is made up of six members, this group is characterized by being like their name suggests, dynamic. All of the members work full time in their respective businesses to be able to meet their goals.
