Mr. Jorge Augusto works for a taxi service, it is his only source of income which is why he dedicates most of his day to his work, to be able to take home enough money to meet the household expenses and that of his 4 children. Mr. Jorge Augusto has worked as a taxi driver for over 20 years and thanks to his job he has been able to provide enough to give his children a higher education.

The loan will be used make maintenance repairs to his vehicle so that it will be in optimal condition to carry out his job.

loans.use: make maintenance repairs to his vehicle.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 60 years old and married.  She is from San Jose, Talibon, Bohol, Philippines.  She helps her husband in tilling their field. They plant rice and other crops on their farm.

Rosalina is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy seedlings, fertilizer, and pesticides. With these items, they will be able to grow and produce  healthy crops.  In the future, Rosalina hopes to expand their farming ventures so that it will continue to provide them with the income that they need.  Any additional income will be saved for future needs.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings, fertilizer, and pesticides.

loans.name: Jacques

texts.fr: Jacques est âgé de 38 ans et est marié à une marchande nommée Agnès. Le couple a cinq enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Jacques n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Jacques vit ensemble avec ses enfants et sa femme. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Il y a de cela dix ans que Jacques exerce comme activité, l’agriculture. Jacques exerce passionnément cette activité, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Jacques s’approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue d’augmenter son fonds de roulement, Jacques sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé, pour cultiver du gombo et du piment. Ce crédit lui servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de sa clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Jacques is 38 years old, and married to Agnès, a retail seller, with whom he has five children.  Some of the children go to school and all are their dependents. Jacques did not attend school.  He lives with his wife and children.  The couple jointly takes care of the various household expenses.

Jacques has been working as a farmer for the past ten years.  He has a passion for his job, and this activity allows him to meet his own needs as well as those of his children.  He stocks up in Benin.  Eager to meet the needs of his customers and to increase his turnover, he is requesting a third loan from  ALIDé in order to grow gumbo (okra) and chili peppers.  This loan will help Jacques to better meet his customers' expectations and to increase his profits.  His previous loans were duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs to grow gumbo (okra) and chili peppers.

loans.name: Los Angelitos 2 Group

texts.es:
La señora Amparo es una persona honesta y responsable, vive con  sus 2 hijos en un caserío al sur de Honduras.
Doña Amparo tiene un negocio que es la compra y venta de  cerdos.  El préstamo lo necesita para la compra de cerdos y con el espera  que sus ventas le aumenten gracias a  la obtención de más mercadería.
Doña Amparo en  esta  temporada navideña tiene una gran cantidad de en cargos de cerdos, y espera que con los ingresos que obtenga ayuden  a mejorar mejor su estilo de de vida y el de su familia.
Doña Amparo en unos años sueña con que  su negocio este posicionado como el  más grande y  reconocido de su caserío y así  poder seguir apoyando a sus hijos y su familia.
Doña Felipa su negocio es venta de gallinas, y tiene 4 años de dedicarse  a esta actividad. 
Doña Martha su negocio es  venta  de gallinas,  desde hace 3 años
Orvelinda su negocio es la venta  de cerdos, desde hace mas de 6  años. 


Choluteca, Honduras – Noviembre  2012
texts.en:
Mrs. Amparo is an honest and responsible person; she lives with her 2 children in a neighborhood in southern Honduras.

Doña Amparo has a business buying and selling pigs. The loan will be used to buy pigs and hopes that her sales will increase by having more merchandize to offer.

Doña Amparo in this Christmas season has a great number of orders for pigs and hopes that the money will help her improve her quality of life and that of her family.

Doña Amparo in a few years hopes that her business will be established and be the biggest and most well-known in her neighborhood to keep supporting her children and family.

Doña Felipa’s business is selling chickens; she has worked in this field for 4 years.

Doña Martha’s business is selling chickens; she has done this for 3 years.

Orvelinda’s business is selling pigs; she has done this for over 6 years. Choluteca, Honduras – November 2012

loans.use: buy pigs for her business.

loans.name: Bimota Group

texts.en:
This is Bimota Group of five tribal women created in 2009. They all live in a small village on the outskirts of Bishnupur in Manipur State, which is in the northeastern part of India. They came together as a group to avail a loan in order to create income activities for themselves.

Bimota is the group leader pictured with a raised hand. She is 38 years old and is the mother of three daughters and one son. She lives with eight members as a family. Her husband's main lines of income are selling firewood and bamboo. However, this source of income is exhausted by itself and takes time to replenish. Therefore, in order to supplement the family income, she usually weaves traditional garments but could not produce much due to limited capital at her disposal. She initiated and formed the group to fulfill the capital needs for her weaving income activities.

With her first loan in 2009, she bought all the requirements for weaving (loom, thread, needs). She started weaving four days a week and was able to produce six traditional wrap rounds of different quality and four shawls in a month and a week’s time. Her husband helped her out with the loan repayments for the initial four months. With the profits, she was able to repay the loan and buy yarn to continue weaving. 

With her second loan, she was able to produce more by employing one more weaver and channeling her sales by supplying a retailer as well as selling some herself. With her income, she managed to support her children's education better. She was able to pay the children's school fees on time. She is happy that her oldest son can continue his graduation class. She is very happy with all the support that she gets from her husband as well as her children. Her children did well by bringing home their friends to buy the traditional garments that their mother weaves. In this way, people know where to buy when they need one.

Now she needs another loan to continue with her weaving business. She will use the loan to stock yarn of different colors and textures to weave the traditional wrap round, shawls and vest coats that she has been weaving. She also means to use part of the loan for the children's enrollment fees for the next session.

The rest of the group members also need another loan to upgrade and do better at their respective activities. The group members' activities can be classified as spring onion farming, fishery, piggery and yam cultivation.

loans.use: to buy yarns of varied colors and texture to weave traditional garments. Also to enroll the children in their school for the next session.

loans.name: El Carbonal Group

texts.es: Adela es miembro del Grupo Solidario Carbonal, tiene 42 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos, dos de ellos estudian en la universidad y los otros dos están en el colegio, su esposo trabaja como administrador de la empresa de Lácteos Sula. Ella inicio su negocio desde hace seis años, fue por iniciativa propia que decidió poner su negocio de venta de comida, actualmente vende golosinas y tiene una cafetería en la Escuela Normal Mixta de Olancho, su horario de atención comienza desde las 6:30 am y culmina a las 2:00 pm, trabaja en conjunto con una empleada. Su ventaja es que tiene competencia y su dificultad es que tiene que pagar alquiler. El préstamo que Adela solicita lo necesita para invertirlo en la compra productos como ser: refrescos, carnes, plátanos, harina, aceite vegetal para la elaboración de sus golosinas. Con la ayuda de este préstamo ella podrá tener surtido su cafetería y ofrecerá mayores productos a sus clientes, satisfaciendo los gustos y preferencias de los mismos. Su sueño es tener un restaurante con su propio local. Es el séptimo préstamo que solicita Adela en FAMA y  siempre ha pagado puntualmente sus cuotas.
texts.en: Adela is a member of the Carbonal Solidary Group, she is 42 years old, married and has 4 children two of which are in university and the others in high school. Her husband works as a manager in the Lácteos Sula Corporation. Adela began her business over six years ago, by her own initiative and started a business selling food. At present, she sells treats and has a cafeteria in the Normal Mixta de Olancho School; her work hours begin at 6:30 a.m. and end at 2:00 p.m. She works with an employee. Adela’s advantage is her competition and a problem is paying rent for the cafeteria. The loan will be used to buy merchandize like beverages, meats, plantains, flour and vegetable oil to make her treats. With the help from this loan she will be able to stock her cafeteria and will be able to offer more products to her customers by satisfying their tastes and preferences. Adela’s dream is to have her own restaurant and place. This is Adela’s seventh loan with FAMA and has always paid her quotas on time.

loans.use: buy merchandize like beverages, meats, plantains, flour, vegetable oil and other items.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret  is a 31 year old married woman. She has 2 children aged 1 month and 8 years. She describes herself as a social and responsible woman. She operates an internet café where she provides internet services. Her business is located in an urban area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as high competition in the area. 

Margaret  will use her KES 60,000 loan to buy clothes to sell during the December holiday, as she anticipates the purchasing power will be high. Her goal is to expand her business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children with money generated from the business. This is her sixth loan with SMEP DTM after taking a previous loan of KES 50,000, which she managed to pay successfully.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Norma is a 58 year old married woman and a mother of a grown up son from Talibon, Bohol. She is engaged in the fishing business since her husband works as a fisherman. Norma does her best to support her husband in meeting the needs of the family. She is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets and lead weights. Through this, her husband will be able to enhance his daily catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Norma dreams of making their business a success.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and lead weights

loans.name: Milkah

texts.en: Milkah is a 27-year-old married woman. She describes herself to be God fearing and business-oriented woman. She operates a retail store where she sells household items such as sugar, salt, maize flour, cooking fat, tea leaves, juice, bread, sodas, water etc. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a highly populated area and her primary customers are residents from the environs. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate stock of household items to sell to customers. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy household items to sell. Her business goal is to run a wholesale shop within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful in her business. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Milkah also runs a grocery store where she sells vegetables and fruits to increase her business income.

loans.use: to buy household items

loans.name: Marthe

texts.en: Marthe is aged 32. She sells stoves and has been in the business for the past 10 years. With the loan, she wants to buy more stoves for sale. The profits from the business will be used to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more stoves for sale.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a resident of Kongowea area of Coast province, Kenya. She is a widowed mother of six school going children. Juliet owns a mobile food supply business, mainly dealing in fried potatoes and buns and has been running this for two years. 
She learnt about Milango from an employee and joined the institution with an aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main challenge is high cost of transport to the centre where she buys stock. 
Juliet is applying for a loan of 6,200 Kenya shillings to purchase food stuff like potatoes, wheat flour, cooking oil etc. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve the living standard of the family especially for the education of her children. She aspires to own a café in the future.

loans.use: To purchase food stuff like potatoes, wheat flour, cooking oil etc.

loans.name: Sourou Jean

texts.fr: Sourou Jean est un agriculteur et est marié à une marchande du nom de Julie. Sourou Jean est âgé de 46 ans. Le couple a six enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Sourou Jean et sa femme vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Sourou Jean n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Il y a environ vingt six ans que Sourou Jean exerce l'activité d'agriculture. Sourou Jean fait parallèlement de la pêche dans un village du Bénin. Sourou Jean exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Sourou Jean s’approvisionne dans sa région. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Sourou Jean sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé, dans le but de cultiver du maïs et du piment pour satisfaire ses clients et se faire plus de profits. Les prêts antérieurs reçus ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Sourou Jean is a 46-year-old farmer.  He is married to Julie, a merchant, with whom he has six children. Some of the couple's children go to school and all are their dependents. Sourou Jean and his wife live with their children and jointly take care of the various household expenses.

Sourou Jean did not attend school.  For the past 26 years or so, he has been working in agriculture.  Additionally, he is involved in fishing, an activity he carries out in a village in Benin.  He is passionate about his work, and his activity allows him to meet his needs as well as those of his children. He stocks up locally. 

Eager to meet the needs of his customers, Sourou Jean is requesting a third loan from ALIDé in order to grow maize and chili peppers. This loan will allow him to better satisfy his customers' needs and to increase his profits. His previous loans were duly repaid.

loans.use: to grow maize and chili peppers.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: La Sra. Maribel tiene 22 años,  se dedica  a la venta de pescado su esposo es pescador y ella comercializa el pescado que su esposo pesca en el lago Titicaca,  ellos viven en una isla Del lago Titicaca, centro turístico del departamento de La Paz donde ofrecen al público  artesanías  de totoras y en lana, la mayoría de los habitantes de esta isla se dedican a la pesca y el turismo,   este préstamo es su primera  secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Maribel va a usar este préstamo para la compra de una bote pesquero de mayor capacidad y redes, su producto de su pesca lo venden en la ciudad de La Paz y con este nuevo bote  quiere incrementar su producción y así satisfacer la demandada de sus clientes, La Sra. Maribel es una persona  con ganas de superación se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que esta es la única fuente de ingresos que tienen para mantenerse.
texts.en: Maribel is 22 years and makes a living selling fish. Her husband is a fisherman, and she sells the fish that he catches on Lake Titicaca. They live on an island in the lake, which is a tourist center in the department of La Paz, offering local crafts made from reeds and wool. The majority of the inhabitants make a living in fishing and tourism. This is her first loan with this institution, and Maribel plans to use it to purchase a bigger fishing boat and nets. She sells her fish in the city of La Paz, and with this new boat she wants to increase her production and satisfy her customers' demands. Maribel is a person with a desire to move up in life, and she feels happy and grateful for the institution for providing support because her business is her only source of income and she needs to maintain it.

loans.use: to purchase a boat and nets.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: El Sr. Francisco tiene 61 años,  el se dedica a la venta de comida en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la zona de Julio Tellez,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, El Sr. Francisco va a usar este préstamo para el mantenimiento de su vehículo,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es que su vehículo está presentando algunas fallas  y esto no le permite trasladar sus comida al puesto de venta y va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando insumos y así mejorando sus ingresos, El Sr. Francisco es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en: Francisco is 61 years old and sells food from a food stall in the Julio Tellez zone.  This will be his first loan through the institution.  He will use the money to maintain his vehicle.  He is asking for this loan because his vehicle is having some problems and this prevents him from taking his food to his food stall.  He will use the benefits to continue buying supplies and in this way improve his income.  Francisco is a very hardworking person and is happy about this opportunity.

loans.use: to maintain his vehicle.

loans.name: Mario Dieter

texts.es: El  señor Mario es cliente antiguo, el cliente tiene la profesión de Odontólogo, soltero  que vive en casa familiar de  sus papas,  el señor Mario se encarga  de  los gastos familiares cuenta que le fue bien con el crédito ya que compro su esterilizador , ahora en esta ocasión  solicita el crédito para la compra de mobiliario y materiales para su consultorio.
texts.en: Mario is a longtime client.  He is a dentist, single, and lives with his parents.  Mario pays the household expenses and he says that things went well for him with the previous loan.  He was able to buy his autoclave.  Now he will use the money from this loan to buy furniture and supplies for his office.

loans.use: to buy furniture and supplies.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary's business has continued to witness growth. She was able to complete the repayment of her previous loan on time and is applying for a new loan of 99,600 Kenyan shillings to build a business structure of her own. She no longer wants  to continue renting her business premises. She believes the savings from the rental payments and the income from the same business which she has run for some time will help in her loan repayment. Her ambition is to steer the business toward becoming a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To build a business structure of her own.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en: Marie is 56 years old. She is married with seven children; they all attend schools. She sells buckets and hoes. She has been in the business for three years. With the loan, she wants to add more buckets and hoes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy more buckets and hoes for sale.

loans.name: Luchadoras De Yanacoto Group

texts.es: Saludos desde Perú!!! Con ustedes el grupo “Luchadoras De Yanacoto”  la gran mayoría de ellos vecinos de la zona la cual pasan a su 2 ciclo conformado por 08 socios responsables. Soledad es la que preside al grupo, cargo que ha llevado con responsabilidad.  Anteriormente Soledad brindaba servicios doméstico, con los trabajos que realizo y buen uso que le dio a sus ingresos pudo comprarse una mototaxi donde actualmente brinda servicio de transporte. Este trabajo le ha permitido apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios. Su mayor deseo es de terminar de construir su vivienda, pues piensa poner una bodega, la cual le generaría mayores ganancias. En esta oportunidad solicito el crédito para la matricula de la academia de su mayor hija. Soledad tiene 31 años casada con 03 hijos dependientes.  El grupo “Luchadoras De Yanacoto” agradecen a los prestamistas Kiva por apoyar en su progreso. Soledad está ubicada en la parte posterior es la segunda del lado izquierdo viste polo plomo.
texts.en: Greetings from Perú!!! With you is the “Luchadoras de Yanacoto” group (The Fighters of Yanacoto) the majority of the members are neighbors to the area. This is their second loan cycle and the group is made up of 8 responsible members. Soledad is the head of the group; it is an obligation that she takes with great responsibility. In the past, Soledad was a housekeeper and with that job she put to good use her earnings and bought a motorcycle taxi and now provides a transportation service. This job has allowed her to help support her husband with the household expenses and their children's education. Her biggest wish is to finish building her home and hopes to open a small grocery store which will generate more income. At present, she needs a loan to pay the tuition of her eldest daughter. Soledad is 31 years old, married and has 3 dependent children. The “Luchadoras de Yanacoto” are grateful to the Kiva lenders for your support in their progress. In the picture, Soledad is in the back, she is second from the left wearing a grey t-shirt.

loans.use: pay the tuition of her eldest daughter.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: La Sra. Martha tiene 36 años y es casada con 2 hijos que son de las edades de 3 y 10 años, ella se dedica a la venta de enaguas para mujeres de polleras, tu tienda se encuentran en la zona de Huayna Potosi,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro la institución, La Sra. Martha va a usar este préstamo para la compra enaguas por mayor para  su negocio ya que por esta fechas que se acerca el aniversario del barrio tiene mucha venta, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es incremento de capital de trabajo, La Sra. Martha enfrenta retos en su negocio que son surtir su mercadería y va a utilizar los beneficios e seguir comprando por mayor.
texts.en:
Martha, 36, is married and has two children, ages 3 and 10.  She makes a living selling petticoats for women's skirts.  Her store is in the Huayna Potosí area.

This loan is her first sequence in the institution.  Martha's going to use this loan to buy petticoats wholesale for her business.  She has a lot of sales around this time because of the neighborhood's anniversary.  Her reason for requesting the loan is to increase her working capital.

In her business, Martha faces the challenge of stocking her merchandise.  She's going to use the profits to continue buying wholesale.

loans.use: to buy petticoats wholesale

loans.name: Susana

texts.es: La Sra. Susana sigue con la misma actividad de la venta de comida, cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito que lo utilizo en la construcción de un tinglado para su puesto de venta, ahora solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos para la elaboración de sus comidas como abarrotes, aceite y papa por mayor.
texts.en: Susana is continuing with her business selling food.  She says she had a really good experience with her last loan, which she used to build a roof for her sales stall.  She is now requesting a loan to buy supplies at wholesale, such as groceries, cooking oil, and potatoes, that she will use to make her dishes.

loans.use: to buy supplies

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en: Jacqueline is 25 years old. She is married with two children aged between three and five. One of the children goes to school. She owns a spare auto parts store. She has been in that business for the past 3 years. With this loan, she wants to buy more spare parts for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy more spare auto parts for resale.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself as an honest and social woman. She operates a retail stall where she sells soft drinks, biscuits, chocolates, and other items. Her business is located in a densely populated area and her primary customers are residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient funds for improving her business. She will use this 20,000 KES loan to buy soft drinks, sweets and biscuits to sell. Her business goal is to be a supplier of soda within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will expand her business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, sweets and biscuits to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase stock of bangles.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a 53-year-old farmer from Talibon, Bohol. She works together with her husband to till their lots. They grow rice and other crops on their farm.
Victoria needs a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer, and pesticides for the plants. With this, they can improve their harvest and yield from the field.
In the future, Victoria wants to expand their farming business and save money for future use.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer, and pesticides for the plants

loans.name: Rozariya

texts.en: Rozariya is 35 years old. She owns a boutique with different items. With this loan, she wants to add more cooking oil, soaps and matchboxes to her stock for sale. The profits from the business will used for savings.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil, soaps and matchboxes to sell.

loans.name: Elvina

texts.en:
Elvina lives in the Changamwe area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is a married business lady who owns a green grocer, a business she has been operating for less than a year. She started the business from the income she received while selling buns. She sells tomatoes, sugar, onions, and more in this business.
She learned about Milango through friends who invited her to the group. She joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenge is the high costs of transport while sourcing the goods. 
Elvina is applying for a loan of 41,900 Kenya shillings to buy vegetables and fruits wholesale and some bags of sugar. Her extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to construct a rental house and improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits wholesale and some bags of sugar.

loans.name: Estar

texts.en:
Estar lives in the Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is a married mother of four children. She owns a green grocery stall that she has been operating for four years. In this business, Estar sells greens, fruits, vegetables, etc. The family also earns some income from farming.
Estar learned about Milango through a Milango employee, and joined with an aim of accessing credit to improve the business operations. The challenges she is facing are inflation and the high costs of transportation of products from the source to her business site.
Estar is applying for a loan of 52,250 Kenya shillings to buy greens, other vegetables, and fruits. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to expand the business and pay for her children’s school fees. Her plans for the future are to start other businesses and also open stalls in different areas.

loans.use: to buy greens and other vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Jemimah

texts.en:
Jemimah is a resident of the Kongowea area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is a married mother of two children. Jemimah owns a food stall business, mainly dealing in popcorn, and has been running this business for two years. 
She learnt about Milango from an employee and joined the institution with an aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main challenge is occasionally limited customers. She has seen some growth in the business and would like to set up another stall.
Jemimah is applying for a loan of 41,900 Kenya shillings to purchase a popcorn making machine. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve the living standards of the family, especially the education of her children. She aspires to own a café in future.

loans.use: to purchase a popcornmaking machine.

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es: El Sr. Ramón tiene 36 años, es casado con 3 hijos que son de las edades de 11, 3 y 5 años, el Sr. Ramón se dedica al servicio de construcción, el trabaja en las distintas construcciones este préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Ramón  va a usar este préstamo para  la compra de una mescladora de cemento ya que le hace mucha falta para realizar las obras, el  Sr. Ramón enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la dependencia de cada trabajo ya que tiene que cumplir con el contrato por cada casa a la que va  a trabajar en la construcción  y va seguir utilizando los beneficios en comprar herramientas y materiales que necesita para la realización de un buen trabajo que implica muchos más contratos y por ende mas ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Ramón is 36 years old, married, and has three children, ages 11, 3, and 5.  Ramón works in construction.  This will be his second loan through the institution and will use the money to buy a cement mixer that needs to be able to do his work.  Ramón has challenges in his business, such as being dependent on contracts.  He will use the benefits to buy tools and supplies that he needs to do good work and get more contracts and therefore more income.

loans.use: to buy a cement mixer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cosmetics on sale

loans.name: Raheri

texts.en: Raheri is 42 years old and she is married with five children, ages 5 to 19. Her husband is a taxi driver. She sells different items on the retail scale and has been doing this for the last three years. This business has enabled her to pay school fees for her children, who are all currently enrolled. She needs a loan to buy more beer in order to make more profits. She will use the profits to expand and to renovate her business.

loans.use: to buy more beer for sale.

loans.name: Janviere

texts.en: Janviere is single. She sells different retail items in a boutique and has been doing this for the last four years. This business has enabled her to provide the basic needs for herself and entire family. She needs a loan to buy more sugar, rice and cooking oil for sale in order to make more profit. She will use the profit to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, rice and cooking oil for sale.

loans.name: Cissy

texts.en:
Cissy lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children and three of them are attending school. She is not looking after her siblings.

She has been selling used clothes in the market for the last one and a half years, working six days a week. She also keeps poultry as an additional source of income.

She has requested for a loan of UGX 2,200,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her buy more bales of used clothes for sale. Her challenges include seasonality and ever-increasing prices of used clothes. Her dream is to settle in one place and move her business there. She joined MCDT because of timely loans and low loan interest. She stays in her husband`s house with access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and transport.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Philimena

texts.en: Philimena is 43 years old. She lives in Margibi County, which is the number one rubber plantation industry location in Liberia. She is married and has five children between 7 to 29 years old. For the past 14 years, she has been selling slippers, body cream, hair greese, and other items in the local market. She likes her business because it provides for her children's needs. She is requesting a loan to purchase slippers, body cream, hair greese, and other items for her business. Her plan is to send her children to school and to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase slippers, body cream, hair greese, and other items for her business.

loans.name: Kisaasi Mirembe Group

texts.en:
Sarah is 45 years old, a member of Mirembe group and a widow whose husband passed away in 2001. She was left her with six children, of which 5 go to school.

Sarah is a vendor dealing in the sale of secondhand clothes in various markets, especially in Kamwokya. This is how she is able to earn a living for her family. She started this business in 2003 after her husband passed away. Sarah’s clients are people who visit the markets and a few of her regular customers place orders for different clothes. Her dream is to have a permanent business place where her customers can find her on a regular basis and also to see her children having a bright future.

Her major obligations are paying school fees, feeding children and paying house rent for the family, among others.

Her major challenges are lack of enough capital to raise enough returns to meet her major obligations and the weather conditions, especially during rainy seasons since she works in an open place, which slows down the growth of her business.

Sarah is very hardworking, social, and honest. She will use part of the loan to rent a small stall in order to get a permanent working place and the balance will be used to add stock in her business in order to earn enough income to support her family and provide for all basic needs.

loans.use: to rent a stall to do her trade.

loans.name: Loyola Group

texts.en:
Rose, who is in her late 30s, is married and living with her husband with two children of whom one is in school. She has been running a business selling fish and charcoal for one year now.  She works from 6am to 9pm daily and she is able to make a fair monthly profit.

She requesting her fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to purchase more fish and sacks of charcoal, paid household expenses, and she has paid back all her loans successfully. She is requesting a loan which she wants to use to  increase her charcoal stock to resell. Her dream is to one day be able to build a house.

She will share this loan with her loan group " LOYOLA" with 17 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase her charcoal stock for resale.

loans.name: Maria

texts.pt:
Solteira e mãe de 5 filhos, dos quais 2 vão a Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta mais 2 netas.
É negociante e dona do próprio negócio de venda de roupas. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (calças, camisas, lençóis, mantas, e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. 
No futuro deseja trabalhar mais e ampliar o seu negócio, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é o pagamento  do empréstimo para que possa ter oportunidade de levantar outros para ampliar o seu negócio.
texts.en:
Maria is single and the mother of 5 children, 2 of whom go to School, lives in her own house with her family and supports 2 granddaughters.

She's a trader and owns her own business selling clothes. With this loan she plans to buy products (trousers, shirts, sheets, blankets and others) to increase the quantity of her stock.

In future she wishes to work more and expand her business and to this end she commits to duly paying off the loan so that she can solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

Her challenge is to pay off her debt so that she has the opportunity so request more loans to expand her business.

loans.use: buy products (trousers, shirts, sheets, blankets and others) to increase the quantity of her stock

loans.name: Sonia

texts.pt:
Solteira e mãe de 4 filhos, dos quais apenas 1 vai a Escola, vive na casa própria com suas filhas e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É operária agrícola numa empresa de produção de bananas. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, areia, chapas, e outros) para a obra da sua casa. 
No futuro deseja terminar a sua obra e melhor confortar as suas filhas, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é o pagamento devido do empréstimo para poder levantar outros
texts.en:
Sonia is a single mother of 4 children, only 1 of whom go to School, lives in her own house with her daughters and doesn't support anyone else.

She works in the agriculture industry for a company producing bananas. With this loan she plans to buy construction material (cement, sand, metal sheets and others) for the building work on her house.

In future she wishes to finish the works and provide more comfort for her daughters. To this end she commits to duly paying off the loan so that she can solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

Her challenge is to pay off her debt so that she can request more loans.

loans.use: buy construction material (cement, sand, metal sheets and others) for the building work on her house.

loans.name: Castigo

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 1 filho ainda menor, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É negociante e dono do próprio negócio de venda de pastas escolares. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar pastas escolares para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. 
No futuro deseja ampliar o seu negócio construindo uma ferragem, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é estar saudável para poder realizar sua acções.
texts.en:
Castigo is married and the father of 1 son who is a minor, lives in his own house with his family and doesn't support anyone else.

He is a trader and owns his own business selling school bags. With this loan he plans to buy school bags to increase the quantity of his stock.

In future he wishes to expand his business by building a  hardware business and to this end he commits to duly paying off the loan so that he can solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

His challenge is to remain healthy to be able to carry out his plans.

loans.use: buy school bags to increase the quantity of his stock

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en: Jacqueline is 25 years old and is married with one child.  Her husband works as a driver.  She sells beer at retail and has been doing this for the last year. This has enabled her to expand her business.  She needs a loan to buy more beer in order to make more profits.  She will use the profits to reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: to buy more beer to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a 10 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester

loans.name: Hilario

texts.en:
As Hilario's dairy farm is the only source of income for his family, he is constantly trying to reduce his operating costs.  With a 20 cubic meter biodigester, he will be able to take advantage of a resource he is currently not utilizing - the several thousand kilograms of cow waste produced yearly on his farm.  With his biodigester, he will turn this "waste" into valuable resources. 

The biogas generated by the system will result in decreased fuel costs and the fertilizer production will save him from spending on the agrochemical products he is currently using.  Moreover, these benefits will not be limited to just his farm; by reducing his dependence on fossil fuels and their products, Hilario's biodigester will reduce his farm's impact on the environment.  This system represents 50% of the total price of his system.

loans.use: To purchase a 20 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen 38, completed her high school education.  She is hard working and determinee.  Her husband is a driver. 

Ellen has  been involved in the sales of used clothing for the past ten years.  She sells mens shirts, mens trousers, womens dresses, and  under clothes. She lives in the sinkor community with her husband and four children, who are between the ages of 10 and 21, and are all in school.  With the initial capital from her husband she started this business.  She sells eleven hours a day and her husband's  vehicle is used to transport her goods. 

Ellen is very proud of her business.  This is her fourth loan  cycle with BRAC Liberia and she also appreciate the lenders for empowering her.  She is requesting this loan to purchase more mens trousers, mens shirts, ladies dresses for the business.  Her plan is to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to  purchase more men's trousers, men's shirts, ladies dresses for the business.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a 43 year old mother of four.  After finishing high school she took different training courses, such as book keeping, to improve her employment possibilities.  After working many years at jobs that simply did not allow her to earn a decent wage, she opened her small photocopying and gifts shop. She is now expanding her business to include digital photos printed on shirts, coffee mugs, other gift items and copying services.

Susan needed this loan to purchase a photo printer for printing on shirts, mugs, pillows and other items; digital copier; stock of gift supplies and for advertising.

Susan's store has good possibilities with this expansion.  She looks forward to earning a decent wage, saving money and sending her four children to study at university.

loans.use: To purchase a photo printer for printing on shirts, mugs, pillows and other items; digital copier; stock of gift supplies and for advertising.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith, age 42 is single and a mother of three children.  She stopped her education in the twelfth grade.  Her children are between the ages of 15 and 24.   They all live in the sinkor community.   

For the past five  years Faith has been working hard to manage her business since she is the only source of income for her children.  She sells candy, bath soap, sugar, milk, biscuit, flour,sardines, butter and many other items.  She sells twelve hours a day.   With a loan from BRAC Liberia, she started in this business.  She is proud of her business because she makes profits.   With the profits, she buys more goods for her business.  She transports her goods by commercial  vehicle to her business area and is thankful to the lenders for their support. 

She is requesting her fourth loan from BRAC  Liberia to purchase more biscuits, candy, milk, sugar, sardines, lunch meats and butter for the business.  She hopes to build a decent house in the  future.

loans.use: to  purchase more biscuit, candy, milk, sugar, sardines, lunch meats, butter for the business, ,

loans.name: Tamam

texts.en:
Tamam is a 55-year-old mother of one child.  She used to manage her business inside her house since 2006, but 15 days ago Tamam moved to a nearby shop where she opened her own grocery store.  She is working hard on improving it and supporting her financial life properly.

Tamam has a special relationship with her customers and works hard to keep it and improve it more and more.  She is applying for her sixth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to start a new business to increase and improve her income to make sure that she will have a stable financial situation especially that she is aging with no one to support her financially.  

She will start selling clothes and she hopes that the styles she is going to sell will attract customer's attention.  She is a good standing borrower with an excellent history of paying back her loans.  Her previous loans helped her a lot in increasing her business capital.   Tamam hopes to expand her business to a mini market.

loans.use: To start new business

loans.name: Fahed

texts.en:
Fahed is a 24-year-old married man.  He has worked as a butcher for the past eleven years and in February 2012 he opened his own butcher shop to increase his income and improve his standard of living.  Fahed is well known in his business with the good quality of meat he serves at affordable prices.

Fahed got married almost a year ago and he is expecting to be a father this month.  That's why he applied for a YOUTH LOAN from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to pay for his wife's delivery and special baby's preparations requested, in addition to increasing his business capital through increasing the quantity of meat to be sold on a daily basis to increase his family's income.

Fahed is very anxious to meet his baby, and he hopes to provide him the best childhood ever unlike his which forced him to work for his own living since he was only 13 years.  This is his third cycle as Al Majmoua is a borrower in good standing.  He will work hard on expanding his business as much as he can for a brighter future.

loans.use: to pay for his wife's delivery and special baby's preparations requested

loans.name: Husein

texts.en:
Husein is a 28-year-old married man and the father of three children.  He has been working in the aluminum business since he was 10 years old.  He didn't have a normal childhood living just like almost all of the Palestinian refugees in Lebanon.

Husein and his wife share their family's responsibilities.  She sells vegetables and fruits to make sure that they can afford their children's needs and requests and provide them with a normal living just like any normal child in this world.

Husein is applying for a YOUTH LOAN from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy the necessary aluminum for a requested project.  He will also use part of the loan to help his sister in a financial problem she is facing.  This is his first experience with Al Majmoua, and he hopes that his future requests will be invested in expanding his work place.

loans.use: To buy necessary Aluminum for a requested project

loans.name: Shiela

texts.en:
This is Shiela, 33, resident of Batasan, Philippines.  She is married to Jonathan and a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business.  At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Shiela operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood.  It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5 worth of cooking oil or an egg.  She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales everyday.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan.  She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.  She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Shiela hopes to expand her business and dreams of giving her children a good and quality education through all her hard work in her business.  She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Rindai Group

texts.en:
In 2009, 10 hard-working tribal women came together to form a group called “Rindai”. These Tribal women live in a small village at the outskirts of Bishnupur town in the state of Manipur located in the North Eastern part of India. Unemployment is a big problem in this part of the country. 

Pouphanliu is the member pictured with raised hand. She is happily married and is a mother to two sons and two daughters. She teaches kindergarten in a private school nearby where her husband is the school principal. All her children go to the same school where she teaches. Her salary, put together with her husband's, is not handsome enough to sustain the family especially when the children come of age and require a bigger amount for their education. Keeping this in mind she has been weaving from time to time to save even before accessing a loan. She also cultivated a homestead garden where she grows vegetables for consumption purposes.

With her first loan in 2009, she purchased weaving materials and employed two weavers to weave traditional garments such as mufflers, sling bags and wrap-around skirts. Samples of the traditional wrap-arounds, her finished products, can be seen in the photograph. She was able to repay her loan on time and increase her savings. She used the second loan for the same weaving activities and began employing the two weavers full-time. She supplied the finished garments to retailers from the main city, Imphal, for bigger profit and faster sale.

Now Pouphanliu needs another loan to increase her production by expanding her weaving shed so that she can hire one more weaver. She will buy tin sheets for the roof and do away with the thatch roof.

Pouphanliu plans to open a vocational school starting with weaving and incorporating other activities down the road. She also plans to introduce the handloom method of weaving. She is very happy that through her income activities at least two women are getting employed apart from the retailer. She has also kept her options open to quit her teaching profession once her children are old enough to go to school by themselves and focus on her vocational activities.

Likewise, the rest of the group members too needed another loan to continue with their respective activities. Potato cultivation, ginger plantation, spring onion plantation, rearing cows, farming vegetables such as mustard leaves and cabbage, and yam cultivation are activities that the group members undertake for income earning.

loans.use: To buy tin sheets to renovate her weaving shed so she can hire another weaver

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 35-year-old Lebanese man. He’s married, living with his wife and four children. The children are all attending school. He’s trying the best he can to enhance the family’s way of living. He has been working as a blacksmith for a few years and doing the best he can to improve and develop himself. 

As he wants to enlarge his business and grow in his occupation as well, Ali decided to take a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase added metal for his business. He wishes to take on bigger projects and offer his children whatever they ask for; that is the reason why he’s in real need to amplify his income in order to be able to make the needed savings and achieve his goals.

loans.use: to purchase added metal for his business

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 24-year-old Lebanese single man. He lives with his parents and three siblings at their modest house located in a beautiful Lebanese village. Mohammad spent the last three years working in electronics until he decided to open his own shop. But he’s not the only one covering the family expenses; his youngest brother and parent are also supplementing the family’s income.  

Mohammad always wanted to better develop his business and improve his work as well, but till now he has earned a barely fair income. For that reason he decided to take out a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to renovate his shop and change its interior decoration. He confirms that the loan will help him increase his sales thus his income by 15%. And as Mohammad wishes to increase his earnings, he also wishes to become an electronics wholesaler.

loans.use: to renovate his shop and change its interior decoration

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn lives peacefully with her husband in the village of San Pedro, Alicia. They are blessed with three children. To make a living, Marilyn grows rice and usually harvests twice a year. The harvest season usually falls during the months of April and November. The one-hectare plot of land she has been cultivating for almost 15 years was inherited from her parents. Marilyn goes down to the field early in the morning with her husband to ensure the proper growth of her rice seedlings. Last harvest season, she earned about 30,000 PHP. Marilyn is now asking for a loan of 50,000 PHP to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her farm. She wants to improve her farming practices to bring in a better yield. In the future, Marilyn hopes to improve her rice production and save enough money to provide a brighter future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her farm.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
This is Marilyn, 50, a resident of Batasan, Philippines. She is married to Cezar, an employee, and a mother to her children. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Marilyn maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products from popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, and Marikina Shoe Exchange. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. The dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue; this is how dealers make their money. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 2000 PHP in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 26,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy additional supplies and products like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Marilyn hopes to give a good future to her family with the help of God. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other items for her business.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 25-year-old engaged man from Lebanon. He is living with his parents and three siblings. One of them is working in addition to the father, their main income provider. They work very hard to be able to handle their heavy life expenses. 

Mohammad has been involved in the construction field for the past four years. He is specialized in completing stone work for outdoor buildings. He is well known in his town and has gained a fair number of clients so far. Today, he is requesting to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a car for his business. This will definitely allow him achieve his work competently and make him able to present good quality services to the clients.  He works on a freelance basis and hopes to take on bigger projects and increase his earnings in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase a car for his business

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a single man from Lebanon. He’s 19 years old, living with his parent and four siblings; two of them are working. Their father is the one covering family expenses from his retirement salary. His siblings also bring added income to the family. 

As for Ahmad, he has many years of experience in his recent job.  He’s a painter who works with high professionalism. He works on different projects and always tries to offer his customers the best results he can. He’s known for being punctual and well-organized. 

Today, he’s asking for a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to renew his painting tools and purchase added paint. He will be utilizing the loan to facilitate and carry on his work in a proper way. He’s is grateful for all the good things God has given him. In the near future, he looks to take on more projects, maybe outside the country if this will help him learn new designs and better develop his business.

loans.use: to renew his painting tools and purchase added paint

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 26-year-old Lebanese single woman. She lives with her parents and three working siblings. The whole family is facing bad circumstances and living in unpleasant financial conditions. This is why Zeinab started to sell clothes and opened her own shop in 2008. She offers a great variety of clothes at fair prices. 

This will be her third Kiva loan and she is very thankful for the results attained so far thanks to the previous loans. Today, she is requesting a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a new winter collection so that she can improve her business operations and follow up on the latest fashion. To better support her family, Zeinab wishes to open several branches as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a new winter collection

loans.name: Samir

texts.en:
Samir is a 47-year-old Lebanese married man, living with his wife and two children. He has owned a car spare parts shop since 1990 and has twenty-two years of experience working in the same occupation. He works very hard in collaboration with his wife to live a proper life. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a big quantity of car spare parts at good prices. He notes that these purchases will allow him to respond rapidly to his clients' demands. In the future, he plans to expand his business into other areas. He is optimistic about his business development and hopes that the coming years will bring positive growth.

loans.use: to purchase a big quantity of car spare parts at good prices

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is an adult married man. He’s 58 years old, Lebanese, living with his wife. He’s trying the best he can to enhance their way of living and offer his wife whatever she needs. From time to time, his wife’s support, even if it’s moral support, is considered very necessary, just to be able to stand his tough work tasks.

Hussein has been working as a taxi driver for many years. He works on a free-lance basis upon requests. And as he wishes to pay his car mechanics fees and perform the needed maintenance on it, he is asking today to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l.  This will facilitate his job and allow him transport his customers safely. In the near future, buying a new van will improve his life financially.

loans.use: to pay his car mechanics fees and perform the needed maintenance on it

loans.name: Arsenio

texts.en:
Arsenio is 57 years old. He is married and has three children. With his family's support and encouragement, he has been managing his farming business well. He plants and harvests rice for future selling to the traders in the village. He has been cultivating his one-hectare rice field for 15 years. Arsenio is not yet an expert in this kind of work and needs to improve his farming practices. He is now asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy pesticides and insecticides used in farming. According to him, rice farming depends upon the climate and on how to manage the rice field well. 

In the future, Arsenio aims to provide a better living for his family.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and insecticides used in farming.

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
This is Celia, 43, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Elmer, and a mother to her children. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Celia offers home service for hair rebonding. She doesn’t have her own salon, so her customers contact her for hair rebonding treatment. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 25,000 PHP in sales monthly.

To help her continue business operations, she is requesting an 18,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy products like hair color, blower, rebonding cream, cellophane and hair treatment products. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Celia dreams to be able to give her children a good and quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy hair color, blower, rebonding cream, cellophane, and hair treatment products for her business.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: The primary source of income for the village where Irene and her family resides is rice farming. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. She helps her husband manage the rice field. Irene hopes to improve their farming practices, which is why she is asking for a loan of 50,000 PHP. She will use this loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her rice seedlings. She is hoping that this loan will help increase crop production, and thereby increase her profits. Irene aims to provide a good education for her children. She hopes that someday they will improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her rice seedlings.

loans.name: Renia

texts.en:
This is Renia, 38, a resident of Batasan, Philippines. She is married to Alvin, her business partner. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to sustain their financial expenses.

Renia is a coconut vendor. She has a stall and customers can easily access her. Aside from the coconut itself, she also sells coconut milk. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 14,400 PHP per month.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy more coconuts for her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Renia hopes to give her children a good and quality education and dreams to expand her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more coconuts for her business.

loans.name: Lauriano

texts.en:
Lauriano's family lives in the peaceful village of San Pedro, Alicia. He is married and together they raise five children. The primary source of income from the village comes from planting and harvesting rice for future merchandise. Lauriano has been in this business for almost 20 years. Due to financial instability, he is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy rice seeds, fertilizers and insecticides used in farming. 

Lauriano hopes that with the help of this loan he can improve his farming practices and help increase crop production. With his hard work and determination, he hopes that someday he can also improve his family's living condition.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, fertilizers and insecticides used in farming.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell like can goods, snack foods, eggs, sugar, etc., for her general store business.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from buying and selling livestock.

Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like can goods, snack foods, eggs, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en: Marietta is 52 years old, married and has five children who need daily allowances. Marietta and her spouse inherited a hectare plot of land from her in-laws that they have been cultivating for almost 15 years. They plant and harvest rice to sell to traders. She wants to increase her crop production, but she has insufficient funds, so she is asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her farm. In the future, she would like to ensure good crops and provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her rice farm.

loans.name: Karim

texts.fr: Karim est âgé de 37 ans et est marié une marchande du nom de Bihounton. Le couple a six enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Karim n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Karim vit ensemble avec ses enfants et sa femme. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Il y a de cela dix sept ans que Karim exerce comme activité, l’agriculture. Karim exerce passionnément cette activité, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Karim s’approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue d’augmenter son fonds de roulement, Karim sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé, pour cultiver du maïs, de la tomate et du piment. Ce crédit lui servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de sa clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Karim is 37 years old and is married to a merchant named Bihounton. They have six children, all still under their care. Some of the children have been to school. Karim has not been to school. Karim lives together with his children and his wife. The couple takes care of the household expenses together. 

For the past ten years, Karim has been in the business of agriculture. He procures his supplies in an area of Benin. He does this job with passion, and this allows him to meet his and his children's needs. 

In the quest for customer satisfaction and to see his business funds increase, Karim is asking for a third loan from Alidé [so he can] cultivate corn, tomato, and peppers. This loan will help him better respond to the needs of his customers and to earn more profits. His previous loans have all been repaid.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs to grow corn, tomato, and peppers

loans.name: Barthélémy

texts.fr: Barthélémy est âgé de 65 ans et est marié à Clémentine. Le couple a sept enfants, dont certains scolarisés et cinq sont à leur charge. La famille vit ensemble. Barthélémy assure ensemble avec sa femme les diverses charges familiales. Barthélémy n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour subvenir à ses différents besoins, Barthélémy fait de l’agriculture depuis une vingtaine d’années. Barthélémy s’approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. En vue de renforcer davantage son activité afin de mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Barthélémy sollicite pour la cinquième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé, dans le but de cultiver du maïs, du gombo et du piment. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Barthélémy is 65 years old and is married to a woman named Clémentine. The couple has seven children, of whom some have been to school, and of whom five are still under their care. The family lives together. Barthélémy and his wife take care of the family's various expenses together. Barthélémy did not attend school.

To meet his different needs, Barthélémy has been farming for the past twenty or so years. He procures his supplies from an area in Benin. 

To further strengthen his business in order to better meet the needs of his customers, Barthélémy is asking for financial assistance from Alidé for the fifth time, with the goal of cultivating corn, okra, and some peppers. His previous loans have all been repaid.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs to grow corn, okra, and peppers

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a Lebanese married man. He’s 31 year old. He lives with his wife at their house that is located in one of the most beautiful villages of Lebanon. Both are managing their household. Hasan is working nonstop to provide his family with the needed income. 

He has been working in his own bakery for many years and he is well known for his good place and delicious food. He has loyal customers always asking for his delightful bread. 

Today he has the intention to borrow a loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l. to buy raw materials like flour, sugar, butter and renovate his bakery plus purchasing new tools as well. He needs to continue production and expand his product inventory. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business. 

In the near future, Hasan has more than few ideas to grow in his domain, and he thinks of taking more Kiva loans to achieve his goals, especially with the great result he has obtained from his first one.

loans.use: to renovate his bakery, purchase new tools and buy raw materials like flour, sugar and butter.

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en:
Fadi is a 46-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and only child. He is the main income source for his family. 

He has owned a shoe shop since 2008. He sells a wide variety of shoes from different trends. Due to his friendly personality, he is able to have many loyal customers always visiting his shop to buy their desired shoe style. He has also been able to hire a full-time employee, a sales woman who benefits from a fair salary that helps her support her family financially. 

Today, Fadi is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase different type of shoes in order to increase his business sales. He is certain that the loan will help him increase his profits by a large percentage and in the future he plans to expand his business into other areas.

loans.use: to purchase different type of shoes.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 41-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is living with his wife and three children, two of whom are still attending school. 

He owns multiple agricultural tractors by which he excavates the lands to prepare them for cultivation. He also owns a tractor used particularly for water distribution and delivery. He works very hard in order to provide good life conditions to his family. 

With his loan requested from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. he will get a new tractor. Hassan is very optimistic and intends to expand his business operations.

loans.use: to buy a new tractor.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
This is Rosario, 63, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is a widow and a mother. She manages her household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to provide income for her family's everyday expenses.  

Rosario operates a buy and sell business. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers and resell it with a little profit. Her products are men and women’s clothes and other similar products. Customers are attracted to buying due to the low prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy ready-to-wear products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. 

Rosario dreams of being able to expand her business and hopes to have good health. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stock of merchandise such as shirts, blankets, bed sheets, and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is married and has five children. She lives in Dolipos Alto, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Mila sells snacks to earn a living and has had this business for two years. She has requested a loan to purchase more raw ingredients for her snack vending business.

Mila  has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, she hopes to have more savings.

loans.use: to purchase more raw ingredients for her snack vending business

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en:
Ernesto is a small farmer in his local community. He is a very industrious worker who has been engaged in this business with his wife (Josephine) for 15 years. This is their main source of income and they support their family through the proceeds from their farm. 

Due to lack of finances, Ernesto is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy farm inputs needed on his farm, including two bags of seeds, a liter of insecticides, and fertilizers, as well as to pay for the labor of an additional worker who will sow and plow the farm. Through his sacrifices, patience, and hard work, Ernesto is confident that he will achieve progress and success.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs needed on his farm, including two bags of seeds, a liter of insecticide, and fertilizers, as well as to pay for the labor of an additional worker who will sow and plow the farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy animal feed for her pigs

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria says there aren’t many commercial janitorial businesses in her hometown of Fordoche, Louisiana, but among the few, her business, Pointe Coupee Janitorial, does a better job and works with the others in the event she cannot take care of a project.

With 32 years of experience, Gloria decided to re-enter the janitorial industry when her late husband became disabled and she needed flexible work hours in order to care for him.

The five-year-old business employs additional help when necessary, but Gloria prefers to work alone. She has the potential to expand her business, but chooses not to at the moment. “I want to make a living, I don’t want to make a killing,” she says. “I need this work to give me peace of mind.”

A returning client of Accion Texas Inc., Gloria plans to use her loan on buffers and commercial vacuums, as she can’t transport these materials between the six businesses she works with weekly. 

“I do enjoy cleaning,” she says. “I want my clients to know that.”

loans.use: to purchase buffers and vacuums.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Gumersida

texts.en:
Gumersida is from Kinuman Norte, Ozamis City. She is 54 years old. Gumersida is married and has 10 children. 

Gumersida plants and harvests corn for sale. She has been in her business for six years and earns 4,000 PHP a month. 

In 2010, Gumersida joined GDMPC. Now she is requesting a loan of 10,500 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizer. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is from Molicay, Ozamis City. She is 54 years old, married and has three children. 

To make a living, Rosalinda operates an eatery/carenderia business. Rosalinda has engaged in her business for eight years and earns 12,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2011, Rosalinda joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 17,500 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw materials to prepare new food products. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to prepare new food products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials needed in the vulcanizing shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for motorela maintenance.

loans.name: Rosabilita

texts.en:
Rosabilita is 49 years old, married, and has children.  She lives in Kinuman Norte, Ozamis City.  She runs a charcoal making business, which she has been doing for five years.  She earns about 3,500 PHP a month. 

Rosabilita is requesting a loan for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to pay the labor cost in charcoal making. She joined GDMPC in 2011. Rosabilita hopes to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to pay the labor cost in charcoal making.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more ready-to-wear clothes and slippers.l

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for resale.

loans.name: Camela

texts.en:
Camela is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental in the Philippines. She is 49 years old. Camela is married and has four children. To make a living, she makes and sells food. She's been in food vending for ten years and earns about 5,000 PHP per month for these activities. 

In 2007, Camela joined the Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative (GDMPC). She is requesting a new loan of 10,500 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make food products for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make food products for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Martha Elizabeth

texts.es:
Martha, tiene la necesidad de invertir en el negocio para variar la mercadería, comprando ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, en blusas, faldas, trajes, ropa interior, camisas, pantalones, con esto estará mejorando el negocio, ofertando más productos para los clientes.
Con el préstamo anterior considera que le ayudo a mejorar sus inventarios, logrando realizar ventas a muchos clientes, sus condiciones económicas han mejorado actualmente su situación familiar se mantiene estable.
texts.en:
Martha needs to invest in her business by buying clothing, such as blouses, skirts, suits, undergarments, shirts, and pants for women, men, and children, so that she can have a variety of merchandise to offer her customers.
